loans.name: Mema

texts.en: “Whatever talent you have is the gift from God” - That is Mema’s belief, mother of six and 45 years old. Mema’s business is sewing and she does it out of her own house at Malie. Most people come to her house and order whatever pattern and sizes they want. She is very good in sewing clothes especially Puletasi, aloha and kids wear.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, scissors and other supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Lemafoe

texts.en: Lemafoe is 47 years old and a mother of 5.  Her last loan used to restock her shop and now she is applying for another loan to buy inventory stuff for her shop and equipment for her 4 acre land not far from her house. She earns approximately $200-$300 per week.

loans.use: To buy gramoxone (a weed-killing chemical), knives, spades and other supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: Matilda has 3 children; two boys and a girl.  Matilda’s business is elei printing and she works six days of the week and earns $200.00-$300.00 fortnightly.   She uses the money for her children’s school fees and to support her family.

loans.use: To buy printing boards, paint and fabrics for her elei printing business

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania is a mother of three.  She is 50 years old and is from the village very far from town but married to a man from Faatoia.  Her business is selling BBQ twice a week to the people of the village.  She earns $150.00-$200.00 a week and uses that money for her family expenditures.  She is requesting a loan of $500 to buy supplies for her barbecue business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her barbecue business

loans.name: Mui

texts.en: Mui is 35 year old, married and a mother of six. Her business is selling vegetables everyday from her house. She takes the vegetables to the new market once a month and earns $150.00-$200.00 a week.

loans.use: To buy weed killing chemicals, knives, and other supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Lolelai

texts.en: Lolelai is 32 years of age, married and has six children. She joined this Program last year when she needed help for her business. She runs a lawn mowing business and is requesting a loan to buy petrol, oil and other supplies to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy petrol, oil, and other supplies for her lawn-mowing business

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en: Fetu, 22 is a young mother of two children.  She joined the Program last year when she needed help for her business.  She runs a canteen at the village’s primary school. She earns $100.00-$150.00 a week and uses that money to support her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies and stock for her canteen

loans.name: Solouta

texts.en: Solouta just joined the Program last week when she needed help for her business. She sells barbecued food all week to the village and to passerby's. She would like to supplement her income by starting another business if she earns enough money from her barbecue business.  She is requesting a loan to expand her barbecue business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her barbecue business

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana S., in her fifties is a mother of seven children.  She owns a B.B.Q. business which she operates in front of her house and works hard to support her family. Ana believes that she is able to continue operating her business because of the loan she got from S.P.B.D.  All of her seven children are attending school.  During weekends, her children help her out in cooking and selling. She earns $120 a week and she spends it on her family weekly needs and her loan payment.

loans.use: To buy boxes of mutton flaps, chicken legs, sausages, tomato sauce, plastic plates, foil wrap, and other supplies for her barbecue business

loans.name: Penina

texts.en: Penina S. is a hard-working woman of thirty four years of age. She has five children who are all attending school. She runs an Ice Cake business at home and sells cakes to the people of her village, especially the school kids. Penina sells her cakes every day of the week and she is able to earn more money than she expected. Her husband and the kids also help out in their business if and when they have free time. Penina really appreciates the help of  S.P.B.D for lending her the money that has allowed her to run her own business.

loans.use: To buy plastic bags, sugar and other supplies for her ice cake business

loans.name: Tiomai

texts.en: Tiomai F. is 47 years of age and has four children.  Along with her husband, they want a better future for their children.  They work hard on maintaining their vegetable garden so that they can sell its fruits in the market. According to Tiomai, S.P.B.D. arrived in her life at the right time, when she really needed the help financially. It is through the S.P.B.D loan that has allowed her to buy the materials she needed in order to run her business smoothly. Nowadays, she’s able to manage her family needs and also make her weekly loan payment.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds, cloves, crowbars, baskets,  and other supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta T. is a talented young woman of thirty three years of age. She has one child  who she supports with all her efforts. Using her sewing talent, she has set up her own tailor shop in town. Imeleta believes in her self and that she can earn enough money for her family. Her husband works full time as a policeman and she is so pleased to have his help whenever he is off duty. She relocated her business to town because of the growth in her customer base. She has a loyal following that includes her friends as well as the women of her community. She is very grateful for SPBD, whose loans have helped her realize her dream. Imeleta believes that repaying her loans will not be a problem and she will continue to take out more loans in the future in order to further develop her business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, needles, buttons, scissors, and other supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Lamosa

texts.en: Lamosa T. is a mother of seven kids. She is 54 years-old but still young at heart. All of her children have graduated, and four of them have jobs. The other three are helping out with their plantation business. They work from Monday to Thursday on maintaining the plantation and preventing theft. On Fridays and Saturdays, they take the taro crop to the market to sell it. Lamosa earns more than $200 a week, which covers her weekly loan payments as well as her family’s weekly needs. Lamosa really appreciates the help of S.P.B.D. for lending her the money to make her business possible.

loans.use: To buy weed-killing chemicals, knives, crowbars, a wheel barrow, and other supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Koleti

texts.en: Koreti P. is struggling for a better tomorrow for her eight children who are all in school. She works hard on her plantation, which is the main source of income for her family.  Her husband does the manual labour of maintaining their plantation.  She sells the taro crop at the new market in town. Koreti only visits the market twice a week, on Fridays and Saturdays. She earns a good profit from selling her products which she uses to meet her family weekly needs and also for her loan repayments. Koreti appreciates the help of S.P.B.D. for lending her the money to run her plantation smoothly.

loans.use: To buy, knives, cloves, weed sprayer, a wheel barrow, crowbars, and other supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Maua

texts.en: Maua T. is a 38-year-old mother of 4 kids and she is doing the best she can to help her children and the family. Maua has a plantation business, and she is glad to have the financial support from S.P.B.D. through the loans she gets. Her husband supports her in the difficult job of maintaining their plantation. Maua is looking forward to her next loan from S.P.B.D., which she plans to use to expand her plantation so that she can sell more taros, which will give her money for her loan repayments and family needs.

loans.use: To buy a wheel barrow, weed spray, and weed-killing chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Beatrice Lohi

texts.en:
Beatrice is a dynamic and ambitious 32 year old single mother. She lives with her 8 year old son in Yopougon, a populated suburb in the south of Abidjan. Béatrice, who did not get the chance to advance in her education, wants to give her son the opportunity to get as far as possible in his education.

Beatrice has her own business selling grilled meet. She has had the business for many years. She joined AE&I's microcredit program in early 2005 and has performed very well in the program. She is well organized and a very business oriented lady. She is requesting this loan to purchase cartons of pig meat to grill and sell.

loans.use: Beatrice will use the loan to purchase cartons of pig meat

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam N., age 56, is a sugarcane broker who earns up to $9.60 per day in revenue. She purchases the sugarcane from an individual’s plantation and resells it to a wholesaler at a market. Her husband raises cattle for a living. They have seven children. Two children work in Thailand and five of their children are students. In order to increase her inventory and expand her business, she would like to request a loan of $1000 to purchase sugarcane in larger quantities, reducing costs by buying in bulk and thus increasing profits. She plans to use the increased profits to take care of her family and finance her children’s education. She is pictured at home with her husband in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase additional sugarcane inventory.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Sam Neang has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng S., age 49, is a widow who works selling scarves at the market to make about $4.85 each day. She has three children, two of whom are married and have moved away from home, and one who works in construction making $50 per month. In order to expand her inventory to meet growing customer demand, she would like to request a loan of $700 to purchase her inventory in bulk and thus get better prices. She is pictured with her son in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase scarves to expand her business.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam S., age 42, grows and sells green beans at the market to earn $6.50 per day in revenue. Her husband, age 50, works selling ice cream, making about $6 per day in income. They have nine children. Three children are students, three work at a garment factory earning about $150 per month collectively, and three are married and live away from home. Mrs. Sam would like to borrow $700 to purchase ice cream ingredients for her husband's business and to buy fertilizer and seeds for her bean plantation.

loans.use: To purchase ice cream ingredients and agriculture supplies.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en: Mrs. Nim N., age 31, sells vegetables along the roadside, earning about $3 each day. Her husband is a construction foreman and earns about $5 each day. They have two children who are students and live at home. Mrs. Nim would like to request this loan of $800 to purchase construction tools to help expand her husband’s business and thus increase her family’s income to finance their children’s education. She is pictured with her husband and children in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Mrs. Khim N., age 56, grows and sells vegetables in the market, earning about $2 per day in income. Her husband works as a police officer, earning $1 per day. They have four children, three of whom are students and one who would like to be a moto-taxi driver so that he can earn $3 per day. Mrs. Khim would like to request a loan of $1100 to purchase a motorbike so that her son can start his own business and help finance his siblings’ education.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Diabagate

texts.en:
Diabagaté M. is a dynamic 31 year old woman. M. lives with her family in Treichville, a populated suburb in the south of Abidjan. She sells various crafted hand made pans and utensils in the Treichville Market. She has been selling her goods in the market for many years. M. orders and purchases the products in bulk from craftsmen in a neighboring city. These products resell well in the Abidjan region.

She joined AE&I's microcredit program in July 2004 when she was recommended by her mother, who was already in the program. M. has benefited from different loans and has performed very well so far. She will use this loan to purchase batches of pans from a blacksmith in Ayama (45 miles north of Abidjan).

loans.use: Diabagaté Mariam will use the loan to purchase batches of pans from a blacksmith

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mrs. Kim P., age 25, works at a garment factory, earning around $2 per day. Her one child is too young to attend school. In order to increase her family’s income and save for her child’s education, she would like to request a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike, so that her husband can start his own business and earn about $2 per day.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to start a moto-taxi business.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Kim Phala has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 36 years old. She lives in Yopougon, a populated suburb in the north of Abidjan. Chantal has 2 children and lives in cohabitation with a man who is a taxi driver.

Chantal sells onions, peanut paste and various aromatic products in the Yopougon-Selmer Market where she has a very good reputation. She has received several loans from AE&I and is a good performer. She always repays her loans on time. Chantal is requesting this loan to purchase goods and to pay education expenses. She will send her elder daughter to school next week. Also, she wants to expand her business by purchasing goods in bulk and acquiring a new Weighing Machine.

loans.use: Chantal will use the loan to purchase goods and pay education expenses.

loans.name: María Soledad

texts.es:
Maria is 36 years old. She is a woman that with all her effort and optimism in her daily agricultural tasks has been able to look after the needs of her young kid aged 10. Her husband abandoned them and took with him their second boy aged 7.

Since this shameful incident happened she has been farming with diligence her small piece of land. She puts in all the love and care she cannot offer to the son that was taken away from her. In spite of being overloaded with melancholy for not having him in her arms, she knows that she still have hopes to find him and that she now has to look after the well being of the child that accompanies her. This makes her forget the immense pain for a few moments.

The desire to find him promptly and shelter him in her home has pushed her to keep working and make an effort in each of her tasks with the objective of making enough profits to pay for all of the family needs and save enough to undertake the search and recovery of her son who she dearly needs.

This is the reason why she speaks to your heart and requests a loan for 350 USDs with which she will increase the harvest of her agricultural products.

Let us allow this diligent and loving mother be able to reunite briefly with her young boy who she loves and misses dearly.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


María tiene 36 años y es una mujer que a base de mucho esfuerzo y optimismo en sus labores agrícolas diarias ha podido velar por las necesidades de su pequeño hijo de diez años ya que su esposo la abandonó llevándose a su otro pequeño de tan solo siete añitos.Desde que ocurrió este penoso incidente ha cultivado con mucho más diligencia su pequeña parcela de tierra y le dedica todo el amor y cuidado que no puede ofrecerle al hijo que le arrebataron, a pesar de inundarle la melancolía por no tenerlo en sus brazos sabe que aún tiene esperanzas de encontrarlo y ahora tiene que velar por el bienestar del niño que lo acompaña y hace que por instantes olvide su inmenso dolor. El anhelo de ubicarlo pronto para cobijarlo en su hogar la impulsa a seguir trabajando y esforzándose en cada de sus ocupaciones con el objetivo de generar buenas ganancias para solventar las necesidades de su familia y ahorrar para emprender la búsqueda y recuperación del niño que tanta falta le hace.Es por ello que apela a vuestro corazón y solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares con el cuál incrementará la siembra de sus productos agrícolas. Hagamos que esta diligente y noble madre pueda reunirse en corto tiempo con su pequeño niño a quién ama y extraña mucho.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds to increase production

loans.name: Oger

texts.en:
Oger is a butcher in Marcory, which is south of Abidjan. He is 34 years old and has been running his butcher business for more than 8 years. He has a slaughterhouse and a butcher table where he resells meat in the market.

Oger wants to purchase some cows for the end of year period when the demand for protein and meat is very high for Christmas, New Year's, and AId el Kebir. He is therefore requesting a loan of $1,050.

Oger is dynamic and honest. He works very hard and he has been a very good performer in AE&I's microcredit program.

loans.use: Oger wants to purchase cows

loans.name: Aurora María

texts.es:
Aurora is a loving mother who works diligently every day in her small grocery store that she opened three years ago. Here she grows professionally and feels very happy. Thanks to her job, she has been able to appease the needs of her family and to be an important source of support for Crisoldo, her husband. Crisoldo makes a living by farming small plots of land. With the sacrifices they make together every day, they can satisfy the needs of their nine-year-old girl, who studies in the modest school in their small city. Therefore, the little money they can save goes towards being able to buy a small house to provide comfort and security for their little princess.

Today Aurora is requesting an amount of $500 to finish implementing her grocery store, with the aim of obtaining greater income to be able to increase their savings and bring the day when they can sleep in a house of their own nearer. Let's help Aurora have a small place to live and a home for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Aurora es una amorosa madre que diligentemente trabaja a diario en su pequeña bodega que aperturó hace ya 3 años y en la que se desempeña y siente muy feliz, debido a que gracias a su trabajo ha podido apaciguar las necesidades de su familia y ser un importante apoyo para Crisoldo, su esposo, quién se dedica a cultivar sus pequeñas parcelas de tierra. Con el sacrificio conjunto de todos los días pueden satisfacer las necesidades de su niña de nueve años de edad, que se encuentra estudiando en un modesto centro educativo de su pequeña ciudad. Por ello el poco dinero que pueden ahorrar está destinado para que en corto tiempo puedan adquirir una pequeña casita para brindarle seguridad y comodidad a su pequeña princesita.

Hoy Aurora solicita la suma de 500 dólares para implementar su bodega con el fin de obtener mayores ingresos para incrementar sus ahorros y hacer más cercano el día de poder dormir en un techo propio. Ayudemos ha Aurora a tener una pequeña morada y un hogar para su familia

loans.use: Implementation of a small grocery store

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Mrs. Ya M., age 46, is a widow who sells porridge for a living and earns $12.50 per day in revenue. She has seven children, two who work at the garment factory earning $100 per month each, two who are students, and three who are married. Mrs. Ya would like to borrow $800 to purchase a motorbike for one of her sons to operate a motor taxi business. She anticipates this will bring in another $2.50-$5 per day of income to help her family. She is pictured next to her son in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to start a motor taxi business.

loans.name: Marguerite Akissi

texts.en:
Marguerite T. sells various aromatic products and spices in her own store in the Marcory market in Abidjan. She has been running her business for more than 15 years. Marguerite is therefore a key contributor to her family's revenues.

Marguerite is 41 years old and married with 4 children. All of her children go to school. She joined the AE&I microcredit program in 2005 and has received several loans that she has repaid without any problem. She will use this loan to pay the school expenses for her children and to purchase goods for her business.

loans.use: Marguerite will use the loan to pay school expenses and to purchase goods for her business

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en:
Delphine T. is a 38 year old single mother. She lives with her children in Marcory, south of Abidjan. Delphine has sold agricultural products in the Marcory market for many years to earn a living for her family.

Delphine's daughter and son go to primary and secondary school. She has to pay all of their school expenses. She is therefore requesting a loan of $850. She has been in AE&I microcredit for a couple of years and has always performed very well, reimbursing her loans.

loans.use: Delphine Teya will use the loan to pay education expenses

loans.name: Juan De Mato

texts.es:
Juan is a gentleman who stands out for being one of the best neighbors in his area, and his kindness increased when he decided to install a telephone in his small home to offer its services to the families in his community. He and his family, composed of his wife and five children, are very happy because they have been able to alleviate the lack of communication that existed until now.

Never the less, some irresponsible people who belong to a gang of delinquents stole everything from him a short time ago and hurt his hopes of progressing. When this happened, he planned to leave everything and move, but the strength and support of his wife and children made him understand how important his work was and how necessary this service was for so many people.

This is why he decided to confront his adversaries one more time. He understands that it's better to protect his home even more to provide security for the people that visit him and his family with the objective of maintaining communication between this small town and the rest of the world.

Let's make it possible for this hard-working father to keep his and many other families united through his every day work.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Juan es un caballero que se caracteriza por ser uno de los mejores vecinos de la localidad y su simpatía se incrementó cuando decidió instalar en su pequeña morada un teléfono para ofrecer sus servicios a las familias de su comunidad. Él y su familia conformada por su esposa y cinco hijos están muy contentos porque han podido aliviar la falta de comunicación que existía hastya ahora.

Sin embargo las personas inconscientes que conformaron una banda de delincuentes le arrebataron todo hace poco tiempo y lastimaron sus deseos de progresar, cuando ocurrió este hecho pensó dejar todo y marcharse sin embargo la fortaleza y apoyo de su esposa e hijos le hicieron comprender lo importante de su labor y lo necesario que era este servicio para muchas personas.

Así que decidió hacerle frente a las adversidades una vez más y ha comprendido que lo mejor es proteger aún más su espacio para brindarle seguridad a las personas que lo visitan y a su amorosa familia con el objetivo de seguir manteniendo la comunicación desde este pequeño espacio hasta el resto del mundo.

Hagamos posible que este trabajador padre de familia mantenga unida a su familia y a muchas otras a través de su desempeño diario.

loans.use: To implement security sensors for the small call center

loans.name: Viviana Marcela

texts.es:
Viviana is a loving wife and mother of five children. She has learnt to give the best of herself in her daily tasks for her family´s well being. Despite a paralysis which affected her for fifteen days which left her inmovilized in bed, she is fighting back. Luck is seemingly not on her side though, as her husband has been diagnosed with a hernia which is incompatible with his work on the family plot of land. He is in a lot of pain which sometimes forces him to rest in bed for days at a time.

Viviana and her children have taken on agricultural tasks which her husband can´t do at this time. She has looked at the projected harvest and has decided to increase the surface planted to create more produce and obtain greater benefits, so her husband can have an operation to remedy his illness.

Let´s help this mother of five children purchase more seeds with the hope that she and her children can increase the harvest to help them get through this situation.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

Viviana es una amorosa esposa y madre de cinco hijos, aprendió a dar todo de sí en su diaria labor y a su familia lo mejor que tiene y puede dar a pesar de los duros momentos que tuvo que afrontar a raíz una parálisis que le afectó por más de quince días y la dejó postrada en cama sin poder movilizarse.Sin embargo para ella no termina esta pena con su recuperación; su esposo hace poco empezó a tener dolores muy fuertes y cuando acudió al nosocomio de su localidad le detectaron una hernia que no le permite realizar más sus labores agrícolas y hay momentos que el dolor se agudiza y lo conduce a la cama por largos días..Sin embargo observando estos hechos los hijos de Viviana decidieron aunarse a las labores que realiza su querida madre con el propósito de procurarle bienestar y menos preocupación a su enfermo padre, los apuros económicos por los que están atravesando no han disminuido sus esperanzas ni fuerzas para seguir soñando con un futuro mejor. Es por ello que luego de analizar su situación y realizar la proyección anual de su cosecha ha decido incrementar la siembra de sus productos con el objetivo de operar en corto tiempo a su querido compañero con las ganancias que obtenga de la comercialización de su siembra.Hagamos posible que esta madre incremente su siembra y las esperanzas de sus pequeños hijos que han decidido acompañarla durante esta larga travesía.

loans.use: Seed purchase to optimize the harvest

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is 36 years old and fights daily to help increase the family income so her children may have all that is necessary to have a good life. Her perseverance has given her family the assurance that she does everything possible to make their lives pleasant.

Thanks to the hard work she invests in agriculture, she was able to purchase a small plot of land that her husband is farming. Margarita also has a small vegetable garden in her house that her children help her with. However, the produce has decreased and the family expenses are using up the little capital they have. In turn, this has reduced the amount of money available for purchasing seeeds and fertilizers for the new plot of land they have invested in.

Margarita and her husband have decided to purchase potato seeds as this crop is needed by the community year round. The situation which Margarita finds herself in has made her ask for help, with the hope that she will find sensitive and caritative collaborators to help her get through these hard times.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita tiene 36 años de edad y lucha día a día por convertirse en un importante apoyo para su esposo con el optimismo de mejorar los ingresos de su hogar y mantener sin privaciones a sus hijos, su perseverancia hace que su familia mantenga entera confianza en ella y en su desempeño diario.Gracias al esmero que pone en su actividad agrícola pudo adquirir un terrenito en el que ahora labora su esposo y establecer una chacrita pequeña en su hogar en el que trabaja con el apoyo de sus hijos y ahora se han convertido en sus mejores socios.Sin embargo sus ingresos han disminuido notablemente y ya no solventan los gastos de su familia ni le permite comprar la misma cantidad de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes que hacen falta para hacer trabajar adecuadamente su nuevo terreno en el que ha decidido sembrar papa para mejorar su situación ya que este tubérculo es requerido todo el año por las familias de su localidad y el público en general.Este hecho por el que atraviesa la llevó a hacer pública su situación con la esperanza de encontrar a personas caritativas colaboradoras y sensibles a fin de que puedan dar respuesta a su petición en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Lou Marguerite

texts.en:
Marguerite Vanié is a dynamic hair dresser and beautician in Marcory (South of Abidjan) . She has her own beauty salon with 2 employees. Marguerite is 34 years old. She lives with her cohabitant and their two children.

Marguerite's beauty salon is the only one operating in the area in which it is located. The salon is successful and Marguerite wants to upgrade the equipment in order to improve the service quality to her clients. Therefore, she is requesting this $1,200 loan.

Marguerite has been in AE&I's microcredit program since October 2005. She has performed very well since then. She is well organized and ambitious.

loans.use: Marguerite Vanié will use the loan to purchase hair salon equipment.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos is a 21-year-old youth, and at his young age, he is the owner of a bakery. He learned this trade from his beloved and selfless father, from whom he also inherited the virtues of hard work and dedication. Currently, Carlos lives with his parents in a rented house, where he also set up his bakery. The desire that this enterprising young man has is to be able to have a larger bakery and to put it in a more strategic place. This is why he works tirelessly every day, starting very early.

Carlos is willing to put forth the effort every day to make his business stronger with the goal of providing his elderly parents with a better quality of life and to be able to make his dream a reality. Carlos is requesting a loan of $400.

Let's help this prosperous, enterprising young man set up a larger bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos es un joven de 21 años y a su corta edad ya es propietario de una panadería, gracias a que este oficio lo aprendió de su querido y abnegado padre, de quién también heredó las virtudes de trabajo y dedicación.En la actualidad vive junto a sus padres en una casa alquilada lugar en el que también montó su panadería y el anhelo que posee este joven emprendedor es llegar a tener una panificadora más grande y ubicarla en un lugar más estratégico, para ello trabaja incansablemente todos los días desde muy temprano. Carlos está dispuesto a esforzarse día a día y a fortalecer más su negocio con el fin de ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus ancianos padres y para hacer realidad su sueño este joven entusiasta esta solicitando un préstamo 400 dólares. Apoyemos a poder montar una panadería más grande a este joven próspero empresario.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material to increase his production

loans.name: Luzmila Katerine

texts.es:
Luzmila is an enthusiastic and hard-working young woman who for more than 10 years has been selling articles of clothing that she brings from the city of Lima. She sells them in the markets of the little towns bordering the city where she lives, Juliaca. She lives in a rented room that she shares with her beloved mother Rosa and her younger brother. Luzmila wants to grow her business until it is an excellent distributor for articles of clothing. In this way she will generate a bigger income to help her mother with the expenses generated by the construction of the house she wishes for. To make these dreams reality, this beautiful young woman appeals for your unselfish help and asks for a loan of $350 which will allow her to grow her business and make her dreams of having her own house reality. Let’s help her achieve her dream soon.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Luzmila es una joven entusiasta y trabajadora, que desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir que trae de la ciudad de Lima para ofrecerlos en las ferias de los diferentes pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad en la que radica, Juliaca, en un cuarto alquilado que lo comparte junto a su querida madre Rosa y su hermano menor. El deseo que tiene es acrecentar su negocio hasta llegar a convertirse en una excelente distribuidora de prendas de vestir, generando así un mayor ingreso económico para ayudar a su madre en los gastos que genera la construcción de su anhelada vivienda.Para hacer realidad sus deseos esta bella joven recurre a tu ayuda desinteresada y solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares que le permitirá crecer con su negocio y hacer realidad sus sueños de tener su propia casita. Ayudémosla a cumplir su sueño en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Buy more articles in order to consolidate her small store space.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio is a responsible father and husband who, day to day, makes a great effort in order to give the best to his son and to his wife María. They are currently living in a rented room but, with great effort and sacrifice, they are already building their own small house.

Julio is presently dedicated to the elaboration and ambulatory sales of specialty breads, such as yolk, milk and cheese breads. He works from 9:00 am to 7:30 pm.

Additionally, he works at social events during his free time, a business that is generating a good income and for which he intends to prepare and put a greater effort, in order for the contracts to keep increasing.

Julio dreams about having his own social events agency and he is aware that, in order to accomplish this, he needs to make a greater effort. For the time being, he wishes to increase his bread production, in order to save enough to reach his goals. For this purpose he turns to you, requesting a $275 loan, which he’ll invest in his business, and promises to repay in six months. Julio and his family place all their hopes in your generous heart. Let’s support them!

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Julio es un padre y esposo responsable, que se esfuerza día a día para brindarles lo mejor a su hijo y a su esposa María. Por el momento viven en una habitación alquilada pero, a base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, ya están construyendo su pequeña morada.

Julio actualmente está dedicado a la preparación y venta ambulatoria de panes especiales, tales como el pan de yema, leche, queso, trabajo que empieza a las 9:00 de la mañana y concluye a las 7:30 de la noche.

Adicionalmente a esta labor, en sus horas libres se dedica a atender eventos sociales, negocio que le esta generando buenos ingresos económicos y para el que pretende prepararse y esforzarse aun más para que los contratos sigan incrementándose.

Julio sueña con tener su propia promotora de eventos sociales, siendo consciente de que para lograrlo tiene que esforzarse mucho más. Por el momento desea aumentar la producción de sus panes, con el ánimo de ahorrar lo suficiente para cumplir sus objetivos; para ello recurre a ti, solicitando un préstamo de 275 dólares, que invertirá en su negocio y promete hacer la devolución del préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses. Julio y su familia ponen todas sus esperanzas en tu generoso corazón; apoyémoslos!

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for the elaboration of specialty breads.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his supplies

loans.name: Tuhtajon

texts.ru:
Tuhtajon was among the first MicroInvest clients/borrowers in Spitamen. Since then for the last 5 years she has been one of the best clients for MicroInvest in the region. It was her example that helped many others gain trust in the loan program and to become clients themselves.

Tuhtajon is 55 years old, married and has 4 children. All her children now have families of their own. Her husband also works and helps her out in the stall on weekends. Loans play a big part in Tuhtajon’s business, allowing her to buy her inventory wholesale. The profit she makes significantly helps the family budget and Tuhtajon considers it her duty to help her husband support the family. The extra money also allows her buy sweet treats for her grandchildren when they come to visit their grandmother.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Тухтажон одна из первых клиентов Микроинвест в Спитамене. С тех пор в течении 5 лет она является одной из лучших клиентов Микроинвест в этом регионе. Следуя ее примеру многие предприниматели поверили в займы и стали активными клиентами. В бизнесе Тухтажон займы играют немаловажную роль. Она имеет возможность закупить товар оптом. Тухтажон 55 лет, она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Все дети имеют свои семьи, а ее муж тоже работает. По выходным дням он выходит помогать торговать. Прибыль от бизнеса вносит весомую лепту в семейный бюджет Тухтажон. Она считает, что этим должна помогать мужу содержать семью. Кроме этого она имеет возможность покупать сладости своим внукам, когда они приходят навещать бабушку.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Izzatoi

texts.ru:
Izzatoi Halikova has a very big family. It numbers 8 people, 6 of whom are children. Naturally in order to feed everyone one needs to have a good income. Since good jobs are hard to come by, Izzatoi decided to go into retail trade. She sells an assortment of small items at a market stall. Her husband works loading and unloading freight in the same market. Her eldest son does various odd jobs. Her two elder daughters help her out in the market stall. The profits from the business help sustain the family budget. She plans to use the new loan to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

У Иззатой очень большая семья. Она насчитывает 8 человек, из них 6 детей. Чтобы прокормить такое количество нужен хороший заработок. Так как приличной работы не найти, Иззатой решила торговать. Ее муж работает грузчиком здесь же на рынке, а старший сын работает на частных работах. На базаре помогают две старшие дочери. Ассортимент товаров включает в себя разную мелочевку. Прибыль от бизнеса помогает Иззатой поддержать семейный бюджет. Новый займ она собирается употребить на дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru:
Morodjon is a music teacher. He teaches children to play the traditional tadjik instrument the rubob. He works in 3 schools simultaneously. In addition to that him and his two sons sells men's clothing and shoes at the main market in Spitamen. This year Murodjon has turned 50 years old. He is married and has 5 children. His elder son is in Russia earning money. He has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004. He plans to continue working with MicroInvest and borrowing more money.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

loans.use: To increase business size

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru:
Mairam is the lucky mother of three children. The elder child is helping Mairam at the market. Her husband is a police officer. Mairam is 35 years old. She has been working on developing her business for the past 5 years. She children's clothing and shoes. She started with a relatively small startup capital and gradually over the time was able to come to a point where he business is bringing a good profit. The loans from MicroInvest have played a significant role in the development of Mairam's business. She has been a client of MicroInvest for the past 5 years.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Майрам счастливая мать троих сыновей. Старший из них уже выходит на базар и помогает матери. Ее муж работает в милиции. Майрам 35 лет. Последние 5 лет она постоянно занимается бизнесом. Ассортимент товаров включает в себя детские одежда и обувь. Начинала свою деятельность с маленького оборотного капитала, постепенно расширяясь достигла уровня когда она стала получать хорошую прибыль. Немаловажную роль при этом играют, получаемые ею займы Микроинвест, ведь она является его клиентом уже в течении последних пяти лет.

loans.use: To increase product selection

loans.name: Uguljon

texts.ru:
In the past, Uguljon would come out to the market and help her sister sell goods on the market. Over time she decided to start her own business. Her husband provided her with the startup capital. She has also obtained a loan from MicroInvest. Since then, her business has gotten significantly larger. Uguljon is 45 and married. Both her husband and her elder son work. Her younger son and her daughter help her with the business. She purchases a portion of her goods from wholesalers at the market where she works. She also purchases goods in the city of Hudjan, located 35 kilometers away from where she lives and works. She plans to continue increasing the size of her business, which is the reason why she is seeking to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Раньше Угулжон выходила на базар помогать своей сестре торговать. Постепенно она решила самостоятельно заняться бизнесом. Для этого ее муж дал денег для начального капитала. Еще она получила займ в Микроинвест. С того времени ее бизнес заметно расширился. Угулчон 45 лет, она замужем. Ее муж и старший сын работают, младший сын и дочь помогают матери на базаре. Товар она покупает у оптовых продавцов здесь же на базаре и еще ездит за товаром в г. Худжанд который находится в 35 км. Она собирается и дальше расширять свой бизнес и хочет получить для этого новый займ.

loans.use: Increase the size of the business

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru:
Gulbahor is 32 years old, married and has 4 children. Together with her husband she sell fruits and vegetables wholesale. This business is the main source of income for the family. Produce is purchased at the border with Uzbekistan and later resold in the local markets. After getting her loan from MicroInvest, Gulbahor was able to significantly increase her turnover capital. She is planing to invest the money from her new loan into purchasing potatoes and onions.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Гульбахор 32 года, она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Вместе с мужем она занимается оптовой реализацией овощей и фруктов. Это основной семейный доход. Товар приобретают на границе с Узбекистаном и потом реализуют по окрестным рынкам. Получив в начале года займ в Микроинвест, Гульбахор значительно расширила свой оборотный капитал. Новый займ собирается потратить на закупку осенней картошки и лука.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes and onions

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Mavluda is 50 years old, is married and has 5 children. Mavluda, her husband and daughter work together in the market. Before Mavluda received her first loan 2 years ago she had a small selection of fabrics. Since then Mavluda has been able to expand her inventory and now she sells many different types of fabrics, including more expensive fabrics. Recently Mavluda rented a small shop in the local market. She wants to use her new loan to purchase additional fabrics for her shop.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Мавлуде 50 лет, она замужем и у нее 5 детей. На рынок выходят торговать она сама, а также ее муж и старшая дочь. 2 года назад когда она получила свой первый займ ассортимент ее товаров включал в себя всего несколько видов тканей. С тех пор она значительно расширилась и сейчас продает также ткани более дорогие по цене. Недавно она арендовала небольшой магазинчик на местном рынке. Новый займ она хочет получить на приобретение тканей для этого магазинчика.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Boost her business

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred K. is 50 years old and owns the guest house, Mambo Kwisha. The day I visited, Fred was ill but his daughter Ruth and her baby greeted me. There are 6 rooms at the guest house and there is a covered area for guests to visit. Mr. K. also offers the use of his grounds to the lending group for their weekly meetings. He has 10 children and has taken care of as many as 6 dependents. He has been in business for three years and has been receiving loans for one and a half years. He has had no problem in making his payments.
He would like to offer soft drinks and some snack foods for his guests with his loan and he intends on doing some remodeling of his meeting area.

loans.use: Fred plans to use his loan to add beverages and snacks and to improve his meeting areas

loans.name: Tulganoi

texts.ru:
Even though Tulganoi is 57 years old, she sells her wares in the local market. It is the main source of income for her family. She has 4 children. Two of her children help Tulganoi with her business. The assortment of the products she sells include all necessary items for a home as well as children’s toys and gift sets. Her oldest son (in the picture above) travels to buy her inventory while Tulganoi and her daughter sell them in the market. A year ago Tulganoi received a loan from MicroInvest. Since then she has been an active client of MicroInvest. She wants a new loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Несмотря на свои 57 лет Тулганой выходит на базар торговать. Торговля составляет основной источник дохода семьи. У нее 4 детей. Двое из них выходят помогать матери. Ассортимент ее товаров включает все необходимое для дома, а также детские игрушки и подарочные наборы. За товаром ездит ее старший сын (на фото), а Тулганой и ее дочь торгуют на рынке. Год назад она получила займ в Микроинвест и с тех пор постоянно сотрудничает. Новый займ пойдет на дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 42 years old, married and has 6 children. She and her husband own a matatoo, a van for transporting up to 14 persons. They also have a small 6 room rental unit attached to their house which they built themselves using previous loans. Janet is the treasury of her lending group and on the day we visited, she hosted as we went from business to business. She is a delightful person with an easy smile and a love for her community.
With her loan she hopes to buy some new tires and to do some much needed maintenance on their matatoo.

loans.use: Janet plans to use her loan to buy new tires and to do much needed Maintenance on their matatoo, taxi.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
Bahtiyor makes “non” – Tajik national bread. His whole family is involved with his business. Bahtiyor is 46 years old. He is married and has 3 children. He has been in business for many years and inherited his profession from his father. Early every morning Bahtiyor starts rolling dough and by 7am one can buy freshly made hot bread. Several small retailers buy fresh bread wholesale from Bahtiyor and sell it in retail at the same market. There are other buyers who come from far away to buy his bread. Bahtiyor has been doing business with MicroInvest for past 2 years and the loans he received helped him to expand his business. He is planning to use new loan to buy flour wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Бахтиер занимается выпечкой лепешек – национального таджикского хлеба. В этом бизнесе занята вся его семья. Бахтиеру 46 лет, он женат и имеет 3 детей. В этом бизнесе он уже много лет и эту профессию он унаследовал от своего отца. Ранним утром он начинает раскатывать тесто и к 7 часам утра уже можно купить готовые горячие лепешки. Розничные продавцы покупают у него оптом и продают здесь же на рынке в розницу. Также у него много покупателей которые приезжают издалека за лепешками. В Микроинвест он кредитуется в течении 2-х лет и займы помогли ему в расширении его бизнеса. На новый займ он собирается закупить оптом муку.

loans.use: Bye flour wholesale

loans.name: Najmiddin

texts.ru:
Najmiddin’s business runs smoothly – he sells household goods at the central market in Kanibadam. Najmiddin is 25 years old and got married recently. His parents and his younger brother help him with his business. 6 months ago Najmiddin received a loan from MicroInvest and rented another shop where his brother sells goods. Najmiddin travels to buy goods. In his newly open shop Najmiddin added new types of goods: gift sets. They are very popular items and bring good profit. Currently, he is planning to add to his assortment kitchenware and is requesting a new loan.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

У Начмиддина хорошо поставленный бизнес – он продает хозяйственные товары на центральном рынке г. Канибадама. Начмиддину 25 лет и недавно он женился. В его бизнесе ему помогают отец с матерью, а также его младший брат. Получив полгода назад займ в Микроинвест он арендовал еще один магазинчик где торгует его брат. За товаром ездит сам Начмиддин. В новом магазинчике он внедрил новые виды товаров – подарочные наборы. Все это пользуется спросом, и прибыль остается хорошая. Сейчас он собирается добавить в ассортимент штучную посуду и поэтому хочет получить новый займ.

loans.use: To purchase kitchenware.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, dressed in a beautiful busuuti dress, is standing in front of her restaurants kitchen. The one thing you can’t sense is the aromas coming from those pots.  Betty knows how to cook. She has been in the restaurant business for 20 years. She makes typical Ugandan food: matooke: fried or boiled plantains (unripened bananas); cassava: steamed or fried tubers; sweet potatoes, yams, Irish potatoes, rice, posho: maize flour, and luwombo, a local dish usually chicken steamed in banana leaves and g-nuts.
Betty is a leader in her lending group. She took us to all the businesses and as you can tell from her smile she is quite pleasant. She’s a petite dynamo.
With her loan, she plans to buy cooking oil, flour and other food stuffs. She also wants to have someone rebuild one wall of her restaurant.

loans.use: Betty plans to use her loan to buy cooking oil, flour, salt and other foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Basilio

texts.pt:
Basilio lives with his 2 children and their mother. Both of his sons are in school. His girlfriend is now working in a factory. Basilio plans to use this loan to buy kitchen appliances for his home. He works at a private company as a driver.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Basilio e solteiro mas vive com uma mulher com quem tem 2 filhos. Os filhos de Basilio estudam. A sua esposa so agora e que arranjou um emprego, pois que a fabrica onde ela trabalhava como serralheira fechou. basilio quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de electrodomesticos para a sua casa. Pois que so com o salario nao consegue comprar. Ele e motorista numa Empresa Privada.

loans.use: Buy home appliances

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 28, married with 2 children and she takes care of 4 other children. For the past four years she has operated a retail store. Right now her inventory is sparse but she hopes to use a new loan to restock her inventory. She sells fresh baked goods and soft drinks. She is reserved but hopeful. She recently lost several of her front teeth and she is hopeful to get to the dentist and have them replaced. She is a lovely soft spoken person who has a kind heart.

For the past year she has been receiving loans and has been able to repay without any problem. When asked what is her dream for the future she cautiously smiles and says that she has a small plot of land and would like to one day build her home on it. With her kind spirit, I’m sure she shall achieve her dream.

loans.use: Agnes plans to use her loan to restock her inventory of fresh baked goods and beverages

loans.name: Aiubjon

texts.ru:
Aiubjon and his wife sell household goods. They have been in business for a long time and are quite successful entrepreneurs. Recently, they rented a small shop where they are currently located. Aiubjob is 45 years old and he has two children. He received his first loan from MicroInvest in order to bring in a wider range of products and it improved his turnover. Currently, he wants a new loan to further expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers

Аюбчон и его жена продают хозяйственные товары. Занимаются они этим недавно и уже являются успешными предпринимателями. Недавно они арендовали маленький магазинчик где и ведут свой бизнес. Аюбчону 45 лет, у него 2 детей. Чтобы приобрести больше товара он получил займ в Микроинвест. Это заметно отразилось на его бизнесе в лучшую сторону. Сейчас он хочет получить новый займ для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Nenden

texts.en: Nenden is 20 years old and is a widow with one child. To support her family, Nenden sells food, soft drinks, and other goods in her kiosk. She has been an active member of Yamida for one year. She earns $20 per day from her business. Nenden needs to borrow $120 to expand her business. She will repay the loan within a 12 month period.

loans.use:
$50 to buy more food, $50 to buy more goods,
$25 to buy more drink products

loans.name: Enoque Julio

texts.pt:
Enoque lives with his girlfriend and two small children who are not yet in school. He plans on using this loan to buy products for his beauty salon. With the income from the business he plans on expanding the salon to attract more customers and increase his income. He also plans on improving his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Enoque vive maritalmente com uma mulher com quem tem 2 filhos ainda pequenos. Os filhos de Enoque ainda nao vao a escola. Ele quer usar o dinheiro para a compra de produtos para o seu salao de Beleza. Ele trabalha com a sua esposa no salao. Com os lucros pensam ampliar o salao para poderem receber um maior numero de clientes.Depois da ampliacao do salao , pensam tambem iniciar a construcao de sua residencia, pois que de momento vivem numa casa de pau a pique.

loans.use: Buy beauty products for the salon

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en:
Scolastica is married has 6 children and takes care of 3 dependents. She has run the retail store in this picture for the last 5 years. The store has a lot of character and charm. There is a comfortable bench in front that allows people to gather and visit. It is very inviting. I don’t know what it is about this place, but it just draws you in. It’s on a busy, large pathway in her village. Out front she sells local food, bananas, tomatoes, onions and avocados. Inside she sells eggs. Lots and lots of eggs. Floor to ceiling, wall to wall, eggs. I asked her if she had layers. She said no, but everyone in the village that needs eggs comes to her.

With her loan, she hopes to restock her store with rice, salt, sugar and of course, eggs. Her dream is to one day own her own home.

loans.use: Scolastica plans to user her loan to buy rice, salt, sugar and eggs for her retail market

loans.name: Idoh

texts.en: Idoh is 35 years old and married. Her business is cooked foods, and she has been working on her business for one year. She sells her goods by going around the village on foot. From her business, Idoh earns $2 per day. Her husband is a farmer who earns $7.50 per day. Idoh needs to borrow $50 to expand her business. She will pay  within a 12-month period.

loans.use: $50 will be used to buy food materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael K. is 50 years of age. She has a family of three children — one boy and two girls all going to school — as well as four dependants. Rachael sells hardware products like varnish, plywood, glue, drawer locks, nails, paint and much more. Her business is strategically stationed in the city suburbs where carpentry workshops are located. This is a ready market for the goods in her small hardware shop — mainly varnish, wood glue, nails and other things. In the small earning she collects, she manages to meet her necessities: mainly food, clothing and rent for her workplace and others. She wishes to borrow $900 for capital for expanding the business to meet the clients' demands, and at the same time fulfill her future plan of saving tuition fees for her college students.

loans.use: Purchase of stock — paint ,wood glue/varnish, plywood, nails, drawers/doors, locks and many other things

loans.name: Mumbeja

texts.en:
Mumbeja is a 52 year old widowed mother of 7 children and with her big heart she cares for 15 other children. In a gated, railed corral, she sells charcoal. She is known by everyone, for everyone uses charcoal for cooking. She has been in business for 13 years. The bags that she is standing next  to are 100kg each. Customers come in with half gallon plastic containers, which she then fills and sells.

With her loan she hopes to buy more charcoal and her dream is to expand her business for her children.

loans.use: Mumbeja plans to use her loan to buy more bags of Charcoal

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru:
Mukaddas has a big multi-specialty sales business. She sells food products; owns a small store, which is managed by her niece; she also sells and delivers furniture from Tashkent, Uzbekistan. In addition, Mukaddas sells watermelons and honeydews. Her businesses bring good steady profit. Since receiving her first MicroInvest loan 3 years ago, Mukaddas noticeably expanded her business. She plans to invest this loan into store expansion.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

У Мукаддас большой бизнес включающий в себя различные направления. Она продает продукты питания, держит маленький магазинчик, где торгует ее племянница, а также привозит мебель с Ташкента, Узбекистан. Также она продает арбузы и дыни. Все это приносит хорошую прибыль. Получив 3 года назад первый займ в Микроинвест Мукаддас с тех пор заметно расширила свой бизнес. С получением нового займа она собирается вложить его в свой магазин.

loans.use: Store expansion

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace K. is married with a family of three children — all girls, aged nine, seven and three years. Peace is selling timber and has four years of experience. She started the  business as a result of insufficient funds raised by her husband, who is a driver. Timber selling has been a challenge to many due to the marketing; nevertheless, Peace has marketing skills. Peace at the moment has potential clients who buy timber for construction and many other uses. She would like to borrow $1,100 to stock more timber that will help meet the demands of clients and at the same time help expand her business through savings.

loans.use: Purchase of timber stock

loans.name: Faribah

texts.en:
Faribah is 35, married with four children and  she cares for four others. She has been in business for 5 years. Currently she has about 20 regular clients. Outside she washes the clothes and hangs them to dry. Then with an iron heated by a charcoal fueled stove, she irons each shirt and pant. I peaked inside and her home is filled with freshly ironed shirts from wall to wall.

With her loan she plans to buy detergent and pay school fees. She dreams of one day owning her own home.

loans.use: Faribah plans to user her loan to buy more detergent and pay school fees

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru:
Gulnoza, 32, is married and has one child. Gulnoza and her husband sell soft drinks on the central market of Spitamen. They have been in business for several years. They purchase the goods at the wholesale markets of Khudzhand and Istaravshan. This is the only source of income that Gulnoza and her husband have. The plan to use this loan to purchase soft drinks.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гулноза и ее муж занимаются продажей прохладительных напитков на центральном рынке Спитамена. Этой деятельностью они занимаются уже несколько лет. Товар привозят с оптовых рынков Худжанда и Истаравшана. Другого заработка для содержания семьи у них нету. Гулнозе 32 года и у нее 1 ребенок. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ для закупки новой партии напитков.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a 47 year old married mother of 6 children and 6 dependents. She and her husband have a fried food business that they deliver by bike to local restaurants and stands. When I was there they were busy frying and packing the fried vegetables. The food is the size of finger food. Two bite stuff. They fill wood boxes 2’ x 2’ x 2’.
They plan to use their loan for buying wheat, onions, cooking oil. In time, they dream of enclosing the area that they use for cooking and to make it their home.

loans.use: Madina plans to use her loan to buy more wheat, onions and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar mas productos y ampliar su negocio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar mas mercaderia

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Business Description

Miguel sells dairy products. He started this business 20 years ago thanks to the help of his father, who also worked in the same profession. The business has grown now that his main customers are the large shops in the area. Miguel works as a travelling salesman, always dedicated to his job selling milk, cheese, eggs and dairy snacks.

Use of the Loan

He would like to use the loan to buy a three wheel cart for his business, as well as more merchandise as his customers have recently been asking for new products.

Personal Information

Miguel is 45 years old and has 4 children, the oldest help him with the business. They live together in a home made of cement. His goal is grow his business so that one day he can increase his family's income and have a much better financial situation.

Descripción del Negocio

El Señor A. se dedica ala venta de productos lácteos, el inicio este negocio hace 20 años gracias a la ayuda de su padre el cual se dedicaba también a esta misma labor, su negocio a crecido ya que sus mayores consumidores son las tiendas del sector, pues don Miguel es un comerciante ambulante que siempre esta dedicado a su labor con mucho empeño, vende queso, leche, huevos y embutidos.

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere usar parte de su crédito para comprar un triciclo y la otra parte en mercadería ya que últimamente sus clientes han realizado nuevos pedidos de nuevos productos. /p>

Información Personal

Tiene 45 años y cuatro hijos, su vivienda es de cemento y en el negocio le ayuda una de sus hijas mayores, su meta es crecer su negocio para un día poder mejorar sus ingresos familiares y de esta manera poder tener una vida económica mucho mejor.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy a three wheel cycle for his business selling dairy products

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night is 35, widowed with 6 children and four dependents. She has a soda distribution business which she has operated for the past 5 years. One store front is for wholesale and the other store front is for retail. She sells soda in crates to other retailers who then resell individual bottles.

With her loan she plans to buy more beverages and start restocking. Currently her inventory is in need of replenishing. She dreams of buying a small plot of land and building her own home.

loans.use: Night plans to use her loan to buy more beverages for her wholesale business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To be able to purchase better quality products for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase goods/inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to help grow his small business selling grilled pork and pork products

loans.name: Isabel Alfredo

texts.pt:
Isabel Alfredo C. joined the Fund program in February 2003. She is 45 years old, and lives with her husband and 5 children. They live in a camping sire in Corumana in the district of Moamba in Maputo. She has a stand and fishing boats. She has been investing loans on kitchen appliances. Isabel is happy with the program and says it has made her life better..

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Isabel Alfredo C. é cliente do FDM desde Fevereiro de 2003. Tem 45 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de 5 filhos. Vive no acampamento da barragem de Corumana no dostrito da Moamba em Maputo.Tem uma barraca e barcos de pesca .O valor dos empréstimos tem aplicado no negócio e na compra de electrodomésticos. Diz estar satisfeita com o programa uma vez que os empréstimos a ajudaram a mudar muita coisa na sua vida.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Description of Business

Domingo has a government warehouse in the commercial area called flor de Bastion. He began his business 4 years ago when he changed work. His wife also has a small store in their house.

Use of loan

He needs the loan to be able to make repairs in his house and buy more merchandise

Personal Information

Domingo is 42 years old and has 2 children who attend school. They live in a house made of cement, and his goal is to be able to finish with the construction of his home.

Descripción del Negocio

el Sr. Domingo tiene una tercena en un sector comercial de la flor de Bastion, empezo hace 4 años cuando cambio de trabajo su esposa ademas siene una pequeña tienda en sus domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el credito para hacer adecuaciones en su casa y comprar mas mercaderia.

Información Personal

El tiene 42 años 2 hijos que estudian su casa es de cemento su meta es terminar de construir su casa.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy different types of meat for his business.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Saodat’s husband is in Russia working as seasonal laborer. In the past, he helped Saodat to sell, but once the business stabilized, Saodat’s husband went to Russia. Saodat sells food products, which she buys wholesale on the same market. Before taking her first MicroInvest loan, Saodat’s sales volume was relatively low. The loan helped Saodat to expand her business. This loan she plans to use to continue the expansion.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муж Саодат находится на заработках в России. Раньше он помогал жене в ее торговле, когда бизнес наладился, решил уехать на заработки. Теперь Саодат сама занимается бизнесом. Она продает продукты питания, которые закупает оптом здесь же на рынке. Оборот ее бизнеса вначале был небольшим, и она решила взять займ в Микроинвест. Это послужило толчком для развития. Сейчас она собирается и дальше расширяться и получать новые займы.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to prepare small parcels of land for other micro businesses to use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to buy merchandise for her businesses.  She sells cosmetics and clothing, as well as chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Martha will use the loan to increase the quantity of products she has to sell in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cesar will use the loan to buy more meat which he grills and sells to people in his area. He would also like to make repairs on his house and set up a patio area where he can serve his customers.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Mahbuba’s core business is wholesale of food products (on the photo Mahbuba has just arrived with a new batch of goods). She buys her products in the neighboring Uzbekistan. Although this is not an easy business, it is also Mahbuba’s only source of income, so she cannot give it up. Most food vendors on the Spitamen’s market are Mahbuba’s clients. In the morning, Mahbuba delivers and distributes the goods. In the evening, the retail vendors come to Mahbuba to pay for the products they sold. Mahbuba, 48, is married. Mahbuba’s husband is jobless and all the responsibility for the family is on Mahbuba’s shoulders. Prior MicroInvest loans helped Mahbuba grow her business. This loan she plans to use to expand her business further.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Основная деятельность Махбубы – оптовая реализация продуктов питания. (на фото Махбуба только что привезла новую партию продуктов питания). Чтобы закупить товар она выезжает в соседнюю республику Узбекистан. Это сопряжено с трудностями, но так как другого источника дохода у нее нет то она вынуждена этим заниматься. На базаре Спитамена почти все являются клиентами Махбубы. Утром она занимается раздачей продуктов питания а вечером предприниматели рассчитываются с нею деньгами. На следующий день Махбуба выезжает за новой партией товара. Махбубе 48 лет, она замужем. Ее муж ничем не занимается и все бремя семейных расходов лежит на ней. Займ Микроинвест помог ей расширить бизнес и получить дополнительную прибыль. Новый займ она потратит на дальнейшее расширение.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Carlos will use the loan to buy an industrial juicer for his business.

loans.name: Rui João

texts.pt:
Rui João M. is 34 years old, he lives with his wife and 4 children. He joined the credit program in 2006, his first loan was of 6.000MT. He is now in the 4th cycle of the program and requests a loan of 10.000MY to be repaid in 6 months. He has invested all loans in construction in Khongolote and has never been late with a payment.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Rui João M. tem 34 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 4 filhos.Entrou para o programa em Maio de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 6.000MT. Vai para o 4º ciclo de empréstimo e vai tomar 10.000MT para pagra em 6 meses. Tem aplicado todo o valor dos empréstimos na construção em Khongolote e nunca teve atrsos no reembolso.

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more chairs and tables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more of the products she sells

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a refridgerator

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia is 35, married with 6 children and 6 dependents. He raises pigs in Kayunga and butchers them. He is hardworking and creative. His business has a market throughout the region, especially in Kampala. He has been in business for seven years and has been receiving loans for 5 years, which he has had no trouble repaying. He plans to use his loan to purchase more pigs. Eventually, he wants to buy a car so he can transport his pork to market without using paid transportation. 
His selling of pork has helped him to educate his children and the orphans he cares for. He has also been able to build his own home.

loans.use: Matia plans to use his loan to buy more pigs and expand his business

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is 40 years old, married and for the last four years has operated a wholesale goods shop in Kayunga. He sells soap, sugar, maize flour, cooking oil along with salt, beans, rice and pineapple sugar. He is a very committed man who has had no problem repaying previous loans. He has been able to build his own home. Eventually he would like to buy a vehicle to more easily transport his goods and reduce his costs of transport. The products he carries have a very good market. He plans to use his loan to expand his business by buying more products to stock his wholesale store.

loans.use: Alfred plans to use his loan to buy more, soap, sugar, maize, cooking oil to stock his wholesale store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 39, married with 6 children of her own and 2 dependents. She has a small general store in Kayunga, which she has operated for 3 years. With her loan she plans to buy more maize flour, soap, rice, g-nuts and hygiene products. Her dream is to one day have a bigger store where she can sell wholesale and to expand her business to other areas. The market for her items is wide and she is very honest and hardworking. She even markets to schools around the area.
Rose has been able to continue educating her children, built a house and helped farmers market their produce.

loans.use: Rose plans to use her loan to buy more hygiene products along with flour, rice, g-nuts, soap, etc. for her store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is widowed, 48 years old with two children. Despite being widowed she has been able to educate her children and send them to the university. She is also a community leader in Kayunga.
Margaret has a retail shop which she has operated for 5 years. She is completing construction on a commercial building in Kayunga. There she will open a new shop to sell sugar, soap, cooking oil, rice, posho, etc. She is a very hardworking person who has been receiving loans for the past five years and has always been able to repay her loans. With her loan, she plans to buy more soft drinks, sugar, salt, soap and household goods. The market for these items is quite strong.

loans.use: Margaret plans to use her loan to buy more soft drinks, sugar, salt, soap and household goods.

loans.name: Isabirye

texts.en:
Isabirye is a 75 year old married man who has raised 21 children and cared for 9 dependents. He has been able to educate the children and his grandchildren as well as meet the household needs. 

He owns the L. Family Drug Shop in Kayunga which he has operated for 51 years. Everyone knows Isabirye. He is a very welcoming man with a big sense of humor and handles his clients with lots of respect and service. The community is better off because of this man. People are able to access needed medical drugs at anytime of day or night.

He plans to use his loan to purchase more medicines and hygiene products. He still dreams of expanding his business to much needed areas and he would like to buy a motorcycle to transport his goods. Currently, he still delivers by bicycle to both the town and rural areas.

loans.use: Isabirye plans to use his loan to buy more medicines and hygiene products

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a married 38 year old man with 8 children and one dependent. He has a retail business that sells beans, coffee and maize which he has operated for 15 years. He has been receiving loans for the past 5 years and has had no problem with repayment. 

With his new loan, he plans to add used clothing and poultry to his existing business of produce sales. He is very creative and hardworking. He helps the farmers to get their produce sold locally.

He dreams of one day being able to buy a motorcycle to enable him to reach broader markets and to improve on his income. Currently, he uses a bicycle to get his produce and goods.

loans.use: Emmanuel plans to use his loan to add a line of used clothing and poultry to his business

loans.name: Marion

texts.en: Marion is 28, married with 3 children and she cares for 2 orphans. She has a produce store which she has operated for 4 years. Some of the items in her store are beans, millet, maize, flour, rice, etc. She recently was able to purchase a small plot of land and she dreams of one day building a home on it. She currently rents. She is very determined and hard working. For now, she plans to continue building her business in Kayunga and wants to use her loan to increase her store supplies of produce staples and personal hygiene items.

loans.use: To increase her supplies of staples and personal hygiene items.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy owns the K200 Farmers Center. She is 25, married with 4 children and she cares for 4 orphans. Her business is farm supplies, which she has operated for the past 10 years. She has worked from a very young age and is very organized. She is located in a rural setting where most of the people are farmers. Her store supplies agricultural seeds and chicken feed. It is the only farm supply in her town, so it is very important to her community.

She dreams of one day opening new farm supply shops in small trading centers. With her determination, she will surely achieve her goals. For now, she plans to use her loan to add more seeds and chicken feed to her store and to pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy more agricultural seed and chicken feed.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.en: María is 31 years old and has three sons, ages 10, 8 and 7 years-old.  She’s living with her partner who helps with her business.  The couple owns a ‘colmadito,’ a grocery store where they sell basic foodstuffs like rice, sugar, juice, beans, and so on.  María started the business two years ago.  Before, she had been working as saleswoman at someone else´s grocery store.  After putting aside money for a long time, and with her partner’s help, she started her own business.  The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies as they running out.  With the extra income from profits, the couple will be able to continue improving their family’s lives.

loans.use: to supply her business with products such as rice, sugar, floor, vegetable oil to satisfy her client´s demands.

loans.name: Lwanga

texts.en:
Lwanga is 40 years old, single, and has 6 children. She also takes care of her mother. For the past 8 years she has run the Mama Nalkianga Restaurant in Kayunga. She is very courageous and determined. She has limited space and the structure needs improvement. But her food is prepared very well and she has a strong business clientele. She serves typical Ugandan dishes of steamed bananas, rice, posho and cassava.

She dreams of making sure her children get a good education and eventually buying a plot and building a home. For now she plans to use her loan to buy more foodstuffs for the restaurant and pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant and pay school fees.

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa operates the Kuteesa Beauty Salon. She is 40 years old and is married with 2 children of her own and 2 orphans. She has managed to pay school fees and to send one of her daughters to the university, which is quite amazing.

She has been working as a beautician since she was 15. Her salon is located in a very rural setting and is the only one of its kind in the area. Though people do not have a lot of money, they do take great pride in their appearance and the salon is an important part of this care. She keeps her fees very reasonable to make sure everyone can afford her services.

Her dream is to slowly expand her business to meet the needs of her community. For now, she plans to use her loan to buy more cosmetics and pay school fees. She has been receiving loans for the past 10 years and has always paid on time.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and pay school fees.

loans.name: Lameeka
