texts.en: Lameeka is 49 years old and married with 4 children of his own and 3 orphans. He is the owner of Basalamala Timber Buyers. He has been in business for 5 years. He is one of three people who own a timber business in the area. He has a good market, since a lot of people are putting up structures in this rural area. He would like to one day acquire another timber store in Kampala to expand his business. For now, he plans to use a loan to add a machine for cutting timber and to buy some more trees. He is a very mature man who is well known in his community. He has had loans before and has always paid on time.

loans.use: To purchase machinery to cut trees and to buy more trees

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther sells crayfish; she is 48 years old, married to Mr. U., has 6 children, and lives in Benin City, Edo State. She has 14 years 'experience in this business and has been a leader in her union for the past 8 years. According to her, if the loan amount of $475 is given to her she will be able to buy more crayfish and dry fish for sale.

loans.use: To buy more crayfish & dry fish for sale

loans.name: Alie Kamandi

texts.en:
Alie Kamandi is thirty-five years old and married with four children. He has been with the SMT program for three years and he has seen his business grow with each loan. He sells children’s clothes and plastic sandals.

Alie is also a certified pharmacist who sells basic medicinal drugs in the market of Kabala in Sierra Leone. He is requesting a loan of $500 to expand and diversify his businesses.

loans.use: Expand and diversify his business selling clothes and sandals

loans.name: Sunny

texts.en: Mr. Sunny A. is 49 years old. He  learnt his business for 2 years and then started on his own in 2002. He is married with 5 children; he lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. He operates a business centre (typing, photo copying, graphic work and printing of documents). He has been in LAPO for 3 years as a leader of his union. He hopes to buy a printer and stationery with the $400 loan.

loans.use: To purchase a printer and stationery

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana started her small business eight years ago so that she could earn extra money to pay for medications for her daughter who needed medicine from abroad. Since that time, her daughter is doing better and her business has greatly expanded.

She currently sells a variety of linens and bedding material at one of the markets in Kharkov, Ukraine. Oksana is a busy entrepreneur who looks for new ways to add to or improve her business. She has benefited from a total of six different loans from Nadiya Ukraine that have helped her develop and expand her business.

Recently, Oksana requested a new loan to help her purchase a car. While the car will likely help with her current business, she’d also like to be able to make money by renting it out. It will be exciting to see how Oksana’s business will continue to develop and provide the means to improve the lives of her family members.

loans.use: Purchase a car

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with 4 children of her own. In addition, she cares for 1 orphan. For the past three years, Betty has owned a retail shop in Kayunga. She offers affordable prices for household items, including clothes. She also offers foodstuffs such as sugar, soap, and cooking oil in large quantities. Her business has expanded greatly. She is very hard working and she eventually would like to build another commercial building and get some rental income.
With her loan she plans to buy sugar, soap, clothes, and cooking oil in larger quantities to reduce the cost of transport.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell wholesale

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman has a small business capitalizing on the huge demand in Ukraine for cell phones and related accessories. He started selling phones three years ago and now has a small stand in a market at the bus station in Borislav. Roman’s business is very personal. Often he will get a request for a specific phone or accessory, and he will make a special effort to find it if he does not have it in stock.

Currently the cell phone business is Roman’s second source of income. He also works at a factory to make ends meet. He is not married but hopes to save money and one day be able to start a family. Roman has requested a short term loan of $200 to give him extra capital to purchase inventory for his business. Nadiya Ukraine is happy to be able to provide the means for Roman to strengthen his business and continue working toward his goals.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: 'I started this business  in 1984 and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safeguard  my capital to ensure continuity in business' - all these are words of Mrs. Felicia O. who sells garri, plantain, pepper and bush meat. She is married with 7 children, 48 years old and lives in Benin City, Edo State. She has been in LAPO for 6 years. She needs the loan amount of $400 to buy more garri, pepper, brush meat and melon for sale.

loans.use: To buy more melon, pepper, and garri & bush meat

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
Alie S. became disabled when the vehicle in which he was traveling overturned in one of the villages in Sierra Leone. At fifty-two years old, he is not able to do as much as before but he is able to continue with his tailoring business.

With his previous loans, Alie bought 4 sewing machines. He later formed a solidarity group with two neighboring tailors, each of whom has two sewing machines. Together they rented a space in Kabala town for conducting their business.

Alie employs two ladies to assist him with the sewing of ladies' African dresses. Alie’s tailoring business has improved and because of his professionalism, he was contacted by an international NGO to train five disabled youth. He could not take more trainees as requested due to lack of sewing machines and cash to pay additional professional tailors to assist with the training. He is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 1050 to purchase six sewing machines and other tailoring materials to meet tailoring training demand in Kabala town.

loans.use: Purchase additional sewing machines to contribute to local demand for sewing apprenticeships

loans.name: Alfa

texts.en:
Alfa has been running his business for five years. He sells used clothes in the town of Kabala in Sierra Leone. He is 36 years old and married with four children.

Thanks to his previous loans, Alfa is now able to purchase bales of clothing on a monthly basis. He has made a good profit and has purchased land for building a family house. His plan is to expand his business to make additional profits which he can invest in constructing the family house. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of $1200.

loans.use: Expansion of his used clothing business to increase his profits

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. is 40 years old and a married mother of 4 children; she sells garri, plantain, pepper and bush meat in the market. She has 15 years' experience in this business and has been with LAPO for the past 6 years. She is requesting for the sum of $400 to buy plantain, melon, pepper, garri & bush meat for sales.

loans.use: To buy more melon, pepper, garri, bush meat & plantain

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is 29 years old, married with one child, and she takes care of two orphans. She owns the Magidu and Sons General Merchandise store. Her store specializes in food stuffs, soft drinks and fuel: petro and paraffin. She plans to use her loan to buy more fuel products in larger quantities so she can sell wholesale. Her store sells various commodities that are essential to homes but are not always easily found in the area. She wants a good education for her children and wants to eventually expand the entire business into wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more paraffin and petro for her store

loans.name: Foday

texts.en: Foday is 36 years old and married with 3 children.  He has been with Salone Microfinance Trust since 2004. With his previous loans, he diversified his business.  He is presently engaged in the selling and renting of music and film CDs, as well as selling engine oil, kerosene and fuel, in the market of Kabala town in Sierra Leone.  Foday is serious about expanding his inventory and would like a loan of $1200 to do so.

loans.use: Expansion of his stock of items for sale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: A dedicated LAPO client who has been a member for 6 years, Mrs. Helen O. is 44 years old, married with 5 children, and lives in Benin City, Edo State. She learnt her business from her mother. She  hopes to get the requested amount of $400 to enable her to buy more garri, bush meat, melon and pepper which she sells to people living in her community.

loans.use: To buy more melon pepper, garri & bush meat for sales

loans.name: Issatu

texts.en:
Issatu is 33 years old and married with two children. She started her business three years ago on a small scale in Yataya village in Sierra Leone. She changes her inventory according to the season to offer seasonal items when they will bring the highest price.

Issatu sells rice, oil, dried beans, and sometimes clothes. Issatu diversified her business to some extent with her previous loans. She needs an additional loan to expand her business further for more profit.

loans.use: Expansion and diversification of her inventory for her general store

loans.name: Zalia

texts.en:
Zalia has the Maama Katende Shop in Kayunga. She is 42 years old, married, and has 6 children. She has been operating her small general store for 9 years and sells clothes, paraffin and home use products. She is very meticulous about her finances and accounts for every coin she receives, i.e. she has proper accounting of income and expenses.

She hopes to use her loan to purchase posho, sugar, salt and rice in larger quantities to sell as wholesale. Her business, though small, is very well run and she also gets involved in produce buying and selling.

Her dream is to see her children study hard and go on to higher education levels, and to buy a cow and farm to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy more posho, sugar, salt and rice in larger quantities

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 30-year-old single parent. He lost his wife a year ago and is now carrying the burden of taking care of the family alone. Mohamed says that his life was an easier one when his wife was alive because her business supplemented his income. Now life is hard for him. His small business is the only source of income and he has not been able to do much because he was taking care of their child.

Now his child has grown up a little and Mohamed has asked his mother and other members of his extended family to assist him in taking care of the child so that he can expand his business. Mohamed sells adult clothes in the town of Kabala, in Sierra Leone. He is requesting a loan of $275 for the purpose of expanding his business to generate more income.

loans.use: Expansion of his clothing business to generate additional income

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience A., a LAPO client of distinguished features, cherishes talking about LAPO loasn and the poor in Nigeria. She is 45 years old, married with 4 children and lives in Benin City of Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in LAPO for 2 years and has been in this business since 1993. According to her she learnt this business from her aunty that brought her up and she needs the loan amount of $400 to buy a refrigerator, drinks and food items. This, she said, will improve her business.

loans.use: To buy refrigerator, drinks and food items

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is 23 years old. He runs a small store in the town of Kabala in Sierra Leone.  He decided to go into business because his father could not afford school fees for him when he was young.  He contributes in meeting some of his father’s family expenses.  With his previous loans, Ibrahim expanded his business and is now able to rent the shop.  He would like a loan of $275 to expand his inventory.

loans.use: Investment in his general store to help it grow and develop a customer base

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is 45 years old and married with 8 children. According to Hassan, one needs to work hard to be able to take care of 8 children. Hassan’s wife assists him with the business of selling used clothes, and both parents work hard to see that the family earns enough income to meet expenses.

Hassan will complete repayment of his current loan next month and would like to take an additional loan of US$ 275 to further expand his used clothing business.

loans.use: Expansion of his clothing business to generate additional income

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 43 years old and a widow with 7 children. She is the sole breadwinner for her family. With her previous loan, Marie was able to expand her business so as to pay her children’s school expenses and feed them more easily. She always praises SMT for the loans. She said, “I do not know how I could feed my children if I did not get loans from SMT”.

Like many widows and other poor women who received loans from SMT, Marie can now serve her children with at least two meals a day. She will complete paying her last installment of the current loan next month and would like to take another loan to increase her stock of food items for sale.

loans.use: To purchase additional food items to sell in Kabala town

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is 37 and married with two children of her own and 3 orphan children. She has a cosmetics shop which she has operated for the last year. She stocks a good variety of cosmetics, though in small quantities and prices to meet the income of the rural areas. She plans to use her loan to purchase more cosmetics for her store and to start buying at wholesale so she can to sell to other stores. She is very motivated and hopes to grow her business. She is well known in the community and offers a wonderful product.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and to start buying wholesale

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
Sixto is a small milk producer and a small potato, barley and grain farmer. He sells his products in La Paz and uses this income to support himself, his mother and his 15-year-old brother. Sixto lives in the community of Batallas in Caluyo, two hours from the capital city of La Paz.

This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow to help increase his milk production. This is his second loan with IMPRO, where he has been a client since 2006 and whose evaluation has found him to qualify for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Sixto es productor de leche de vaca y pequeño agricultor de papa, cebada, quinua y chuño, los cuales son comercializados en la ciudad de La Paz y son la fuente de sus ingresos con los que mantiene a su madre y hermano de 15 años. Sixto vive en la Comunidad de Batallas - Caluyo (A dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito solicitado será destinado para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el segundo crédito con Impro; es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006 y la evaluación actualizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sallamatu

texts.en:
Sallamatu started her business three years ago. Although she owns a market stall in Kabala town, she goes from village to village on market days. At thirty-two years old, she is married with four children.

With the profit from her business, Sallamatu is able to meet her children's education expenses and other needs. She would like to expand her stock and is requesting a loan of $275 to accomplish this.

loans.use: expand her business by providing additional food items for sale

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia is an entrepreneurial woman who works many jobs: she has a small convenience store, sells videos, CDs and DVDs and also helps her husband with his minibus transportation business. All these activities provide them with the income necessary to support their three children. Her husband is a minibus chauffer and they live in the Santa Rosa area of the city of El Alto.

This loan will be used to buy inventory for her convenience store and as working capital. This is her sixth loan with Impro, where she has been a client since 2001 and whose evaluation allows her to qualify for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Sofía es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a distintas actividades: es comerciante de abarrotes, vende videos y CD musicales y películas y también trabaja con su esposo de ayudante en su minibús; todas estas actividades son las fuentes de donde provienen sus ingresos económicos con los que mantienen a sus tres hijos; el esposo es chofer de minibús de servicio publico; vive en la Zona Santa Rosa de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito requerido será utilizado para incrementar su mercadería en su tienda de abarrotes e incrementar su capital de trabajo. Es el sexto crédito con Impro; Sofia es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2001. La evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia K. is 35 years old and single, with 6 children to raise. She has a small retail shop called The K. Shop which she has run for the past 9 years. Her shop carries soft drinks, local fruits, sugar, salt, etc. She is able to pay for school fees for her children, rent, medical expenses and other family needs. She plans to use her loan to buy more supplies for her store such as soap, personal hygiene items, rice, sugar and salt. She is a very hard working lady and is determined to pursue her dreams. One day she hopes to be able to build a home for her children.

loans.use: To buy more soap, personal hygiene items and staples for her store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a student at the public University of El Alto and works selling crackers wholesale at a city fair in El Alto. This is her main source of income and allows her to cover her living expenses and her studies. She lives in the Huayna Potosí area of the city of El Alto.

She will use this loan to buy more inventory to meet demand for her products. This is her first loan with Impro and she has been prequalified.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth es estudiante de la Universidad Publica El Alto (UPEA) y comerciante de galletas al por mayor, mismas que distribuye en la feria 16 de julio de la Ciudad de El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre sus estudios y su alimentación; vive en la Zona Huayna Potosí de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito requiere para incrementar su mercadería y así satisfacer la demanda que tiene en su mercado. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Babah Kalay

texts.en:
Babah rents a small hardware shop in Kabala town. He expanded his business with loans from SMT. His first loan was too small, thus Babah took loans from money lenders at higher interest rates to purchase more goods but only made a very small profit. He could not build his capital, as he was required to pay the installments on a weekly basis.

Babah says that with loans from SMT, he had a chance to increase his profit because the installments are on a monthly basis. He is presently requesting a loan of $1200 to increase his stock and build his own business capital.

loans.use: Increase his hardware inventory

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en: Saidu is married with a child. He sells shoes in the town of Kabala in Sierra Leone. Saidu joined SMT in 2004 and has seen his business grow since that time.  He would like to continue expanding his business slowly by taking small loans, one at a time.  For this reason he is presently requesting a loan of $275.  At 27 years old, he believes that he needs to build a bright future for his family; therefore, he wants to start now.

loans.use: Build his shoe business slowly and steadily to better provide for his family

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Osewan Mercy is 52 years old ,  a married mother of 4, and sells local food made from cassava known as fufu or 6 to 6 to people living in her community. She is also a farmer. She is requesting for the sum of $250 to buy more cassava for the processing of Santana and to plant and harvest more crops. This will enable her to earn a better living as well as take good care of her family. She has been a faithful and trustworthy leader of her union for the past 4 years and has been in this business for past 18 years.

loans.use: To buy more cassava

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is single with 3 children of her own and she cares for 3 orphans.  She has operated the Racheal Restaurant in Kayunga for the past 10 years. She serves typical Ugandan food: posho, cassava, matooke, sweet potatoes and rice. She is very innovative and business oriented. Her prices are quite reasonable and her food is very good, so she has a good repeat clientele.
She dreams of buying a small plot of land in town to establish her business in her own building. For now, she plans to use her loan to buy more foodstuff for her restaurant and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more posho, matooke, rice, and sweet potatoes for her restaurant

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en: 'I am proud to be a LAPO leader of my union', explains Mrs. O. Modupe. She is 49 years old and married with  5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells primarily  cosmetics, luggage and clothing in Usule market. She is seeking for the sum of $800 to buy more stock. She has 5 years' experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 32 years old, married with four children. She sells cotton materials in the market of Kabala in Sierra Leone. She started her business on a very small scale, purchasing the materials by the meter and selling them in the neighborhoods.

With her previous loans, Jerry got a stall in the market and also increased her stock. Jerry’s plan now is to purchase the materials wholesale so she can make a better profit. A loan of US$ 275 will provide her with a good chance at expansion.

loans.use: Purchase her materials wholesale for additional profit.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 27 and married with one child. For the past 3 years he has been selling produce which he buys from local farmers. He is very hard working and has large plans for the future. He would like to buy a boda-boda, motorbike, so he can more easily transport the produce he buys and sells. This would also help him to increase his volume of produce. He also would like to sell wholesale produce and distribute to other markets. Every day you can see him on his bike with his produce. He plans to use his loan to buy larger quantities of produce. John dreams of one day building his own home for his family.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of produce to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: 'LAPO has allowed my business to flourish', says Mrs. I. Margaret who lives in Benin City, Edo State. She sells bags, shoes and carpetz. She is the secretary of her union and has 7 years' experience in her business. A married mother of 4 children, she is requesting $250 to buy more bags, shoes and carpets to augment her sales and improve her turnover.

loans.use: To buy more bags, shoes and carpets

loans.name: Mantenneh

texts.en:
Mantenneh is 35, married, and has 5 children. She started her business soon after the war. According to Mantenneh, life was hard and she had to sell her watch to start a micro-business. She was making porridge by the street, at first, and then later, she changed her business to selling cookies.

With her first loan from SMT, Mantenneh expanded her business and began selling cooking oil, tomato paste, and onions on a small scale. As she continued taking subsequent loans, her business also continued to expand.

Mantenneh plans to build a house for her children as the family home is too small. She also plans to establish a wholesale enterprise. Mantenneh is in the process of purchasing a piece of land for her home. For these reasons, she is requesting a loan of $1050 so that she can expand her business for more profit.

loans.use: Continue to expand her business of selling food items to support her family and build a home

loans.name: Ramatah

texts.en:
Ramatah is married and has 5 children. Although her husband is also engaged in petty trade, Ramatah needs to earn additional income to sufficiently meet the needs of her children. She sells foodstuffs such as onions, peanut butter, tomato paste, etc. She is very pleased that she has managed to get loans from SMT to expand her business.

Ramatah proudly says that with her profits, she has managed to purchase land for her future house.

Ramatah would like to diversify her business further for more profit so as to be able to support her children well and build a house for them. She is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 275.

loans.use: Expand and diversify her food items for sale

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu is 40 years old and has 6 children.  Her husband works as a driver but the income is insufficient for their family expenses.  For this reason, Isatu is engaged in a small business to earn income for their children.  She sells basic items such as onions, salt, canned fish, and chicken stock cubes.  Her inventory has increased with the loans from SMT.  Isatu meets her loan obligations on time and she is now requesting another loan of $275 to further expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her inventory to generate additional income

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
Christian is 21 years old and lives in his parents' home in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. There he runs a business consisting of Internet-based computer games, which provides the income he uses to pay for his studies.

He is requesting this loan so that he can expand this business and increase his income by adding two billiards tables. He has no credit history with Impro, but his cashflow analysis qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Christian tiene 21 años de edad y vive la calle 6 de agosto de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz en la casa de sus padres donde tiene un negocio de juegos en red a traves del Internet, con el cual solventa sus estudios. El crédito que solicita es para ampliar su negocio; él desea comprar un par de mesas de billar usadas y así mejorar sus ingresos, No tiene antecedente con Impro pero el análisis de flujo de caja lo califica para acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To purchase pool tables

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Mrs. Charity I. lives in Benin City. A married mother of 4 children, she is 35 years old. She runs a restaurant and wishes to buy more drinks, starch and food items for sale with the loan of $1175. She has been in this business since 2001 and is a leader of her union. 'I am glad to be a member of LAPO' says Mrs. Charity I..

loans.use: To buy more food and drinks

loans.name: Yerie

texts.en:
Yerie is a mother of 7 children. Her husband is sick and cannot work to support the family, so Yerie is the sole provider. She sells fish and salt, and she is diversifying her business for better profit.

With loans from SMT, Yerie has been able to expand her business. She says her children’s education expenses are her priority because with education, they will be able to take care of her in the future when she gets older. She is requesting a loan to expand further so that her eldest son can assist her in running the business.

loans.use: Expand her fish selling business by purchasing additional fish and salt

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is 38 years old and lives with his wife and their six children in his father in law's house in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. His main occupation is the manufacturing of shoes. He has received two previous loans, which he used to increase his sales and has paid off in full.

He has a workshop and employs a helper. He's requesting this loan to buy more raw materials, hire more employees, expand his workshop and as a result, increase his income. His credit history qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan tiene 38 años de edad y vive con su esposa y sus seis hijos en la casa de su suegro en la calle 12 de octubre de la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz, la actividad que realiza es la elaboración de calzados. Los dos créditos que le fueron otorgados eran para incrementar sus ventas, actualmente están cancelados. El tiene un taller y trabaja con un empleado y el crédito que solicita es para comprar mas materia prima contratar mas empleados, agrandar el taller y mejorar sus ingresos. Por su antecedente histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Louisette

texts.en: Louisette B. is a 28-year-old single mother. She sells textiles and fashion clothing in Belleville's market (southern area of Abidjan). She has more than 7 years work experience in dealing in the textiles sector in Abidjan. Louisette lives with her 9-year-old  daughter who is in primary school downtown. Louisette imports some of her products from neighboring Ghana, where she travels regularly for business. Louisette joined the AE&I microcredit program early in 2005 when she received her first loan. She is a very good performer and has been able to reimburse all her loans in good manner.

loans.use: Louisette Bleoussi will use the loan to purchase clothing

loans.name: Bangali

texts.en: Bangali is 34 years old and has four children.  He provides milling services to women in his community.  He owns four simple machines that process peanut butter and cassava leaves. Cassava leaves are the main vegetable in Sierra Leone.  Bangali’s business has reduced the workload of processing peanuts and pounding the cassava leaves for the  women.  Market women who sell peanut butter also use the service.  With his previous loans, Bangali purchased 3 additional machines and hired three youths to assist in the business.  He would like to purchase 4 more machines and 12 bags of peanuts.  For these purposes, Bangali is requesting a loan of $275.

loans.use: Purchase additional milling machines to increase his productivity.

loans.name: Assissatou

texts.en: Assissatou E. is a 51-year-old disabled woman. She works with her daughters in the Treichville market in the south of Abidjan. Assissatou is a widowed woman and has 5 children. Her husband died some months ago, and she is now the sole resource provider for her family and takes care of her children alone. So, three of her children were then obliged to stop their studies in secondary school in order to help their mother in the market. Assissatou is a cosmetic products seller. She sells various fashion products and wants to replenish her store for the coming celebration period of the end of the year and Christmas. Assissatou has been in the AE&I microcredit program since September 2005 and has been a very good performer since then.

loans.use: Assissatou Essou will use the loan to purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Manso

texts.en: Manso is 35 years old and is the father of four children.  He started his business three years ago and since then he has been accessing loans from SMT.  He owns 8 machines that process peanut butter and cassava leaves in the Kabala market in Sierra Leone.  With his previous loans Manso purchased 4 additional machines and hired 4 youths to assist in the business.  He would like to purchase 2 more machines and bags of peanuts with the loan. He would also like to diversify his business by including sesame, rice and palm oil. For these purposes, he is requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: Diversify and expand his business to increase productivity.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul J. is 42 years old and married with 4 children. He is a pharmacist in Kabala, Sierra Leone.  He started his business in 2002 on a very small scale.  Abdul sells basic medicines and is providing services to the community.  With his previous loans, he increased his stock. Health workers from village health centers buy their medicines from Abdul’s pharmacy.  At times, he cannot supply some of the health centers when needed due to lack of inventory to meet the demand.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To increase his pharmacy stock to meet community demand.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita, 23 years old, is married, with three children.  Her husband works as driver of heavy trucks. The children go to the public school of the township, except the youngest that is just one year old.  To help her husband face the family’s needs, María plans to sell clothes.  She thinks that the holiday season is the suitable moment to begin the business.  With the loan requested, she’ll wholesale purchase clothes in Santo Domingo and Dajabón, a frontier city with Haiti where garments are very cheap.  She also plans o buy a stall so that she can easily show the clothes to the customers.  The entrepreneur hopes she’ll get quickly the loan to begin the activity which will change her family life.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in order to start her business.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is 43 years old and married with 4 adopted children.  She started her business by selling cookies.  With her first loan, she added palm oil and spices to her business. Her subsequent loans enabled her to diversify her business. She now sells clothes, plastic sandals and saucepans, in addition to selling her palm oil and spices.  Although Amie has no biological children, she feels happy that she can adopt her brother's and sister's children, and is proud to provide them with an education.  
<Pp>
A powerful woman, Amie involves her husband in the business and he normally purchases the supplies.  Amie would like to increase her stock, specifically the palm oil and spices so she can export them to the Republic of Guinea.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $675. With the profit from her business, she purchased land and she is in the process of building a family house.

loans.use: Expansion of her business by purchasing additional palm oil and spices for exporting.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Her name is Françoise G. . She is a tradeswoman in the Belleville market in the south of Abidjan. Françoise is a 31-year-old single mother. She lives with her two children in her grandmother's apartment in Marcory. She sells crops and exotic products such as cucumbers, cabbages, French beans, lettuce, etc. Françoise started her business 7 years ago. With her experience, she has consistently developed her business. She wants to use the loan to import pork and various spices in bulk from neighboring Ghana. Françoise is dynamic and professional. She has always performed well since she has been in AE&I's microcredit program.

loans.use: Françoise  Gbazo imports pork and various spices in bulk from neighboring Ghana.

loans.name: Alba

texts.en: Alba, 30 years old, has been separated from her husband for two years, and on her own she is taking care of her well-loved son.  Since then, she started a small business, selling gold filled jewelery.  She also sells hand and body lotion and deodorants.  She has a well established clientele.  In fact she sells her products to teachers of the schools and also to the personnel of the town council.  She is requesting a loan to purchase a larger amount of products in order to sell the jewels at special prices for the holiday season.  That way, she will increase her sales volume and her income.  This loan will help this young single mother continue taking care of her son and improve their life.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of gold filled jewelery for her business, in order to satisfy the demand of her customers

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es un hombre viudo y tiene cinco hijos, comenzó hace mas D. 25 años viendo L. necesidad y convirtiéndoL. en oportunidad D. poder vender Escobas en su colonia, Al inicio empezó cargando pocas en el hombro, y ofreciendo sus productos casa por casa, poco a poco ha ido saliendo adelante y le ha permitido mantener a su familia. Hoy ya venD. sus escobas en un triciclo y piensa en un futuro poder comprarse una camioneta, para poder tener mayor alcance y mejorar sus ingresos.

Marco esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 1,200 para comprar mercancía y poder ofrecer más productos, ya que sus ventas se han incrementado y desea continuar con su crecimiento, ofreciendo pagar en 6 meses el préstamo. El te agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas para continuar con su crecimiento.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Marco is a widower that lives with his five children. More than 25 years ago, he began to see the need to sell brooms in his village, and took the opportunity. At the start he charged very little, and sold his products door to door, little by little earning more and being able to support his family. Today he sells his brooms from a bike and hopes to be able to buy a truck in the future, to be able to increase his earnings. Marco is asking for a loan of $1200 USD to buy merchandise to be able to sell more products, since his sales have been increasing and he would like to continue that. He will pay back the loan in 6 months. He thanks you for your support that allows him to continue pursuing growth in his business.

loans.use: Merchandise for his business

loans.name: Lucrecia Alcántara

texts.en: Seven years ago, this 33 year old woman, who is the mother of three children, started her business.  Lucrecia sells clothes and curtains.  Every two weeks, she goes to Santo Domingo, the capital, to purchase the goods then resells them in her community.  Generally, she operates the business in her house, but during the holiday season she goes to the public place to lay out her products to increase her sales volume.  With the loan requested, the entrepreneur will purchase more clothes and curtains to sell for the period.  She will also introduce tablecloths in order to diversify her inventory.  That way, she will increase her income and will be in a better situation to improve her children’s life.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and curtains for her business.  Also to introduce tablecloths, in order to diversify inventory.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha is a married woman whose husband is a day laborer. She started her own business because her husband's salary was not enough to cover their family's basic needs. 8 years ago, she started selling jewelry to her friends and family, and later they began to recommend her to others. Today she has a large clientele that always goes to her when they want to buy jewelry. She is a hard-working and dedicated individual and hopes to continue the growth of her business. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $1100 USD to buy more merchandise for her business, and will pay back the loan in 6 months. She thanks you for your support that allows her business to continue moving ahead. This photograph is of Bertha with a jewlery catalog in her hands.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Bertha es una mujer casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado, ella empezó su negocio por que el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, por eso hace 8 años atrás ella empezó vendiendo joyas entre sus familiares y conocidos, y luego ellos la comenzaron a recomendar y ahora ya tiene su cartera de clientes fija y siempre van con ella cuando quieren comprar sus joyas. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora y trabajadora y desea continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer cada vez más.

Bertha está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 1,100 para comprar mercancía para su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio y salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.en: Marta has a successful small business: preparing and selling food.  She started her business five years ago.  In the morning, she prepares food such as spaghetti, boiled eggs, bananas with fried hot dogs or fried eggs and so on.  In the night, she sells fried chicken, broth, fried potatoes, manioc, and so forth.  With the income obtained from her business, Marta, 36, provides her two sons with a good education.  Currently, she is thinking about remodeling the locale where she operates the business.  With the loan requested, she will also purchase raw materials to prepare the food.  Given the loan, the entrepreneur hopes the remodeled local will attract new customers to her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to prepare food for her business.  Also to remodel the locale where she sells the food.

loans.name: Máxima Figueora

texts.en: Two years ago, this skilled entrepreneur started her business.  She purchases clothes wholesale in Dajabón and Elías Piña, where garments can be acquired at very low prices, and she sells the clothes in her community.  That way, Máxima, 40, helps her husband face the family’s needs and provides their three children with a good education.  The entrepreneur is requesting a loan because she wants to supply the business with more clothes so that she can increase her sales volume during the holiday season.  With profits from the business, she will also set aside money for possible disease issues of a member of the family.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of a large amount clothes in order to increase her sales volume during the holiday season.

loans.name: Evangelina Bautista

texts.en: Evangelina is 42 years old and has three sons (23, 18 and 17 years old).  Her husband is a livestock farmer.  Evangelina started her small business two years ago.  She sells clothes and shoes for women.  Normally, she sells the clothes in her house, however, sometimes she takes the goods to the customers upon request.  The entrepreneur wants to increase her sales volume and therefore her income.  She wants a loan to purchase a larger amount of clothes and shoes to sell during the holiday season.  Given this loan, Evangelina will better face her family’s needs and will continue improving their standard of life.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of clothes and shoes to increase her income and satisfy her family's needs

loans.name: Cesilia Antigua

texts.en: The pride of this 57 year old single mother resides in having done her best to provide a good education to her children.  Her five children are now grown up, earning their own livings, and are  professionals who support their mother.  Although her economic situation is relatively stable, Cesilia wants to continue working.  She thinks that getting old is not an excuse for sluggishness.  Two years ago, she started a small business, selling hair-slides, hair clips, earrings, and underwear to women.  She is now requesting a loan in order to purchase men’s underwear to introduce in the business.  That way, she will increase her income and feel independent.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of men's underwear to introduce in her business so as to increase her income.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores is 37 years old and has five children. She runs a small grocery store from her home from which she sells a variety of products such as rice, sugar, coffee, oil, cookies, and drinks. She belongs to the Santa Barbara 4 collective along with two artisans, Rosalia Hernandez Hernandez and Alicia Mendez Vazquez. Rosalia and Alicia make blouses, and are also hoping to obtain funds separately to buy raw materials to expand their businesses. Dolores would like to use her loan to purchase a variety of supplies for her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

DOLORES tiene 37 años, cinco hijos. Ella tiene instalado en su casa una tienda donde vende: arroz, azúcar, café, pastas, aceite, galletas, bebidas, etc. Pertenece al grupo solidario llamado Santa Bárbara 4 junto con doña Rosalía Hernández Hernández (artesana) y doña Alicia Méndez Vázquez (artesana). Rosalía y Alicia invertirán en la compra de tela e hilos para aumentar la producción de blusas artesanales características de la región y Dolores comprara un surtido de productos para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for grocery store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is an artisan who works making blouses. To obtain her supplies, she travels an hour to the nearest city (Comitan). She is 33 years old, and has five children. She belongs to a collective called Santa Barbara 4 along with Maria Aguilar M., also an artisan. With their loan, they would like to purchase fabric, thread, sewing needles and scissors.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

ROSA es artesana, se dedica a confeccionar blusas con tela de manta y posteriormente las borda, para obtener la materia prima viaja una hora hacia la ciudad más cercana (Comitán). Ella tiene 33 años, 5 hijos y pertenece al grupo solidario llamado Santa Bárbara 4 junto con doña Maria Aguilar Méndez (artesana). Ambas con sus préstamos invertirán en la compra de telas, hilos, agujas y tijeras.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is 40 years old, and has four children. She works making blouses, which she takes to nearby cities known for their tourism (San Cristobal, Comitan). She belongs to a collective called Santa Barbara 5, along with Hortensia M. Hernandez and Romelia Vazquez Vazquez who are also artisans. She would use her loan to purchase additional supplies for her business, such as material, thread, sewing needles, and scissors.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

MARGARITA tiene 40 años, cuatro hijos. Ella se dedica a confeccionar y bordar blusas de manta, sus productos los lleva a vender a las ciudades mas cercanas y visitadas por los turistas (San Cristóbal, Comitán). Pertenece al grupo solidario llamado Santa Bárbara 5 junto con doña Hortensia Méndez Hernández (artesana) y doña Romelia Vázquez Vázquez (artesana). Con sus préstamos invertirán en la compra de su materia prima (telas, hilos, agujas y tijeras) para aumentar su producción.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.es:
Carmelina is 26 years old, single, and dedicates herself to making blouses. She travels to the nearest cities to purchase her supplies (San Cristobal, Comitan) where she also sells her goods to the tourists who frequent those areas. She belongs to Santa Barbara 5, a collective comprised of several women with similar businesses. They hope to purchase fabric and thread at wholesale prices to help reduce their costs and therefore increase their profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

CARMELINA se dedica a bordar blusas de manta, soltera y tiene 26 años. Ella viaja para comprar su materia prima a las ciudades más cercanas a su localidad (San Cristóbal, Comitán) y posteriormente las vende ahí mismo, sus principales clientes son los turistas que visitan las ciudades. De esta forma ella solventa sus gastos. Pertenece al grupo llamado Santa Bárbara 5 junto con doña Dolores Méndez López (artesana), doña Maria Elva Aguilar Vázquez (artesana) y doña Elena Cristiani Hernández (artesana). Ellas invertirán en la compra de telas e hilos al por mayor para abaratar costos.

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
ELENA is 44 years old, married, and until now has been unable to become pregnant. She sells rice, sugar, pasta noodles, drinks, and cooking oil in her convenience store. With her loan she will invest in the purchase of more products for her store so that her business will prosper. She belongs to a group called Bajucu 1 with Ms. Elena Hernández Vázquez (handicrafts) and Ms. Emiliana López López (handicrafts). Elena and Emiliana will invest in the purchase of cloth and thread in multiple colors.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

ELENA tiene 44 años, casada, hasta el momento no ha podido embarazarse. Se dedica a la venta de arroz, azúcar, pastas, aceite, bebidas, en su tienda de abarrotes.. Con su préstamo invertirá en la compra de más productos para surtir la tienda con el objetivo de que el negocio prospere. Pertenece al grupo llamado Bajucu 1 junto con doña Elena Hernández Vázquez (artesana) y doña Emiliana López López (artesana). Elena y Emiliana invertirán en la compra de tela e hilos en su variedad de colores.

loans.use: Convenience Store

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
JOSEFA is 38 years old. She has five children and works by decorating and making borders for handicraft blouses worn by locals in the region. She belongs to a solidarity group called Bajucu 1 together with Ms. Delina Hernández Méndez (handicrafts) y Ms. Carmelina Santiz López (handicrafts). With their loans they will invest in the purchase of thread in a variety of colors, more cloth, needles, and scissors.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

JOSEFA tiene 38 años, cinco hijos y se dedica al bordado de blusas artesanales característica de la región. Pertenece al grupo solidario llamado Bajucu 1 junto con doña Delina Hernández Méndez (artesana) y doña Carmelina Santiz López (artesana). Con sus prestamos invertirán en la compra de hilos en su variedad de colores, telas al por mayor, agujas y tijeras.

loans.use: Handicrafts

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
SILVIA is an artist who works with handicrafts; she is 25 years old, with three children. She makes and embroiders comforter slips. She belongs to a group called Bajucu 2 together with Ms. Carmelina Vázquez Méndez (handicraft artist) and Ms. Dolores Hernández Vázquez (handicraft artist). With their loan they will invest in the purchase of more cloth and thread so as to be able to lower the prices of their products.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

SILVIA es artesana, tiene 25 años, tres hijos. Ella confecciona y borda blusas de manta. Pertenece al grupo llamado Bajucu 2 junto con doña Carmelina Vázquez Méndez (artesana) y doña Dolores Hernández Vázquez (artesana). Con sus prestamos invertirán en la compra de telas e hilos al por mayor para abaratar precios..

loans.use: With their loan they will invest in the purchase of more cloth and thread so as to be able to lower the prices of their products.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Mrs. Carolina C. has a convenience store. For over 2 years this business has served as the source of income for the family since she was left alone to raise her two children. I am asking for a loan of $500 dollars in order to purchase merchandise and be able to better supply my business and have more inventory to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Carolina C. tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde mas de 2 años este negocio a si la fuente de ingresos de su familia desde que se quedo solo con sus dos hijos. Estoy solicitando un préstamo de $500.00 Dlls. Para la compra de mercancía, así surtir más mi negocio y tener más inventario para vender.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
MARIA ROSA has a convenience store out of her house where she sells: sugar, rice, cooking oil, drinks, cookies, and sweets. She is 39 years old and has three children. She belongs to a group called Bajucu 2 together with Ms. Magdalena Méndez López (handicraft artist) and Ms. Teresa López Hernández (handicraft artist). Maria Rosa will invest in the purchase of a variety of products to add to her convenience store. Magdalena and Teresa will invest in the purchase of cloth and thread in order to increase production of their handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA ROSA tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa en donde vende: azúcar, arroz, aceite, bebidas, galletas, dulces. Ella tiene 39 años, tres hijos y pertenece al grupo llamado Bajucu 2 junto con doña Magdalena Méndez López (artesana) y doña Teresa López Hernández (artesana). Maria rosa invertirá en la compra de una variedad de productos para surtir la tienda de abarrotes, Magdalena y Teresa en la compra de telas e hilos para aumentar la producción de sus artesanías.

loans.use: Convenience Store

loans.name: Elida Louis

texts.en: This 40 year old woman is a very dynamic and ambitious one, and she is putting a lot of effort into providing a good education to and food for her three children.  Her husband works as a painter but his income is not enough to bear all the expenses of the family.  After a long time of inactivity due to disease issues, Elida wants to sell clothes again.  With the loan she has requested, she will  purchase clothes wholesale in Santo Domingo and will resell them in her community.  She has a lot of experience in selling those goods, and is confident that her business will be a success.  She will use the profits from business to help her husband face the economic situation of the family and improve their standard of life.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of clothes so as to start her business again.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
JUANA is 37 years old and has three children. She makes and embroiders comforter slips and sells her products with people in her community who take them to sell at tourist areas inside and outside of the state. She belongs to a group called Bajucu 3 together with Ms. Dalia Hernández Méndez (Handicraft Artist) and Ms. Romelia Méndez Hernández (Handicraft Artist). With their loans they will invest in the purchase of cloth and thread in order to increase production and in this way help out with family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

JUANA tiene 37 años, tres hijos. Se dedica a confeccionar y bordar blusas de manta, sus productos los vende con gente de su comunidad que los lleva a comercializarlo a lugares turísticos dentro y fuera del Estado. Pertenece al grupo llamado Bajucu 3 junto con doña Dalia Hernández Méndez (artesana) y doña Romelia Méndez Hernández (artesana). Con sus préstamos invertirán en la compra de telas e hilos para aumentar la producción, y de esta forma contribuir al gasto familiar.

loans.use: Handicrafts

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
ELVIRA is 52 years old. She has six children and her husband works by farming the land. So as to help out with the family expenses, Elvira opened a convenience store out of their house where she sells essential food items that are used by the people of her community. These items include rice, sugar, salt, drinks, cooking oil, etc. She belongs to a solidarity group called Bajucu 3 together with Ms. Tomasa Vázquez Méndez (handicraft artist) and Ms. Julia Hernández Méndez (handicraft artist). With their loans, they will invest in the purchase of more cloth and thread in order to increase the production of their handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

ELVIRA tiene 52 años, seis hijos, su esposo trabaja labrando la tierra. Ella para contribuir al gasto familiar tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, en donde vende lo más indispensable que consume la gente de su localidad (arroz, azúcar, sal, bebidas, aceite, etc.). Pertenece al grupo solidario llamado Bajucu 3 junto con doña Tomasa Vázquez Méndez (artesana) y doña Julia Hernández Méndez (artesana). Con sus prestamos invertirán en la compra de tela e hilos al por mayor y así aumentar la producción de sus artesanías.

loans.use: Convenience Store

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
MARIANA is 57 years old and has nine children. Her husband used to work in the countryside, but he suffered an embolism and is now unable to work. Ever since then Mariana has taken over as head of household by making handmade tortillas and selling them among the people of her community as tortillas are the core of any meal. She belongs to a group called San Dionisio 7 and the other members of the group are: Marta Gómez Velasco (convenience store owner), Guadalupe Gómez Velasco (convenience store owner), Blanca Martínez Jiménez (tortilla maker) and Ms. Lidia Gómez Velasco (convenience store owner). With the loan, three of them will invest in the purchase of merchandise in order to better supply their stores, the other two women will purchase corn, firewood and other instruments in order to make their tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIANA, tiene 57 años , 9 hijos , su esposos trabajaba en el campo pero sufrió una embolia que lo dejo imposibilitado para trabajar y por lo tanto ella se hizo cargo de la manutención del hogar dedicándose a hacer tortillas a mano y las vende entre las personas de su comunidad ya que son la base de cualquier alimento..Pertenece al grupo San Dionisio 7 y las otras integrantes del grupo son: Marta Gómez Velasco (tienda De abarrotes), Guadalupe Gómez Velasco (tienda de abarrotes), Blanca Martínez Jiménez (hace tortillas) y doña Lidia Gómez Velasco (tienda de abarrotes). Con el préstamo tres de ellas invertirán comprando mercaderías para abastecer mejor sus tiendas, en cambio las otras dos compraran maíz, leña e implementos para la fabricación de sus tortillas.

loans.use: TORTILLA SALES

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
JUANA is a handicraft artist who makes comforter slips and then embroiders them. She also makes morraletas (plastic bags used to carry items purchased at the market) and she then embroiders them with silk thread and sells them in the city of San Cristobal or in the tourist areas. She is 25 years old and married with four children. Her husband works in construction. She belongs to a group called San Dionisio 10 together with Ms. Juana Díaz Díaz (handicraft artist) and Ms. Rosa Hernández Gómez ((handicraft artist). With this loan, they will invest in silk thread and blankets to decorate a greater variety of garments.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca, Kiva Volunteer.

JUANA, es artesana se dedica a confeccionar blusas de manta y luego las borda y además hace morraletas (bolsas de plástico para las compras) y las borda con hilos de seda, las sale a vender a la ciudad de San Cristobal o en las zonas turísticas. Tiene 25 años , es casada y tiene 4 hijos , su esposo trabaja en la construcción ..Ella pertenece al grupo San Dionisio 10 junto con doña Juana Díaz Díaz (artesana) y doña Rosa Hernández Gómez (artesana).Con el préstamo invertirán en hilos de seda y manta para confeccionar mayor cantidad de prendas

loans.use: Handicraft Arts

loans.name: Adalia Adali

texts.es:
ADALIA , se dedica a la venta de recipientes de plásticos en su casa , esta casada tiene 23 años y su esposo trabaja como carpintero .Pertenece al grupo Lomita 6 junto con doña Amalia Solís Suárez ( vende recipientes de plástico como ambulante) y doña Amparo Solís Sánchez ( tiene una panadería artesanal ) . Con sus préstamo invertirán Adalia y Amalia comprando diversidad de pocillos para tener mas variedad que ofrecer y doña Amparo implementos para su cocina y así poder aumentar la cantidad de pan a producir.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Adalia works in the sale of plastic products from her home. She has been married for 23 years and her husband works as a carpenter. She is part of the group Lomita 6 along with other businesswomen. With her loan she will buy a new variety of products to be able to offer kitchen tools that will help other business people, such as Amparo Solis Sanchez, be able to bake better bread.

loans.use: Sale of plastic products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: This 36 year old woman dedicates herself to preparing and selling ´chimi churri.´  Frequently abbreviated to ‘chimi,’ it’s a hot sandwich – either a pork burger or roast pork – adorned with fresh salad and a variety of sauces squeezed from plastic bottles.  Her husband works as a watchman in a hotel at Bávaro, a touristy zone located in the east of the country.  She has three boys and a girl.  They attend the public school of the suburb; the elder is finishing the last grade of secondary school.  Esther operates the business from 4 pm to 12 am.  Besides the ´chimi,´ she also sells beer and natural juices.  With her loan, she wants to purchase raw materials such as ´salami,´ cabbage, lettuce, onion, and meat, in order to prepare her ´chimis.´  With the profits from business, she will help her husband financially support  their children and continue improving the family’s life condition.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to continue preparing and selling her 'chimis,' a typical hot sandwich of the Dominican Republic.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
LUCIA is 53 years old, she is married and has 4 children, she buys meat and she cures it (by adding salt) in order to later resell it to the people on the communities close to her house. She belongs to the group Lomita 6 along with Mrs. Cecilia Gómez Solís (who sells cosmetics and perfumes) and Mrs. Luz Solís Suárez (who sells plastic-ware). With the loan, Lucia will invest the money on her business to buy more inventory to increase the quantity of products offered.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

LUCIA, tiene 53 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos se dedica a comprar carne y le agregan sal y la secan para posteriormente vender como cecina en la comunidades aledañas a su casa. Pertenece al grupo Lomita 6 junto con doña Cecilia Gómez Solís (vende cosméticos y perfumes) y doña Luz Solís Suárez (vende pocillos plásticos).Con el préstamo invertirán en sus negocios comprando lo necesario para aumentar las ventas teniendo mas cantidad de productos.

loans.use: SALE OF CURED MEAT

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
MERCEDES is 20 years old, she is a single mother and has 1 son, and at her home she bakes artisan bread to later resell it on the streets of the City of San Cristóbal. She belongs to the group Flor de Pascua 4 along with Mrs. Carmen Hernández Díaz (who sells coffee, corn and pinole [parched ground grain, sugar and spices] and Mrs. Maria Guadalupe Maldonado (who sells candies on the street markets). Together, they will invest the money from the loan to better organize the place where they make their products and buy utensils that will help them on the making of the products.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

MERCEDES, tiene 20 años es madre soltera de un hijo, se dedica en su casa a hacer pan artesanal y posteriormente lo sale a vender de manera ambulante por las calles de la ciudad de San Cristóbal. Pertenece al grupo Flor de Pascua 4 junto con doña Carmen Hernández Díaz (vende café, maíz y pinole molidos) y doña Maria Guadalupe Maldonado (vende dulces en las ferias) .Todas ellas invertirán sus prestamos adecuando de mejor manera el lugar donde hacen sus productos y comprando utensilios que le faciliten la preparación de los mismos.

loans.use: SALE OF ARTISAN BREAD

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
FRANCISCA is 59 years old, she has 6 children, she is a widow since 5 years ago, and she sells meat from her house door to door and also works as a cook in a city restaurant. She belongs to the group Flor de Pascua 4 along with Mrs. Juana Pérez Suárez (who makes empanadas [corn cakes]), and Mrs. Alejandrina Díaz Velasco (who bakes artisan bread). Together, with the money form the loan they will buy better kitchen utensils and will try to get a place (shop) where they can sell their products since now they have to sell their products from the streets.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

FRANCISCA, tiene 59 años, tuvo 6 hijos es viuda desde hace 5 años, se dedica a la venta de carne de casa en casa y además trabaja de cocinera en un restaurante de la ciudad. Pertenece al grupo Flor de Pascua 4 junto con doña Juana Pérez Suárez (hace empanadas) y doña Alejandrina Díaz Velasco (hace pan artesanal) Con el préstamo todas habilitaran sus cocinas de mejores implementos y trataran de obtener un lugar donde vender ya que en estos momentos se desempeñan como vendedoras ambulantes.

loans.use: MEAT SALES

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
I have been selling clothes and shoes for over 15 years. This business is my family's only source of income and it employs myself and my son. We sell our products in specified locations in Nuevo Laredo city. We are requesting a loan in the amount of US$500.00 that will be used to purchase merchandise for the cold season.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Tengo ya más de 15 años vendiendo ropa, y calzado. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en el trabajamos ni hijo y yo, vendemos en ciertos lugares de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Estamos solicitando un préstamo de $ 500.00 Dlls. Para la compra de mercancía de temperada de frió.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Fabia Mena

texts.en: Fabia, 56, is a very diligent, hard working, and ambitious woman.  Her children (3 girls and 3 boys) are gown up and currently are professionals and university students. Her husband is a farmer.  For more than 10 years, Fabia had been selling sandwiches,’ churros’ (fried strips of dough), juice, coconuts, and pastry in general.  With the money earned from that activity, and with her husband’s help, she could buy a small locale where she is running a ‘colmaldo,’ a grocery store.  Soap, pasta, oil, candy, drinks, rice, and peas are just some of the goods that can be sold in her grocery.  Fabia thinks about increasing the income obtained from the business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more and new products in order to offer a wider variety of goods with to her clientele.  That way, she will better help her husband face the housing issues.

loans.use: To supply the grocery store with products such as soap, rice, beans, vegetable oil, and new goods in order to satisfy the customers' needs.

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
Maria Concepcion is a very hard working woman, she is married and she has three children. Her husband income is very low and it is not enough to cover the family's basic expenses. In order to bring in extra money, Maria decided to sell corn and snacks. With help from her husband, she has made the business grow slowly. They started out selling their products in the streets but now they have modified a room in their house to accommodate a store.

Currently, Maria is requesting a loan in the amount of US$325.00, which will be used to buy equipment that will improve the quality of the service they offer and to improve the store's appearance. She promises to pay it back within 4 months. Be an important part in the life of this family by contributing to their business' growth, they sincerely appreciate it.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Concepción es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene tres hijos. El salario que recibe su esposo es muy bajo e insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, para obtener un ingreso extra Maria emprendió su negocio con la venta de elotes y botanas, con la ayuda de su esposo poco a poco han hecho crecer el negocio, comenzaron vendiendo sus productos por las calles y ahora Maria ha acondicionado un lugar de su casa para instalar su negocio.

En estos momentos Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la compra de equipo que necesita para poder mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece y mejorar la apariencia de su negocio, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Forma parte importante en la vida de esta familia contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Equipment Purchase

loans.name: Toribia Hernández

texts.en: Toribia and her sister own a small store and they sell women’s clothes, shoes, beauty, and toilet products, and also products for the hair.  They started the business ten years ago.  Toribia is 47, and a single mother with three children (a boy and two girls).  She needs a loan which will help supply the business with a variety of products like soap, deodorants, hand and body lotion, shoes for women, and clothes to sell during the holiday season.  Given this loan, the entrepreneur will increase her income and will be in a condition to continue providing a good education and food to her children.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of a large amount of clothes, shoes, beauty, and toilet products to sell during the holiday season so as to increase her income.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is from the Apodaca area in Nuevo Leon. She is married and has two sons. Due to the high unemployment rate in that country, Francisca and her husband were faced with no source of income. Then they decided to prepare pastries that would be sold at special events. At first, they only prepared them by special order, but thanks to their customer's recommendations, the demand for their products increased sharply. Soon after, they implemented a home delivery system and opened up a bakery.

Francisca now wishes that her business continues to grow, and in order to offer a better service to her customers, she needs a credit line in the amount of US$1200.00, which will be used to purchase a larger baking oven to increase production output. She commits to paying it back in 6 months. Be an important part of this business growth, Francisca and her family sincerely appreciate it.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Francisca es originaria de la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Ante la falta de empleo del país Francisca y su esposo se encontraban sin ninguna fuente de ingresos así que decidieron emprender su propio negocio con la elaboración y venta de pasteles para eventos especiales, al principio sólo fue sobre pedidos pero gracias a las recomendaciones de sus clientes la demanda por sus productos se incrementó mucho y pronto incorporaron la entrega a domicilio e iniciaron una panadería.

Ahora Francisca desea que su negocio continúe creciendo y para poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes necesita de un crédito de $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de un horno más grande, lo que le permitirá incrementar su producción, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, Francisca y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Equipment Purchase.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa lives in Guadalupe, Nuevo León. She is a very hard-working and enthusiastic married mother of three. Her family was the motivation in deciding to start her own business five years ago; since her husband's salary was so low they couldn't cover household expenses or their children's education. First, she started helping one of her girl friends in a beauty salon, and a year later, with the experience she gained, she opened her own shop.

Fortunately, the high-quality service she offers has helped her increase her clientele, but the size of her salon is too small to accommodate them all. So she is requesting a loan of $750, which she will use to remodel her shop and purchase supplies. She plans to repay the loan within six months. Tomasa and her family are sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

En la localidad de Guadalupe, Nuevo León vive Tomasa, ella es muy trabajadora y entusiasta, está casada y tiene tres hijos, ellos han sido el motivo por el cual decidió emprender su negocio hace 5 años, ya que con el bajo salario que recibe su esposo era imposible cubrir los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus pequeños, primero comenzó ayudándole a una de sus amigas en su estética y un año después, con la experiencia que había adquirido en el manejo de este tipo de negocios, abrió su propio salón de belleza.

Afortunadamente el buen servicio que ofrece le ha permitido incrementar su número de clientes, pero el espacio que tiene es insuficiente por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la remodelación de su local y en la compra de insumos, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio, Tomasa y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase furniture and supplies; remodel

loans.name: Madoue

texts.en: Madoué B. is a widowed woman. She was born in 1958 and did not have the chance to go to school. Her life goal, as she said to us, is to give all her 4 children the ability to access a university or high school education. She started selling crops, fish and other dry foods with her mum when she was very young. Madoué is very experienced, because of her 30 years of practice. She lives in Anoumanbo a township in the south of the Abidjan district. Madoué has paid part of the school expenses of her children and is short about $460. The rest of the loan will be used to purchase in bulk dry fish. Madoué is an honest and courageous woman.

loans.use: Madoué Bamba will use the loan to purchase goods and pay school expenses

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa is married and has a small 6-year-old son. They are originally from San Nicolás de los Garza in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. Her husband's salary is low, so to improve her family's quality of life, Teresa decided to start her own business selling perfumes three years ago. With the help of her husband she started getting supplies to present to clients, and fortunately her clientele has increased and her sales are improving every day.

To cover the orders of her clients, Teresa is requesting a loan of $475, which she plans to repay within six months. With it, she hopes to improve her customer service and continue growing her business. Teresa is very grateful for the opportunity to keep moving ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Teresa es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad, ellos son originarios de la localidad de San Nicolás de los Garza en Nuevo León. Para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Teresa decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de perfumes hace tres años, ya que el salario que su esposo recibe es muy bajo. Con la ayuda de su esposo comenzaron a surtir mercancía para darla a conocer, afortunadamente han logrado incrementar su cartera de clientes y sus ventas mejoran cada día.

Para poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes Teresa está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que se compromete a devolver en 6 meses, con esto espera poder mejorar la calidad del servicio que ofrece y continuar creciendo con su negocio. Teresa agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva is a single mother and has had to work very to keep her family moving forward. She has two children, ages 15 and 18. Eva is a very hard-working woman, but the salary she was earning couldn't make ends meet. So, along with her sister, she decided to open a beauty salon 17 years ago. Little by little, they were able to better supply and set up the business, and now they have a large list of customers.

Eva wants to provide a high-quality service to her clients, and for this reason she is requesting a loan of $650, which she will use to purchase necessary equipment. She plans to repay the loan within six months. Eva and her family are sincerely grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Eva es madre soltera y ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante a su familia ella sola, tiene dos hijos de 15 y 18 años de edad. Eva es una mujer muy trabajadora y con el salario que obtenía no podía solventar sus gastos, así que junto con su hermana decidieron abrir una estética hace 17 años, poco a poco fueron surtiendo y acondicionando mejor su negocio, ahora ya cuentan con un amplia clientela.

Eva desea ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y por esto solicita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos y equipo que necesita en su negocio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar, decídete a apoyarla, Eva y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase equipment for beauty salon

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.es:
Cleotilde is a very hard-working married mother of two children, ages 15 and 22. Due to the lack of steady work for her husband, she repaired household appliances to help when times were tough. She started selling jewelry five years ago with the help of her husband, who supplied the first orders. Now her sales have increased a lot and she wants to keep growing the business and see her children finish their studies so they can have a better future.

Currently, Cleotilde is requesting a loan of $475, which she will use to purchase supplies so she can cover the demand for her products. She plans to repay the loan within six months. Play a fundamental role in the development of her business and help Cleotilde and her family. They are very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Cleotilde es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene dos hijos, de 15 y 22 años de edad, ante la falta de empleo su esposo se dedica a la reparación de electrodomésticos por su cuenta y en ocasiones la escasez de trabajo le impide recibir un ingreso, para apoyar a su esposo Cleotilde comenzó a vender joyería hace cinco años con ayuda de su esposo para surtir los primeros pedidos, ahora sus ventas han mejorado mucho y ella desea continuar creciendo con su negocio, pues desea que sus hijos culminen sus estudios para que puedan tener un mejor futuro.

En estos momentos Cleotilde necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía y se compromete a devolver en 6 meses, con esto ella espera poder cubrir la demanda por sus productos. Se parte fundamental en el desarrollo de este negocio, decídete a ayudar a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen mucho.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Aka Alice

texts.en: Miss Aka Alice A. is a dynamic, warm 35-year-old woman. She lives in Port-Bouët,  a populated suburb in the south of the Abidjan District. Alice sells cereals in the Treichville market located 3 miles away from her home. She makes that distance every day to join her customers on the market. Alice has many years of experience in crops and cereal selling. She has consistently developed her business over the last two years. She is ambitious and rigorous. She joined the AE&I loan program in 2005 and has been a very good performer. She wants to expand her activities in importing wheat flour for an artisan bakery near her work place.

loans.use: Alice Allou will use the loan to purchase batches of wheat flour

loans.name: Toukourou

texts.en: Toukourou S. is a 26-year-old young lady. She has a cosmetic products store in Adjamé-Forum in Abidjan where she sells various fashion products. Toukourou left primary school because her parents were not able to pay her school expenses. She then started her business when she was 16 after many years as a trainee with her aunt. She is ambitious and well organized. She received her first loan from AE&I in September 2004 when she heard about us from her aunt. She has been performing very well since then.
