She would like to expand her business and replenish her store with black ladies' cosmetics products imported from the USA.

loans.use: Toukourou Sauboulade will use the loan purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Ydi Esmeralda

texts.es:
Ydi and Jaime are a young husband and wife who are 20 and 22 years old, respectively. They are very entrepreneurial and hardworking, with innumerable plans for their future life. They currently live in a small rented room in their hometown. Their dream is to build their own house so that they can live in comfort and safety with their son, Edy, who is one year old.

In order to make their dream a reality, Jaime has had to leave their town to look for a stable and decent-paying job. Ydi decided to become a street vendor of gasoline in order to contribute to the household solvency until her beloved husband can establish himself in another city. She begins work at 5:00am and finishes at 6:00pm. She has also decided to increase her income by cooking various meals to sell in the evenings to people in the community; she is certain this business will go well for her because she is an excellent cook and patient.

Ydi is very hopeful about this business and it is up to each of you because you can extend your generous help and make sure she has the money she is requesting for her new occupation. With these funds, she will be able to purchase kitchenware that will help her to do her work in a clean and orderly manner. Let’s make it possible for this new dream become reality, for the benefit of little Edy.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Ydi y Jaime conforman una pareja de esposos jóvenes de 20 y 22 años de edad respectivamente Se caracterizan por ser muy emprendedores y trabajadores con innumerables planes e ilusiones para su vida futura; actualmente viven en una pequeña habitación alquilada de su ciudad natal y el deseo que tienen es construir su propia casita para que puedan cobijarse cómodamente junto a su hijo menor Edy de 1 añito. Para hacer realidad sus anhelos Jaime tuvo que salir de su pueblo en busca de un trabajo seguro y rentable; por su parte Ydi decidió dedicarse a la venta de combustible en forma ambulatoria para contribuir con la solvencia de los gastos que genera su pequeño hasta que su querido compañero se establezca totalmente en otra ciudad. El desempeño de su labor la inicia a las 5:00 de la mañana y la culmina a las 6:00 de la tarde, adicionalmente ha decidido incrementar sus ingresos preparando diversos platos para ofrecerlos durante las noches frías para deleite de su comunidad; negocio que está segura le resultaría muy rentable por su excelente sazón y paciencia. Con mucha esperanza de poner en marcha este nuevo deseo recurre a cada uno de ustedes a fin de que puedan extenderle su mano generosa y pueda conseguir la cantidad de dinero que solicita para el financiamiento de su nueva ocupación. Con el podrá adquirir enceres de cocina a fin de que su labor sea llevada a cabo con mucha limpieza y orden. Hagamos posible que este nuevo sueño se convierta en realidad para beneficio del pequeño Edy.

loans.use: To buy kitchenware outfit Ydi's new business

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
MARIBEL is 27 years old, has 3 children, her husband is a construction worker and she makes tamales (corn husks filled with chicken, beef or vegetables). She sells them door-to-door in her community. She is a member of the Flor de Pascua 6 group along with Patricia Gómez Ramírez (candy sales), Berta Sánchez Juárez (candy sales), Anarely Gómez Ramírez (bread sales). With the loan they will buy the ingredients needed to make their products and thus make a greater profit.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

MARIBEL , tiene 27 años , 3 hijos , su esposo trabaja como albañil en la construcción, ella se dedica a hacer tamales (hojas de maíz , rellenas de pollo , carne o verduras ) y las vende de casa en casa en la comunidad donde ella vive .pertenece al grupo Flor de Pascua 6 junto con doña Patricia Gómez Ramírez (venta de dulces) doña Berta Sánchez Juárez(venta de dulces) y doña Anarely Gómez Ramírez (vende pan).Con el préstamo compraran materias primas para la preparación de sus productos y de esta forma obtener mas ganancias .

loans.use:
SALE OF TRADITIONAL FOODS

VENTA DE COMIDA TIPICA

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
ISABEL is 42 years old, she has 2 children, and she has a mini-market on her house where she sells: oil, sugar, salt, cookies, drinks, pasta, etc. The majority of her clients are people that live on her same neighborhood. With her business’ profits, she reinvests part of the money on her business and part she uses to pay for her house expenses. She belongs to the group Santiago 3 along with Mrs. Ramona Z. Pérez (who has a mini-market), Mrs. Maria Ángela Gómez Z. (who also has a mini-market), and Mrs. Eva Rut Navarro Gómez (who has a restaurant that sells traditional foods). With the loan, Isabel, Ramona and Maria Ángela will invest in buying more products for their businesses, and Eva Rut will buy bread, mayonnaise, tomatoes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

ISABEL tiene 42 años, dos hijos, tiene en su casa una tienda de abarrotes en donde venden: aceite, azúcar, sal, galletas, bebidas, pastas, etc. Sus principales clientes son gente de su misma localidad. Con las ganancias reinvierte en el negocio y contribuye al gasto familiar. Pertenece al grupo llamado Santiago 3 junto con doña Ramona Z. Pérez (tienda de abarrotes), Maria Ángela Gómez Z. (tienda de abarrotes) y doña Eva Rut Navarro Gómez (venta de comida tradicional). Con sus prestamos Isabel, Ramona y Maria Ángela invertirán el la compra en un surtido de productos para abastecer sus negocios, y Eva Rut en la compra de pan., mayonesa, tomates, etc.

loans.use: MINI-MARKET

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
MARIA GUADALUPE is 23 years old, she has 3 children, and she buys bread form different bakeries to resell it to people that live on her same neighborhood. She belongs to the group Santiago 1 along with Mrs. Imelda López López (fruit and vegetables sales) and Mrs. Ausencia López Lagunas (buys and sells fabrics by the meter). With the loan, Maria Guadalupe and Imelda will adapt a part of their houses to enable them to sell their merchandise there and Ausencia will invest the money in buying fabric rolls to enable her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Felipe Salcedo, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA GUADALUPE, tiene 23 años, 3 hijos ella se dedica a comprar pan en grandes panaderías y revenderlo después entre las personas de su comunidad. Pertenece al grupo Santiago 1 junto con doña Imelda López López (venta de frutas y verduras) y doña Ausencia López Lagunas (compra y vende telas por metros ). Con el préstamo Maria Guadalupe e Imelda adaptaran un lugar en sus casas para poder vender ahí sus mercaderías y Ausencia invertirá comprando telas por rollos para poder Aumentar sus ventas.

loans.use: BREAD SALES

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
RUFINA prepares and sells traditional food from her region both on request and as a hired caterer for weddings, birthday parties, graduations, etc. in her community. She is 29 years old, has four children and is a member of the Santiago 4 group along with Dioselvina H. H. (perfume and cosmetics sales). Rufina will invest the money in kitchen utensils to be able to prepare meals more efficiently, and Dioselvina will use the loan to buy more products for her display.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

RUFINA se dedica a preparar y vender comida típica de su región, ya sea a pedido o contratada como cocinera para eventos como bodas, cumpleaños, graduaciones entre la gente de su comunidad. Ella tiene 29 años, cuatro hijos y pertenece al grupo llamado Santiago 4 junto con doña Dioselvina H. H. (venta de perfumes y cosméticos). Rufina invertirá en la compra de utensilios de cocina para agilizar la preparación de los alimentos y Dioselvina en la compra de más productos para su exhibición.

loans.use:
SALE OF TRADITIONAL FOOD

VENTA DE COMIDA TRADICIONAL

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
DOLORES sells bread door-to-door in her community. She is 66 years old, has 8 children and is a widow. She is a member of the Santiago 1 group along with María Díaz Ruiz (fruit and vegetable sales), Marta Juárez Laguna (fruit sales), Dionisia Ruiz Vásquez (tamale sales). They hope to invest the loan to increase sales and, thus, earn more profits to help their budget.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

DOLORES, se dedica a hacer pan y lo vende de casa en casa entre las personas de su comunidad, tiene 66 años, tuvo 8 hijos y actualmente está viuda. Pertenece al grupo Santiago 1 junto con doña María Díaz Ruiz (venta de frutas y verduras) y doña Marta Juárez Laguna (venta de frutas) y doña Dionisia Ruiz Vásquez (venta de tamales).Ellas esperan invertir sus préstamos en incrementar la compra de sus productos y así lograr obtener mas ganancias que beneficien su presupuesto.

loans.use:
BREAD SALES

VENTA DE PAN

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
LUCRECIA and her husband work selling fruit and vegetables in areas outside the city that have no vendors. They hire a private car to transport their goods. Lucrecia is 35 years old, has 3 children and is part of a group called Santiago 4 along with Dionisia Ruiz Ruiz (artisan) and Adela Velasco Velasco (traditional food sales). Lucrecia will use the loan to purchase a variety of fruit and vegetables, Dionisia: colorful fabrics and thread, and Adela: kitchen utensils.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

LUCRECIA junto con su esposo se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras llevando a los alrededores en donde no hay vendedores. Para transportar su mercancía contratan un carro particular. Ella tiene 35 años, tres hijos, pertenece al grupo llamado Santiago 4 junto con doña Dionisia Ruiz Ruiz (artesana) y doña Adela Velasco Velasco (venta de comida tradicional). Lucrecia comprara un surtido de frutas y verduras, Dionisia en telas e hilos en diversos colores y doña Adela en utensilios de cocina.

loans.use:
FRUIT AND VEGETABLE SALES

VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
ELVA is 42 years old and has four children. She and her husband process flower nectar to make a tasty and nutritious food called pollen, honey and jelly. Adding this to milk shakes with any type of fruit or to fruit cocktails is delicious. These products are on display and sold from her home. Elva is a member of the Santiago 5 group with Maria Cecilia Hernández Velasco (fruit and vegetable sales), Olga Lidia Hernández Mijangos (traditional food sales), Yolanda Estrada Martines (animal breeding) and Hortensia Hernández Vázquez (grocery store). Each of them invests in the businesses, to help where needed and make improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

ELVA tiene 42 años, cuatro hijos. Ella junto con su esposo procesa el néctar de las flores convirtiendo en un rico y nutritivo alimento llamado polen, miel y jalea. Esto se puede poner a los licuados de leche con cualquier fruta o a los cócteles de fruta y sale muy rico. Estos productos los exhiben y vende en su casa. Pertenece al grupo llamado Santiago 5 junto con: Maria Cecilia Hernández Velasco (venta de frutas y verduras), Olga Lidia Hernández Mijangos (venta de comida típica), Yolanda Estrada Martines (crianza de animales) y doña Hortensia Hernández Vázquez (tienda de abarrotes). Cada una de ellas invertirá en sus negocios supliendo alguna necesidad y mejorando.

loans.use:
SALE OF HONEY

VENTA DE MIEL DE ABEJA

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria is the mother of two small children. Since the time she was young, she dreamed of having a home where peace, tranquility, and harmony would reign. Unfortunately, this was not to be, as she constantly received physical and psychological abuse from her husband. Tired of the daily violence, she decided to end the abuse and begin a new life in the company of her two greatest loves, her children.

At that time she began selling underwear in the markets of several small towns near the city where she lives, Juliaca. This has been, so far, enough to provide for the day-to-day needs of her children, who are currently studying in a modest school in their town.

Candelaria wishes to grow and increase her business. In order to do this, she needs to increase the variety of products she has available to offer. With the additional income she makes, she will be able to provide economic stability to her family. To make her dream a reality, she is requesting a loan of $150.00. With this money, she will buy the merchandise she needs to assure the future prosperity of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Candelaria es madre de 2 pequeños niños y desde pequeña siempre soñó con formar un hogar en donde reine la paz, tranquilidad y armonía familiar, desafortunadamente no pudo ser así, debido a que recibía constantemente maltratos físicos y psicológicos de su esposo, con quién mucho antes de casarse creía que compartiría un hogar cálido lleno de amor y tranquilidad. Cansada de este violento acoso diario decidió terminar con este abuso y empezar una nueva vida en compañía de sus dos grandes amores, desde entonces desarrolló la venta de ropas interiores, productos que ofrece en las ferias de los diversos pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad donde vive, Juliaca, con los que hasta el día de hoy les procura el sustento diario a sus hijos que se encuentran estudiando en un modesto centro educativo de la ciudad que habitan.El deseo que tiene es el de acrecentar y ampliar su negocio para esto requiere aumentar la variedad de los productos que ha estado ofreciendo hasta ahora y con los beneficios que obtenga brindar estabilidad económica a su familia. Para hacer realidad sus sueños la señora Candelaria está solicitando un préstamo de 150 dólares, dinero con el que podrá comprar artículos para futuro beneficio de su hogar.

loans.use: To additional clothing clothing for resale

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 49 years old and has a grandson who she looks after and who is also pictured here. His name is Carlos Manuel and he is 5 years old. The name of her small store is “Colmadito Marzia”. There she sells rice, cornmeal, sugar, juice, and soda.

She took out her first loan with Esperanza a year and half ago for 5000 pesos (US$ 150). Now she's on her 4th loan from Esperanza, and she has successfully paid back the other three. The way Esperanza works is that initially small loans are given out and as a group of women successfully pay back their loans and get a credit history, they can borrow larger and larger amounts. She is pictured at her biweekly repayment meeting.

With this loan, Valentina hopes to buy more products for her small store, including meat, such as chicken and pork.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her small grocery store

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 58 years old and has ten children and 22 grandchildren. She is married, and five of her children still live in her house. She buys fruits and vegetables in bulk from the surrounding local farms and sells them in the nearby city markets, such as in La Romana and El Seybo. Right now it is avocado season and that is currently her main product.

Aida took out her first loan with Esperanza 2 years ago for 3000 pesos (US$ 90). This is the 4th loan that she is going to take out from Esperanza, and she has successfully paid back the other three. Esperanza typically offers smaller loans initially and as a group of women successfully pay back their loans and get a credit history, they can take out larger and larger amounts. Aida is pictured at her biweekly repayment meeting.

With her profits from her small business, Aida says that she can help provide for her family, buying food and medicine for her children and grandchildren. Her goal with this loan is to keep moving forward with her business, increasing her sales little by little as she eventually is able to sell more and more produce at local markets.

loans.use: To invest in her business and better provide for her children and grandchildren

loans.name: Gloria Consuelo

texts.es:
Gloria and Héctor are dedicated parents who, through much hard work and sacrifice, have mangaged to provide for their 3 children. They are very proud to continue to support their children as they study in the best and most prestigious universities in their country. This is why the couple has to work even harder, so that they can continue to keep up with the expenses created by their children living outside of the home, such as food and rent for them. It is increasingly difficult to come up with the money due to the difficulties caused by nature, such as climate change, and competition from other farmers.

These factors have had negative effects on their economic stability and they have had to cut back on household expenses. So as not to disrupt their children’s studies, they are requesting a loan of $350.00 to buy fertilizers, with the goal of improving their crops. We hope you will contribute to this request. Your collaboration is invaluable and very important.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria y Héctor son unos abnegados padres que a costa de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio en sus labores agrícolas, han podido mantener a sus 3 hijos a buen recaudo y con mucho orgullo ahora los mantienen cursando estudios superiores en las universidades más prestigiosas de su país. Por ello es que esta pareja tiene que dedicarse aún más en sus actividades con el propósito de seguir solventando los gastos que le demanda la permanencia de sus hijos fuera del seno familiar como es la comida y el alquiler de los cuartos. La suma de dinero que tienen que conseguir cada vez es más difícil de obtener por la dura lucha que hay que emprender con la naturaleza por los cambios climatológicos y con el hombre por la dura competencia de sus productos. Estos factores han perjudicado mucho la estabilidad de su economía y han tenido que acortar los gastos en su hogar. Para no interrumpir con los estudios de sus hijos solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares para comprar fertilizantes y abonos a fin de mejorar sus productos. Esperamos usted pueda contribuir con esta petición su colaboración es imprescindible y muy importante recuérdelo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Argelia

texts.en:
Argelia is 49 years old and has 10 children and six grandchildren. She is not married and supports her family herself. Six of her children still live in her home.

Argelia sells prepared meals and snacks from her home. In addition, she sells breakfasts to the students in nearby schools. In different seasons she sells different meals. For instance, right now she sells a lot of salads with avocados, but in the summer she sells a lot of mango juice.

She took out her first loan with Esperanza 2 years ago for 3000 pesos (US$ 90). This is the 6th loan that she is going to take out from Esperanza, and she has successfully paid back the other 5. Esperanza typically offers smaller loans initially and as a group of women successfully pay back their loans and get a credit history, they can borrow larger and larger amounts. Argelia is pictured at her biweekly repayment meeting.

Argelia reports that she can pay back her loan with the profits that she makes from her small store and is also able to put a little bit aside in her savings account (also with Esperanza) in case of an emergency. She wants to be able to keep expanding her business and be able to cater to more and more families in her community.

loans.use: To invest in her seasonally varied, prepared food business

loans.name: Enersida

texts.en:
Enersida is 32 years old. She has three children, ages 17, 14, and 13 (this means she had her first child at 15!). Two of them are still in school. Her three children and her husband all live with her in her home.

Enersida buys fruit (such as mangos, guavas, plantains, and bananas) in bulk from the surrounding local farms and sells them in the nearby city markets, such as in La Romana and El Seybo. With her loans she is able to pay for her produce upfront, which allows her to have larger profits. Before she received a loan, she had to buy smaller quantities and wait to sell that before she could, with those earnings, buy additional fruit to sell.

Enersida took out her first loan with Esperanza 2 years ago for 3000 pesos (US$ 90). This is the 4th loan that she is going to take out from Esperanza, and she has successfully paid back the other 3. Esperanza typically offers smaller loans initially and as a group of women successfully pay back their loans and get a credit history, they can borrow larger and larger amounts. She is pictured at her biweekly repayment meeting.

With this loan, Enersida wants to keep investing in her business, buying her produce in ever greater quantities to be able to sell in the markets for increased profit.

loans.use: To allow her to pay cash for bulk fruit purchases from local farms

loans.name: Doris Sixta

texts.es:
Señora Doris Romaní is 42 years old and has three children, whom she loves with all her heart. They are the reason that this selfless mother works arduously in a small sales position of sweets and chicken sandwiches. It is through this activity that she contributes to paying the expenses of her children's higher education, which they receive thanks to years of her great effort. Unfortunately, the business has suffered, because she was swindled for the sum of 1,000 dollars when one of her children tried to study in a military institution. This fact has caused a downfall in the family economy, very much, but it has not caused a downfall in the diligent work of this loving mother. To struggle with and overcome this enormous loss, she has decided to start her own little kiosk once more in order to continue working for the well being of her children. We can make it possible for this sweet mother to fill her children with hope once more.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Doris Romaní tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, a los cuales ama con todo el corazón y por los cuales, esta abnegada madre, trabaja arduamente en un pequeño puesto D. ventas D. dulces y sándwich D. pollo.Es a través D. esta actividad que contribuye a solventar los gastos D. sus hijos que cursan estudios superiores gracias a años D. mucho esfuerzo, sin embargo, el negocio se ha visto afectado, por la estafa que sufrió uno D. sus hijos por la suma D. $1000 dólares, al tratar D. estudiar en un instituto militar.Este hecho ha propiciado un decaimiento en la economía familiar, muy granD., pero no ha hecho que decaiga el ánimo diligente D. esta amorosa madre. Para luchar contra esta enorme pérdida ha decidido implementar su pequeño Kiosko una vez más para seguir trabajando por el bienestar D. sus hijos.Hagamos posible que esta tierna madre llene D. dulzura una vez más las esperanzas D. sus hijos

loans.use: Begin her little kiosk of sweets and sandwiches once more.

loans.name: Mardonio

texts.es:
Mardonio H. cooks and sells seafood meals in downtown Nuevo Laredo. He and his son have been in business for 14 years. He is asking for a loan of $1200 to buy supplies and some tables and chairs so his customers can enjoy their meals comfortably.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Mardonio H. tiene un negocio de venta de comida de mariscos en el centro de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Tengo con el negocio mas de 14 años en el trabajamos mi hijo y yo estamos solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para la compra de mercancía y comprar sillas y mesas para atender a los clientes y que el cliente este mas cómodo.

loans.use: To buy seafood and some tables and chairs.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is 45 years old and has 10 children and 8 grandchildren. She has a husband, but they are not married through the church.

The name of her small business is “Carniceria Ramona” and she sells mainly pork and beef. She is able to buy a pig every week to sell and a cow about every month. She can make about US$ 60 – 90 profit on each pig she sells.

Ramona took out her first loan with Esperanza 2 years ago for 3000 pesos (US$ 90). This is the 4th loan that she is going to take out from Esperanza, and she has successfully paid back the other 3. Esperanza typically offers smaller loans initially and as a group of women successfully pay back their loans and get a credit history, they can borrow increasingly larger amounts. Ramona is pictured at her biweekly repayment meeting.

loans.use: To continue to expand her butcher shop business

loans.name: Meris

texts.en:
Meris is 41 years old and has 10 children, but no grandchildren yet. She is illiterate, but she is sending her children to school. She is not married and is the sole supporter of her children.

She works in collaboration with Ramona del Rosario, who also sells pork, but they sell to different local communities. She is able to buy a pig every week and a half and can make about US$ 60 – 90 profit on each pig she sells.

Meris took out her first loan with Esperanza 2 years ago for 3000 pesos (US$ 90). This is the 4th loan that she is going to take out from Esperanza, and she has successfully paid back the other 3. Esperanza typically offers smaller loans initially and as a group of women successfully pay back their loans and get a credit history, they can borrow increasingly larger amounts. She is pictured at her biweekly repayment meeting.

Meris is going to use the next loan from Esperanza to start including fruit to sell in her small shop.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell in her little butcher shop

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Señora Carmen Huamán Cárdenas is a 49 year-old, persevering woman who with much sacrifice was able to complete her studies of pedagogy (education), which she completed through an evening school. The knowledge of this field has allowed her to set up a little booksotre in her home, in which she spends most of her time when she is not teaching classes. The lack of a family has worked out well for her, because she takes care of her niece along with her daughter, who lost her parents at a very young age; they have been a great joy for Carmen. It is for this reason that she wants to increase her income in this activity and jointly open up sales for sewing items with the little extra space that she has available. Carmen requires your collaboration to grow economically and become a provider for her niece and niece's daughter, who are now a part of her heart. Your collaboration is very important for her to continue carrying out such a noble job and continue providing for the well being of her two loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Carmen Huamán Cárdenas, de 49 años, es una mujer empeñosa que con mucho sacrificio pudo concluir sus estudios de pedagogía, que llevaba a cabo en una escuelita por las tardes, el conocimiento de esta actividad le ha permitido acondicionar una pequeña librería en casa, en la cual pasa el mayor tiempo cuando no esta dictando clases. La carencia de una familia se ha visto muy bien copada, por la presencia de su sobrina, ya que perdió a sus padres muy joven y a su pequeña hija, a quién alberga muy gentilmente ya que se ha llegado a convertir en una gran alegría para ella.Es por ello que desea incrementar su inversión en esta actividad y conjuntamente aperturar una mercería en el pequeño espacio que tiene a su disposición y aún no ocupa.Carmen requiere de su colaboración para crecer económicamente y convertirse en un sostén para su sobrina y su sobrina nieta quienes ahora forman parte de su corazón.Su colaboración es muy importante para que siga desempeñando tan noble labor y siga generando bienestar a sus dos grandes compañías

loans.use: Increase the quantity of articles that she offers in her little bookstore.

loans.name: Audilia

texts.en:
Audilia is 40 years old and has 9 children and 4 grandchildren. Eight of her children/grandchildren still live with her in her home. She is not married, so she is the sole supporter of her family . All her children go to school, and one goes to the university in the nearby town of La Romana. Audilia is Haitian by origin, but was born in the Dominican Republic.

Audilia's small house is located on the side of the highway that goes from El Seybo to La Romana. This way she is able to cater to passersby who drop by her little store. She sells different products depending on the season. Right now she is selling avocados and plantains. She says that the market for her produce picks up once the sugarcane season starts because there are more people moving through the area, so she has more customers.

With her loans from Esperanza Audilia was able to buy the plot of land surrounding her house, which she uses as a small farm to grow her produce. She has built a little hut next to her produce stand and wants to stock it with other foods and convenience items, such as a rice, sugar, and charcoal. That is what she is going to concentrate this next loan on.

loans.use: To expand her business by selling rice, sugar and charcoal as well as produce

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
I have been in business for a little over a year operating a small restaurant. My elderly parents live with me and we count on income from the restaurant to get by. I want to invest in the business and buy some tables and chairs. That's why I'm asking for a loan of $1000.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Tengo más de un año que empecé con la venta de comida preparados. El negocio es la fuente de ingreso desde hace un año con migo viven mis papas que son ya personas mayores de edad así que están a mi cargo y para sacarlos a delante, quiero invertirle mas al negocio como comprar sillas y mesas . Solicito un préstamo de $1.000.00 Dlls. para la comprar de mobiliario.

loans.use: To buy furniture for a small restaurant.

loans.name: Mireya

texts.es:
Mireya is married and has a 16-year-old daughter. Her husband is a construction worker, and she started her business because his salary couldn't cover the household expenses and she wanted to educate her daughter. So she decided to help her family out by opening her small convenience store 11 years ago, and little by little her business and her clientele grew. Now her product line has increased and she hopes to see continued growth.

Mireya is requesting a loan of $500 to invest in her business, specifically to enlarge the store to better accommodate her customers and increase her sales by offering new and varied products. She plans to repay the loan within three months. She and her family are very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mireya esta casada y tiene una hija de 16 años, su esposo trabaja como albañil, ella empezó con su negocio por que con el sueldo de su esposo no cubrían los gastos familiares y quería brindarle educación a su hija, así que ella decidió ayudar a su esposo abriendo su pequeña tienda de abarrotes hace 11 años atrás vendiendo solo lo indispensable, y poco a poco fue creciendo con su negocio y fue incrementando su cartera de clientes, ahora ya tiene más surtido y desea continuar con su crecimiento.

Mireya esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de USD $ 500 para invertir en su negocio, específicamente ampliar su tienda para mayor comodidad para sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas ofreciendo nuevos y más variados productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para poder continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Enlarge her convenience store

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria's first loan with Esperanza, which she is taking out collectively with four other women in her community. She is 32 years old and has six children. She now also has a granddaughter, the daughter of her 15-year-old daughter, whom she also looks after.

Maria is going to use her first loan to stock her little store with products such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, beans, soap, and charcoal. She is going to sell these products to her community, whose residents often don’t have the ability to make it to the town to buy food and household products.

NOTE: This $750 loan will fund Maria's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective businesses and will pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To invest in starting up a little convenience store

loans.name: Carmen Nelly

texts.es:
Señora Carmen P. is 42 years old, and with her husband Don Florentino they have four children. For their children they selflessly work in a little restaurant that they possess jointly with Carmen's sister, in a daily effort to provide for their dear family. Many times this effort has not been sufficient to help them completely. For example, their 21 year-old daughter had to abandon her nursing studies. This fact has motivated them to begin a new project of installing in their house a little restaurant and opening very soon, so that they will be able to generate an income with the hope that their children's dreams will be followed once again. To complete their goals and longings, they request your support, which will enable them to start this business and achieve economic stability. With your collaboration, Carmen will see her dreams fulfilled.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Carmen P. tiene 42 años y junto a su esposo Don Florentino, formaron una familia y ahora tienen 4 hijos, por los cuales abnegadamente se esfuerzan, en un restaurante que poseen conjuntamente con la hermana de Carmen, en el que diariamente buscan el sustento de su querida familia.. Muchas veces este esfuerzo no ha sido suficiente, para poder ayudarlos plenamente. Situación por la cual su hija de 21 años tuvo que abandonar sus estudios de enfermería.Este hecho ha motivado a que esta familia, emprenda un nuevo proyecto en las instalaciones de su casa y planeen abrir una bodega muy pronto con el que podrán también generar ingresos a fin de que los sueños de sus queridos hijos sean retomados. Para cumplir, sus metas y anhelos solicitan el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes, con el podrán iniciar este negocio y lograran estabilizarse económicamente.Con su colaboración hará que Carmen vea sus sueños casi realizados.

loans.use: Begin a little family restaurant.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
My wife and I have kept a small grocery store for more than 16 years and rely on the business to support our family. We are asking for a loan of $1200 to stock up on merchandise hoping to boost sales and better provide for our family.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya mas de 16 años con el negocio de venta de abarrotes este negocio a sido la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en el trabajamos mi esposa y yo. Estamos solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 Dlls. Para la compra de mercancía y así tener suficiente inventario y tener mas ventas , mas ingresos a la familia.

loans.use: To restock a small grocery store.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.en:
Marleni is 26 years old. She is married and has four children, all girls (the youngest is pictured with her). This is the first loan she is taking out with Esperanza, a collective loan with four other women in her community.

Marleni used to sell chicken in her community, but she got sick and was not able to keep up her business. Now she is starting over by selling small convenience items out of her little store (which is the front room of her house). She sells such items as gum, snacks, and diapers. She eventually wants to make enough profits so she can start selling chicken again. She is able to stock her small store from a delivery truck that comes from the nearby city of El Seybo three times a week. With her loan, she will be able to increase the number of products that she sells.

She was able to buy her own house with the profits from her previous business, but there is a lot of work that she still hopes to do on it. For instance, she hopes that with the profits of her new business she will be able to buy a refrigerator.

NOTE: This $750 loan will fund Marleni's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective businesses and will pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To diversity the inventory in her little convenience store

loans.name: Nivia

texts.en:
Nivia is 54 years old and has four children and five grandchildren. She is married, and five of her children/grandchildren live with her at home. Her husband is an agricultural worker at a local farm.

Nivia runs a small chicken farm. She raises some to sell for their meat and others to sell their eggs. With the earnings from her small business, she is able to supplement her family’s income.

Nivia took out her first loan with Esperanza 2 years ago for 3000 pesos (US$ 90). This is the 5th loan that she is going to take out from Esperanza, and she has successfully paid back the other 4. Esperanza typically offers smaller loans initially and as a group of women successfully pay back their loans and get a credit history, they can borrow increasingly larger amounts. Nivia is pictured at her biweekly repayment meeting.

With her new loan she wants to increase the number of chickens she can raise to sell.

loans.use: To be able to raise more chickens to sell for meat or as layer-hens

loans.name: Laudovina

texts.en:
Laudovina is 54 years old and has 9 children and 11 grandchildren – 7 of whom still live with her in her house. Her husband is a truck driver transporting produce through the nearby cities.

Laudovina's business is selling gasoline from her home, which is near the large road connecting the two major cities of El Seybo and La Romana. The nearest gas station is in a large town about 40 minutes away, so the people in her community appreciate being able to go directly to her. The majority of her clients are passing “motoconchos” (motorcycle taxis) and agricultural delivery trucks.

Laudovina took out her first loan with Esperanza 2 years ago for 3000 pesos (US$ 90). This is the 4th loan that she is going to take out from Esperanza, and she has successfully paid back the other 3. Esperanza typically offers smaller loans initially and as a group of women successfully pay back their loans and get a credit history, they can borrow increasingly larger amounts. Laudovina is pictured at her biweekly repayment meeting.

With her first loan from Esperanza, Laudovina started her business from the ground up, and she has been able to progressively build up her small business to serve more and more people. With the profits she makes from her small gas station, she is able to buy food for her family and help provide for her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Ysidora

texts.en:
Ysidora is 46 years old and has five children. All her children go to school in nearby El Seybo. She is married and her husband is an agricultural worker in the surrounding farms.

She plans to use her loan to build a little structure, adding on to her house for a small beauty salon. She currently runs her business out of her house, offering services such as doing hair and nails for local women. The name of her salon is “Salon Liza”, after her oldest daughter, who is 17.

Ysidora belongs to a group of four other women, who are taking out the loan collectively. The name of her women’s collective (composed of 5 loan groups) is “Esperanza y Fe” – “Hope and Faith”. She is pictured at her biweekly repayment meeting.

This is Ysidora's fifth loan from Esperanza, each loan being for 5000 pesos, so she can progressively build her beauty salon adjacent to her house. Esperanza typically offers smaller loans initially and as a group of women successfully pay back their loans and get a credit history, they can borrow increasingly larger amounts.

NOTE: As stated above, this $750 loan will fund Ysidora's business as well as four other businesses in her solidarity group. She and four other women micro-entrepreneurs came to Esperanza and formed their group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective businesses and will pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To build a space for her beauty salon

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long D., 46, lives with her husband and three children in Bathambong Province, Cambodia. To support herself and her two school-aged children, Mrs. Long Daroen works making and selling traditional cakes at an open-air market, earning around US$5 a day in revenue. Her husband and one of their children work in construction, each earning US$3 a day. Mrs. D. is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to purchase a motorcycle for trasportation, and to invest in business expansion.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle and of supplies for business expansion

loans.name: Preab

texts.en: Mrs. Preab C., 41 years old and a mother of two, lives in Batambong Province, Cambodia. She stays at home cooking food for her family, while her husband works driving a motor-taxi, earning around US$7 a day. One of their children is employed at a private company; the other one is a motor-taxi driver like his father. Mrs. Preab C. is asking for a loan of US$300 to be able to purchase a motorcycle for her son, so that he can better operate his motor-taxi business.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle to operate as a motor-taxi

loans.name: Suja'i

texts.id:
Suja’i lives in a rented place for Rp150,000.00 (about US$16.50)/month. He lives with his wife and 5 children. The eldest is 11 years old. He works as a recycler with his wife. They have been in this business for one year. They chose a pick up truck to pick up the items to be recycled around the city of Denpasar, hotels that has been their customers. In the morning they go around town to pick up these items. In the afternoon they brought those items home, sorted according to type, and weigh them. Afterwards they bring those items to the place to sell: Mentasari street, not too far from where they live. This business could bring a profit of Rp3,000,000 (about $330)/month. Their living expenses are about Rp50,000 (about $5.50)/day, and children's education expenses of about Rp200,000.00 (about $22)/month, have made them to work hard. That is their daily work. Suja’i and wife have high hopes for the expected capital. This capital will help them to obtain more to be recycled goods to buy and store. The higher the capital, the higher the profit to be achieved. Their children's future depends on this business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Suja’i tinggal di tempat kos dengan satu kamar seharga Rp 150.000,00/bulan. Sudah lima tahun dia tinggal tempat yang sekarang ini. Dia tinggal bersama isteri dan 5 orang anaknya. Anaknya yang sulung berumur 11 tahun. Dia bekerja sebagai pemulung bersama isterinya. Mereka menekuni usaha ini baru sekitar satu tahun. Mereka memilih sebuah mobil pick up untuk mengambil barang-barang rongsokan di sekitar Kota Denpasar, yaitu hotel – hotel yang sudah menjadi langganannya. Pada pagi hari mereka keliling untuk mengambil barang-barang rongsokan. Dan siang harinya mereka bawa pulang untuk dipilih dan dikumpulkan sesuai dengan jenis barang lalu ditimbang. Setelah itu dibawa ke tempat penjualannya di Jl. Mertasari - tidak jauh dari tempat tinggal mereka. Usaha ini memberikan keuntungan mencapai Rp 3.000.000,00/bulan. Biaya hidup yang mencapai Rp 50.000,00/hari dan biaya pendidikan anak sebesar Rp 200.000,00/bulan membuat mereka harus bekerja dengan keras. Begitulah pekerjaan yang dilakukan sehari-hari. Suja’i dan isterinyanya berharap banyak dengan pinjaman yang mereka peroleh. Modal ini akan membantu mereka untuk lebih banyak memperoleh barang rongsokan untuk dibeli dan dikumpulkan. Semakin besar modal yang mereka miliki, akan semakin besar pula keuntungan yang akan mereka dapat. Masa depan anak – anak mereka bergantung pada usaha ini.

loans.use:
To buy items to be recycled

Membeli barang - barang rongsokan

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: Mrs. Eam O. is 27 years old and a mother of three young children. She lives with her husband and her mother (pictured in the photograph) in Batambong province, Cambodia. To support her family, she runs a small booth selling fruit at an open-air market, where she typically earns around US$4 a day in revenue, while her husband works as a construction foreman, making about US$3 a day. Mrs. Eam O. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to expand the fruit inventory in response to the growing customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit for inventory

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Eam Oun repaid your Kiva loan early! Thank you for your support Cambodian entrepreneurs. We hope you will invest with CREDIT MFI in the future!

Best regards,
Jordyan Edmiston, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mr. Seng C., 48, is married to Mrs. Chuon Suor (pictured) and has four children. To support his family, Seng C. works as a tire repairman on the roadside, whereby he can typically earn around US$2 a day. His wife also works on the roadside selling porridge and dessert to the people in the area, generally making up to US$15 a day in revenue. Mr. Seng C. is asking for a loan of US$550 to purchase more equipment for his wife's business, and to buy a motorcycle for the family's transportation needs.

loans.use: Purchase of 1) equipment for a store and 2) a motorcycle

loans.name: Soeum

texts.en: Mr. Some V., 49, lives with his wife and five school-aged children in Batambong province, Cambodia. He works next to a market, driving a motor-taxi, earning around US$5 a day, while Mrs. Chea Sokha, his wife, runs a small butcher stand at an open-air market, earning up to US$62 a day in revenue. The couple is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to expand the inventory (pork and sausage) of Mrs. Sokha's butcher stand to meet the growing customer demand.

loans.use: Expansion of inventory (pork and sausage)

loans.name: Siti Aminah

texts.id:
Siti started to sell food 10 years ago. She lives with husband and two children, including grandchild. Siti has a small food stall in front of her home. This food stall is where she sells food, like: Rujak, tipat cantok (local food types), and other small food. Per day her gross income is about Rp150,000.00 (about US$16.50), with expenses of Rp 50,000.00 (about $5.50)/day. The raw materials she bought in the market herself - not far from home. Although 54 years old, her energy to earn for husband and herself is still high. Her husband is sick - so he could not work - plus his sight is blurred. In their age, she is not expecting much; she hopes her business could help her provide enough income for her husband's and her own needs. Loan from Dinari will be used to increase business capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Siti mulai usaha jual makanan ini sekitar 10 tahun yang lalu. Dia tinggal bersama suami dan anaknya yang kedua – termasuk cucunya. Siti mempunyai warung kecil di depan rumahnya. Warung inilah tempatnya menjual makanan, antara lain : rujak, tipat cantok dan makanan kecil lainnya. Per hari penghasilan kotornya mencapai Rp 150.000,00 dengan biaya hidup Rp 50.000,00/hari. Bahan baku untuk jualan dibelinya sendiri di pasar – tidak jauh dari tempat tinggalnya. Walau sudah berumur 54 tahun, semangatnya untuk menafkahi suami dan diri sendiri masih besar. Suaminya dalam kondisi sakit – jadi tidak bisa bekerja - ditambah lagi dengan penglihatannya yang mulai kabur. Di usianya ini dia tidak berharap banyak memang ; dia hanya berharap usaha yang dilakukannya ini bisa membantunya untuk mencukupi kebutuhan suami dan kebutuhannya sendiri. Pinjaman yang diperoleh akan dia pakai untuk menambah modal usaha.

loans.use:
To buy rice, fruits, and spices

Membeli beras, buah dan bumbu.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Mrs. Roeun P., 39, married, has six children and lives with her husband in Batambong province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and has to take care of her five children who are in school, while her sixth child and her husband work in construction. Mrs. P. is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase more construction tools for her family members to operate their business.

loans.use: Purchase of construction tools

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Mrs. Roeun P., 39, married with six children and lives with her husband in Batambong province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and has to take care of her five children, who are in school, whilst her husband works as a construction foreman and one of her children works at the construction as well. This loan is beneficially used to purchase more construction for her members to operate their business.

loans.use: To purchase more costruction tools for her husband and one of her children to operate a business.

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.ru:
Sadriddin G., 40, married and has 4 children. Sadriddin makes a living by farming cattle. He has been in business for 3 years. Sadriddin plans to use this loan to purchase a milking cow and 2 calves. Sadriddin will sell milk to Yavana villagers as well as city residents, who live there. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Гуломов Садриддин, возраст – 40 лет, образование средне-техническое, женат, имеет 4 детей. Основной вид деятельности, которым занимается и который приносит доход Садриддину это разведение домашнего скота. Животноводством он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. На полученный кредит клиент хочет приобрести одну дойную корову и 2 бычков. Удой, который будет получать Садриддин от купленный коровы будет продовать жителям кишлака, которые живут в его кишлаке и не имеют собственных животных, а также тем, кто приобретает молоко у сельских жителей и продает его городским жителям, живущим в городе Яване. Жителя кишлака и города получат возможность приобретать свежее молоко, а релизаторы молока будут иметь возможносьть получить доход от продажи молока, помогающий им содержать свои семьи. Оставшихся двух остальных бычков клиент планирует после откормки перепродать их. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow and 2 calves

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Mrs. Moeun S., 48, married, has three school-aged children and lives with her husband in Batambong Province, Cambodia. She owns a cart selling fried noodles on the roadside and in front of a market, earning around US$6 a day in revenue. Her husband runs another cart, attached to a motorcycle, selling fried noodles to the local people, earning around US$6 a day in revenue. Mrs. Moeun S. has applied for a loan of US$500 be able to afford repairing her husband's old motorcycle, and to expand her own business.

loans.use: Motorcycle repair and business expansion

loans.name: Bibisang

texts.ru:
Bibisang S., 48, a trained nurse, is married and has 3 children. She owns a sales stand at the central market “Mekhrgon” in Yavana, where she sells fabrics and clothing for women and children. Bibisang has been in business for 7 years. This loan Bibisang plans to use to purchase Fall collection of clothing, as the demand for it is about to go up. With your help, the residents of Yavana will be able to buy warm clothing from Bibisang without having to travel 80 km all the way to Dushanbe. Bibisang plans to repay this loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Салихова Бибисанг, возраст – 48 лет, образование среднее, по специальности - медсестра, замужем, имеет 3 детеей. Имеет торговую точку на центарльном рынке «Мехргон» в городе Яване, где торгует женскими и детскими вещами, материалом для пошива женской одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже в течение 7 лет. На полученный кредит Бибисанг планирует закупить осеннйи ассортимент женского товара, детские осенние вещи так как скоро начнутся холода и вырасттет спрос на этот товар. Люди проживающие в городе Яване будут иметь возможность купить необходимые им осенние вещи не выезжая за пределы своего города, так как близлежащий рынок находится в городе Душанбе и расстояние между городами составляет 80 км. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase Fall collection of women’s and children’s clothing

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru:
Ismoil P., 27, is married and has 4 children. He lives in the village Mullo Baroti, Yavanskiy region where he owns a food store. Ismoil started his business recently—6 months ago. Ismoil’s is the only food store within 10 km of his village, but the assortment of goods that he offers is relatively small. Ismoil wants to use this loan to expand the variety of products he sells. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Пиров Исмоил, возраст – 27 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 4 детей. Клиент проживает в Яванском районе в кишлаке Мулло Бароти, где имеет магазин по торговле продуктмаи питания. Клиент начал заниматься этим бизнесом недавно – 6 месяцев назад. Так как предлагаемый ассортимент товара не слишком велик, на поолученный кредит Исмоил хочет приобрести новый товар для продажи. В кишлаке нет больше других торговых точек по продаже продуктов питания, а центр города находится в 10 км от него. Полученный кредит поможет увеличить предлаагемый ассортимент товара и жители кишлака будут иметь возможность приобрести необходимые им продукты питания не выезжая для этого в город. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase assortment of products sold

loans.name: Khaidar

texts.ru:
Khaidar B., 47, is a professional electrician. He is married and has 2 children. Khaidar is electric grid inspector for the town of Yavana. In addition, he raises cattle at home. Khaidar has 20 years of experience raising cattle. He plans to use this loan to purchase 3 bulls. The income from cattle farming supplements the modest pay that Khaidar receives from the town job. Khaidar’s main clients are individuals and businesses that produce meat products and resell them to the local people. Khaidar plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Боев Хайдар, возраст – 47 лет, образование средне-техническое, специальность – электрик, женат, имеет 2 детеей. Работает инспктором в Городской Электрической сети города Явана и параллельно занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота у себя дома. Клиент занимается животноводством в течение 20 лет и имеет хорошие знания по разведению скота. На сумму кредита клиент планирует приобрести 3 бычков, которые он хочет откормить и после чего продать их. Клиент таким образом получает дополнительный доход, так как зарплата получаемая в организации, где он работает не слишком высокая, а также основными его покупателями являются люди, которые приобретая у него скот, затем производят мясные изделия и реализуют местным жителям. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase 3 bulls

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Mrs. Seang H., 43, widowed, lives with her younger brother in Batambong province, Cambodia. To support her household, she works selling fish at a busy market, where she typically earns a profit of around US$5 a day. Her brother, meanwhile, works buying and selling recyclable items in the local community. 
Mrs. Seang H. is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorcycle which she could use to transport fish to the market, while the rest of the loan will be used for other types of investment in her fish-sales business.

loans.use: 1 ) Purchase of a motorcycle to transport  fish to the market 2) business expansion

payments.comment:
Congratulations to Seag Hor for repaying this loan back early!  

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. We hope that you will continue lending on Kiva.

Best regards,
Isadora Tang
Kiva Fellow
Cambodia

loans.name: Ing

texts.en: Mr. Ing C. is 48 years old and lives with his wife and six children in Batambong province, Cambodia. To support his family, Mr. Ing C. works near a market as a motor-taxi driver and can usually earn around US$4 a day in revenue. His wife stays at home cooking food and looking after her four school-aged children. His other two children work -  one at a garment factory, and the other - as a motor-taxi driver like his father. Mr. Ing C. is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase a new motorcycle for his son to operate as a motor-taxi, thereby providing additional income for the family.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle to operate as a motor-taxi

loans.name: I Komang Suarta

texts.id:
As a farmer whose family living expenses depend on agriculture, I Komang Suarta is clever to take advantage of the situation, and also market opportunities. I Komang Suarta farms a family inherited farm of 75 are (about 7500 square meters). While waiting for the rain, where afterwards rice would be planted, I Komang Suarta and wife Ni Ketut Sriani used it to plant several assortment of vegetables and chili. His primadona vegetable is long beans, since they have planted this vegetable several times, and the results are also quite promising. With a capital of Rp3,500,000 (about US$390) in one planting period (3 months) I Komang Suarta could profit Rp2,000,000 (about $220). Long beans could be harvest as many as 20-25X plucking per period, at 40-90 days and plucking is done once every two days. His harvest could be bought by vegetable sales persons directly from plucking location. I Komang Suarta is quite happy with his results, therefore I Komang Suarta could finance the needs of their 2 small children, and save for their future education. Besides that I Komang Suarta is also proud to provide jobs for daily workers at the plucking time of the harvest.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai seorang petani yang mengandalkan seluruh biaya kehidupan keluarganya melalui hasil dari bercocok tanam , I Komang Suarta sangat pandai dalam memanfaatkan situasi, kesempatan dan juga peluang pasar yang ada. I Komang Suarta mengolah sebidang tanah dengan luas 75 Are yang masih merupakan tanah waris milik keluarga. Sambil menunggu musim hujan turun, yang nantinya akan ditanami padi oleh I Komang Suarta dan istrinya, Ni Ketut Sriani, di manfaatkan dengan menanami berbagai jenis tanaman sayur –sayuran dan cabai. Sayuran yang menjadi primadonanya adalah kacang panjang karena menanam sayuran ini sudah sering dilakukannya dan hasilnya pun cukup menjanjikan . Dengan modal sebesar Rp 3.500.000,- dalam satu periode penanaman ( 3 Bulan ) I Komang Suarta bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp 2.000.000,-. Tanaman kacang panjang bisa berbuah dan di panen sebanyak 20 - 25 kali petik per satu periode, yaitu dari tanaman berumur 40-90 hari dan pemetikan dilakukan setiap dua hari sekali. Hasil panennya biasanya dibeli oleh para pedagang sayur yang langsung datang ke lokasi pemetikan . I Komang Suarta cukup senang dengan hasil yang di peroleh ,karena dengan itu I Komang Suarta dapat membiayai kebutuhan 2 orang anaknya yang masih kecil dan menabung untuk biaya pendidikannya nanti . Disamping itu juga I Komang Suarta merasa bangga bisa menciptakan lapangan pekerjaan bagi beberapa orang yang di bayar harian pada saat pemetikan hasil panennya.

loans.use:
To buy long bean seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and maintenance expenses

Membeli bibit kacang panjang, pupuk, obat - obatan dan biaya perawatan

loans.name: Pit

texts.en: Mrs. Pit S., 56, widowed, works selling vegetables at an open-air market, and generally earns around US$6 a day in revenue. One of her children works at a garment factory, while another one drives a motor-taxi. The rest of Mrs. S.'s children are in school. Mrs. Pit S. is asking for a loan of US$150 to increase the inventory of her vegetable stand, as well as to pay for the medical treatment of her son who is currently sick.

loans.use: 1) Purchase of vegetables for inventory and 2) payment of fees for medical treatment

loans.name: I Komang Muriada

texts.id:
With only a Middle school diploma, and a so so looks, it was not enough for I Komang Muriada to get a job at a formal institution or a private company. Especially since married to Putu Putri Ariani, his responsibility has increased to provide a living for a wife and two children. Therefore Komang Muriada has to work hard to obtain enough income to support continued family living. Several work as laborer has been tried, however the income was not enough to support ever increasing family needs. Finally Komang Muriada follows his parents footsteps to work as a farmer. He works on the 40 are (about 4000 square meters) land owned by his parents with Dinari's loan. Komang Muriada started this new work since last year. As with othe farmers in his village, Komang Muriada also plants long bean vegetables on the land. From working the land, planting seeds, fertilized it, to spraying was done by Komang Muriada himself. During harvest time Komang Muriada is getting help from his wife and 2 daily laborers at a rate of Rp20,000 (about US$2.20)/day. In one plucking day harvest, Komang Muriada could make about 100 bunches (about 1 kg/bunch), which he sold for Rp2500-Rp3000 (about 30-35 cents). This was done once every two days. Long beans could be pluck about 25-30X per period (3 months). Within a period Komang Muriada could produce about Rp 6,000,000 (about US$660) in income. After subtracting Expenses for fertilizers, pesticides, labor cost, etc his net profit is Rp2,050,000 (about US$220)/ 3 months. This makes Komang Muriada more enthusiastic in doing his work.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan hanya memiliki Ijazah SMP dan ketrampilan yang pas-pasan, tak cukup bagi I Komang Muriada untuk mendapatkan pekerjaan di lembaga formal maupun perusahaan swasta. Apalagi semenjak menikah dengan Putu Putri Ariani, tanggung jawabnya semakin bertambah karena harus menghidupi istri dan dua orang anak.Untuk itu Komang Muriada harus berusaha keras untuk mendapatkan penghasilan yang menunjang kelangsungan hidup keluarga. Berbagai pekerjaan sebagai buruh sudah di cobanya, namun hasilnya tak cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya yang semakin meningkat. Sehingga akhirnya Komang Muriada harus mengikuti jejak orang tuanya terjun sebagai petani . Menggarap tanah seluas 40 Are milik orang tua dan dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari, Komang Muriada memulai menekuni pekerjaan barunya sejak tahun lalu . Seperti halnya petani lain di desanya Komang muriada juga menanami tanah garapannya dengan tanaman sayuran yaitu kacang panjang. Dari mengolah tanah, menanam bibit , memupuk dan menyemprot di kerjakan Komang Muriada sendiri . Sedangkan pada waktu musim panen Komang Muriada di bantu oleh istri dan juga ada dua orang tenaga buruh yang di bayar harian sebesar Rp 20.000,- . Dalam sekali petik hasil panen, Komang Muriada bisa mencapai 100 ikat ( beratnya kurang lebih 1 kg) , yang per ikat nya di jual Rp. 2.500,- s/d Rp. 3.000.,- Itu dilakukan tiap dua hari sekali . Tanaman kacang panjang bisa dipanen sebanyak 20 s/d 25 kali dalam satu periode ( 3 Bulan ) Dalam satu periode Komang Muriada mendapat hasil produksi sebesar Rp. 6.000.000,- dan keuntungan yang di peroleh setelah di potong biaya bibit, pupuk , obat-obatan , ongkos buruh dan lain-lain adalah sebesar Rp. 2.050.000,- / tiga bulan . Hasil ini membuat Komang Muriada semakin semangat untuk menekuni pekerjaannya itu.

loans.use:
To buy long bean seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and maintenance upkeep

Membeli bibit kacang panjang, pupuk, obat - obatan dan biaya perawatan

loans.name: I Wayan Buda

texts.id:
To be a farmer has been his profession since he graduated from highschool, now he is 60 years old. But Wayan Buda, born in Tused village (West Bali) is still able to manage and work on his 50 are (about 5000 square meter) farm, inherited from his parents. Long beans has been the main producer of the farm, which depends on rainfall as main water source. Besides a well that Wayan Buda digged to help with watering during the dry season. In his current activities, Wayan Buda is often assisted by his 2 sons, I Putu Nugraha Adi and I Kadek Ari, who both finished highschool but are still jobless. Except work that does not need extra hands, he did all by himself, like: planting, fertilize and spraying pesticides. For one long beans planting season, Wayan Buda needs a capital of about Rp3,000,000 to 4,000,000 (about US$330-440), this depends on fertilizer, and pesticides cost to be sprayed. Harvest Income during the 3 months is about Rp5,500,00-Rp6,500,000 (about U$630-730), so that nett profit is about Rp600,000 (about $66)/month. With the loan, Wayan Buda could plant long beans 2 times. Especially with the new water pump he just bought, Wayan Buda is not afraid about water issues, which was a holding factor during planting time.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Menjadi petani sudah ditekuninya sejak baru tamat SMA, kini 60 tahun telah usianya. Tetapi Wayan Buda laki-laki asli kelahiran desa Tuwed ( Bali Barat ) ini masih mampu mengurus dan bekerja di ladang seluas 50 Are yang merupakan warisan dari orang tuanya. Sayur kacang panjang merupakan sumber penghasilan utama dari ladang /sawah yang menghandalkan air hujan sebagai sumber pengairannya ini. Di samping sebuah sumur yang dengan sengaja di buat oleh Wayan Buda untuk membantu pengairan di musim kemarau. Dalam melakukan aktifitasnya saat ini , Wayan Buda sering dibantu oleh dua orang anaknya yaitu I Putu Nugraha Adi dan I Kadek Ari yang telah tamat SMA dan sekarang masih menganggur , kecuali pekerjaan yang tak membutuhkan tenaga kerja masih tetap di kerjakannya sendiri seperti : menanam , memupuk dan menyemprot hama . Untuk sekali masa tanam sayur kacang panjang, Wayan Buda memerlukan modal kurang lebih sebesar Rp. 3.000.000.- s/d 4.000.000.- , ini sangat tergantung pada harga pupuk dan banyaknya biaya obat untuk penyemprotan. Sedangkan hasil panen selama 3 bln yang di peroleh sebesar Rp 5.500.000,- s.d Rp. 6.500.000 sehingga keuntungan rata –rata yang di dapat Rp. 600.000.- / bulan . Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, kini dalam setahun Wayan Buda bisa melakukan proses penanaman kacang panjang 2 kali. Apalagi dengan dukungan sebuah mesin pompa air yang baru saja di beli ,Wayan Buda tak khawatir lagi dengan masalah air yang selama ini menjadi faktor penghambat waktu penanaman.

loans.use:
To buy long bean seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and maintenance expenses

Membeli bibit kacang panjang, pupuk, obat - obatan dan biaya perawatan

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en: Mr. Im Chok, 49, lives with his wife and three school-aged children in Batambong province, Cambodia. To support his family, Im Chok works as a carpenter, making around US$3 a day, while his wife stays at home and takes care of the children. Mr. Im Chok is asking for a loan of US$600 to be able to purchase a motorcycle to go to work every morning. Thereby, he hopes to save the money he usually spends on motor-taxi services.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Nyoman Sadwathi

texts.id:
Sadwathi has a rice stall business. She has been doing it to increase family's income. Her husband's income is Rp700,000.00 (about US$77)/month. That amount is certainly not sufficient. Daily expenses are about Rp30,000.00 (about $3.30), rent for house and food stall. Although her 2 children are independent, she has to work. The rice stall business gives her gross profit of Rp100,000 (about $11). The distance she has to take between her house and her rice stall is about 2 km. Her rice stall location is quite strategic. One factor is that the road is quite busy. That fact is also supported that the food Sadwathi sells are liked by her customers. Also the many building laborers working around Sadwathi's food-stall. Raw materials prices are quite high, but this mother relies on capital to buy enough raw materials. The to be obtained loan would be used to add to her capital.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sadwathi memiliki usaha warung nasi. Dia menekuni usaha ini untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga. Penghasilan suaminya per bulan Rp 700.000,00. Uang sejumlah itu tentu saja masih belum mencukupi. Biaya hidup per hari Rp 30.000,00, kontrakkan baik untuk rumah maupun untuk warung nasinya. Walaupun kedua anaknya sudah mandiri, dia harus bekerja. Usaha warung nasinya ini memberikan keuntungan kotor per hari mencapai Rp 100.000,00. Jarak yang harus dia tempuh dari rumah menuju warung ± 2 km. Letak warung nasinya cukup strategis. Salah satu faktornya jalur yang melewatinya cukup ramai. Hal tersebut juga didukung oleh makanan yang dijual Sadwathi diminati oleh pelanggan. Hasilnya penjualannya pun sangat bagus. Hal ini ditambah dengan banyaknya buruh bangunan yang bekerja di sekitar warung Sadwathi. Harga bahan baku sekarang memang cukup tinggi, tapi ibu ini memanfaatkan modal yang ada untuk membeli bahan baku yang cukup. Pinjaman yang dia peroleh akan dia manfaatkan untuk menambah modal yang sudah dia miliki.

loans.use:
To buy rice, vegetable and spices

Membeli beras, sayur, dan bumbu.

loans.name: Gulbakhar

texts.en:
N. Gulbakhar is a 29-year-old woman who owns her business in the small village of Varkhankend, situated in southern part of Azerbaijan in the Saatli region.

Gulbakhar raises vegetables, particularly cucumbers, in her garden and sells them to the local bazaar traders. She has five years of experience raising vegetables. Her business has brought her a good income all the years. Cucumbers are in very high demand among the Azerbaijani people, as they use them in their everyday meals.

Since selling vegetables is the only source of income for her family, Gulbakhar and her husband work very hard to cover all the family's needs and feed their two grown daughters. Last year was too hard for Gulbakhar`s family, as the prices for food increased twice, and they are going to rise again next year. Gulbakhar applied for a loan of $1200 to develop her business. She is going to rent land and start raising other sorts of vegetables.

loans.use: To expand her farming

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud has a sweets and carrot juice shop in the area of Borj el Barajneh, in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He is a 31-yearold married man with one child  who is supporting his family through the small business he owns. His freshly squeezed vegetables are a delight to the eye and to the mouth. In order to develop his shop and to generate more revenues, Mahmoud is requesting a loan of $1200. This will be the 4th loan Mahmoud has gotten from Al Majmoua, and he always repays his debt.

loans.use: To purchase of goods and develop his business.

loans.name: Kafa

texts.en: Kafa is a hairdresser who lives with her husband in in Ouzai, a very poor area in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. Kafa is a 44-year-old woman who is striving to help her husband support their extended family (they have no children). She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase beauty products and develop her business. Kafa belongs to a loan group with other women from the same area.  A group is usually constituted of self-chosen women living in vulnerable conditions. The group lending is based on incrementA. increases of loan amounts and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. It is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women. Kafa has borrowed five loans from A. Majmoua in the past and always repaid her them on time. Kafa is proud of being an economically active woman in her society.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her hairdresser business

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 27-year-old, single woman who lives in the area of Chyah in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. She is a beautician and offers her services to neighboring clients. Amal benefited from technical training in beauty techniques and is able to offer a large variety of services to her clients -- manicures, make up, tattoos, etc. She doesn't limit herself to light esthetic's, because she has the skills to undertake more complicated tasks requested by women. Amal, a very smart and ambitious woman, is striving to become financially independent from her parents who live with limited revenues. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase her inventory of beauty products.

loans.use: To purchase of a large inventory of beauty products

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil N. is a 29-year-old butcher who sells fresh meat in his own small booth.  He lives in the southern part of Azerbaijan, Imishli region with his wife, one son and one daughter. He started his business in 2000, when he first began help his father. He learned very soon how to cut meat and how to choose healthy animals for meat.  Veal, beef and mutton are in very high demand all across Azerbaijan and people use meat in every day life. His meat booth used to bring him good income but as the economic situation in the country is unstable and prices for products rise every year.  Ramil's  income is not enough to cover family needs and Ramil has applied for 1200 USD to improve the conditions of his business, repair his place of work and to be able to purchase more animals for meat selling.

loans.use: Going to improve conditions of his business

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal M. is a 22-year-old farmer who sells pomegranates in his own village Varkhankend in the Imishli region of Azerbijan. He lives with his old parents. Kamal has two years of experience raising pomegranates and selling them to the local bazaar traders. Azerbaijan's climate is quite optimal for pomegranate tree growing, the average tree growing in 6-12 months. It starts to give fruit within a period of 8-14 months. Kamal has more than fifteen pomegranates trees in his garden. He gathers crops in the autumn and with the money from selling them he covers his family needs for the next three seasons. The conditions are hard but Kamal also has his small garden where he raises vegetables like potatoes and onions which he uses for food during the winter and spring.
Kamal is going to develop his business and start raising potatoes and onion for selling. He has enough experience in this field  and for this purpose he applied for 1200 USD.

loans.use: Going to start raising potatoes and onions for selling

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz M. is a 51-year-old baker who runs his own small bakery shop in the Sabirabad region, situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan.  Ramiz is married and has three children. He started his business in 1992. Now Ramiz sells lavash/pita to the local people and sometimes to the Baku city traders. His business brings him good income, however it is the only financial source in his family. His purpose is to improve the conditions of his bakery shop, repair, expand it and attract his son to help him.  In the same place he would like to open small shop to sell cooked pita. His income is not enough to make his dream possible and he has applied for 1000 USD to make that happen.

loans.use: Going to to improve the condition of his bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Nawal lives in Borj Barajneh, in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. She is a beauty specialist and she is requesting a loan of $1000 to pay the school tuition fees of her children and to purchase a variety of beauty products which will increase her business and generate more revenue. This is the first time she requests a loan from Majmoua. Nawal is a fifty-year-old mother of six children striving to help her husband support their family.

loans.use: To pay the school tuition fees of her children and purchase beauty products

loans.name: Felismina Fabiao

texts.pt:
Felismina lives with her husband and their six school age children – all of whom are enrolled in school. She joined the credit program in 2005 and, thanks to her micro-loans, her business has been doing well. She has a small shop where she sells miscellaneous household and farming tools: rakes, buckets, rope, hoses, chains, nails, etc. She would use this cycle's loan to increase the shop's inventory. Felismina hopes the business will continue to do well so that she can make additions to her house, to better accomodate her many children. At the shop she counts with her husband's help.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Felismina vive maritalmente com um homem com quem tem 6 filhos. Todos os seus filhos estao a estudar.Ela entrou para o Programa de Credito do FDm em 2005. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para adquirir mais artigos para rechear a sua barraca. Ela tem muita clientela, pois que vende de tudo um pouco, desde baldes, cordas, ancinhos, correntes,mangueiras, balancas, pregos etc,. Com os rendimentos do negocio ela pensa ampliar a residencia tendo em conta o numero de filhos. Ela trabalha com o marido na venda.

loans.use: Felismina will use her loan to buy more items to sell at the hardware shop she runs with the help of her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira N. is a 43-year-old farmer who raises guinea squash (eggplant) in her home town Sabirabad. Tahira lives with her three children and husband. She has twelve years of experience in raising vegetables and selling it to the local bazaar traders. Guinea squash is in very high demand in Azerbaijan. People cook many different meals, sauces and also salt them for the winter season. Currently Tahira sells guinea squash in the bazaar herself or sometimes her son helps her. Tahira's husband is unemployed and selling guinea squash is the only source of income in her family. This income is just enough to feed the family but not yet enough to live a normal life. Tahira was in trouble thinking of ways to improve the conditions of her business to earn more.  She decided to apply for 900 USD and expand her activity in raising vegetables.

loans.use: Going to expand her activity in raising vegetables

loans.name: Argena

texts.pt:
