Olga tiene 27 años es una joven entusiasta y luchadora con grandes planes en su vida futura, desde muy pequeñita siempre fue muy laboriosa, hábil y ágil, gracias a esas virtudes pudo aprender diversos oficios en el que se desempeña con facilidad; después de dedicarse a diferentes actividades pudo ahorrar lo suficiente y adquirir su máquina de coser, con el que realiza sus trabajos de confección de buzos, poleras, polos, etc. Trabajo que le viene generando mucha satisfacción y con el que puede cubrir sus gastos personales y apoyar económicamente a sus ancianos padres.En este pequeño taller ubicado en su domicilio Olga realiza sus labores diarias desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde junto a otras 2 personas quienes la apoyan en la confección de las prendas de vestir trabajo que desempeñan en equipo arduamente durante todos los días de la semana. El deseo más grande que tiene es crecer mucho más con este negocio, hasta lograr exportar al exterior sus confecciones; actualmente solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares, dinero que invertirá en comprar más cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos. Colaboremos para que este deseo se haga realidad en poco tiempo y esta joven diligente siga cobijando en su corazón deseos de superación.

loans.use: To buy raw material for making clothes.

loans.name: Placida

texts.es:
Placida and her husband, Victor, left the town where they were born, Santiago de Nicasio, hopeful of succeeding in life and improving their economic situation, above all in order to provide higher education for their 4 young children. At first, Placida sold groceries from a cart, but, thanks to her hard work and dedication, she was able to rent a small store to sell products that met the basic needs of her clients. She never imagined that this new business would bring her so much satisfaction and that the income generated would become essential for her family. She is now able to support her husband in covering household expenses and her children's university educations. Placida wants to expand her small store and increase her product variety so as to offer greater, thorough service to her clients and therefore earn more income for her family. This is why she is asking for a $200 loan with which to increase her store's stock. "With your generous contribution, you will be able to help Placida and her family continue to prosper everyday."

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Placida y su esposo Víctor, salieron de su pueblo natal Santiago de Nicasio con muchas expectativas de triunfar en la vida y mejorar su situación económica, sobre todo brindarles una educación superior a sus 4 hijos menores. En un principio Doña Placida se dedicó a la venta de abarrotes en forma ambulatoria, pero gracias a su empeño y dedicación pudo abrir su pequeña bodeguita en su domicilio alquilado y ofrece productos de primera necesidad a sus nuevos vecinos, nunca se imaginó que este nuevo negocio le traería mucha satisfacción y que se convertiría en un ingreso económico indispensable para su familia, con el ahora puede apoyar a su esposo para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y estudios superiores de sus hijos.El deseo que tiene Placida es ampliar su pequeña tiendita y aumentar la variedad de sus productos con el fin de ofrecer un mejor y completo servicio a sus clientes y por ende generar mayor ingreso económico para su familia, es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares, dinero que podrá invertir en ampliar el stock de su negocio. “Con tu generoso apoyo podrás ayudar a Placida y a su familia a seguir prosperando día a día”

loans.use: To expand the small family grocery store and buy more items to sell

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves is a very hard-working 20-year-old. She began working at 16 helping her mother sell used clothing to help with the family expenses and to finance her studies. She sell clothing on the street three days a week--Monday, Thursday and Sunday from 4:30 AM to 5:00PM and studies garment making at an occupational training center in her town the other days. Her dream is to some day have her own garment shop making t-shirts, overalls and pull-overs. She is working very hard towards this goal. Right now she would like to increase her stock and buy several bundles of used clothing to resell and finance her dream. She is asking for a loan of $500 which she promises to repay in 6 months. With your help, this young entrepreneur will soon see her dream of owning a garment shop a reality.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Nieves tiene 20 años de edad es una joven luchadora y muy laboriosa, empezó a trabajar a la edad de 16 años, en un principio apoyando a su madre en la venta de ropa de segundo uso, oficio al que actualmente se dedica y con el que le permite apoyar económicamente a su humilde familia y cubrir el gastos de sus estudios.Vende su mercadería 3 días a la semana los lunes, jueves y domingo, en forma ambulatoria, a partir de las 4.30 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde, el resto de días se dedica a estudiar confección textil en un centro de ocupación superior de su pequeña ciudad, el sueño de esta joven emprendedora es tener su propio taller de confección de camisetas, buzos y casacas y está dispuesta ha esforzarse día a día para concretizar lo antes posible este sueño.Por ahora desea aumentar su mercadería y comprar más fardos de ropa usada, con el fin de poderlos vender y obtener mayor beneficio económico para ahorrar lo suficiente y así en un futuro no muy lejano hacer realidad sus sueños; para esto solicita un préstamo de 500 dólares y se compromete a hacer la devolución en un lapso de 6 meses“Con tu ayuda desinteresada esta joven emprendedora podrá hacer realidad sus sueños de tener su propio taller de confección de prendas de vestir”

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for a small clothing shop.

loans.name: Rosa Regina

texts.es:
Rosita, as her friends and customers affectionately call her, is the mother of a four-year-old girl, the light of her life. Rosita has overcome deception and heartbreak and endeavors to give young Milagros a good home. She has opened a small grocery store in her parents' home where she lives. She tends the shop with good cheer and the business is growing. She is asking for a loan of $200 to stock up on more varied merchandise and promises to repay the loan in 6 months. Please help this hard-working young mother fulfill her dreams and those of her daughter.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosita como cariñosamente la suelen llamar sus amigos y clientes, es madre de una niña de 4 años; tras haber sufrido innumerables decepciones y sufrimientos en la vida, aún tiene una razón por la que debe seguir luchando, su hija menor Milagros, quien es la luz de sus sueños y la alegría de su hogar. Actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres, donde decidió habilitar un ambiente para abrir su bodeguita de abarrotes, gracias a la amabilidad y paciencia con la que trata a su clientela ha podido crecer con su negocio y obtener asiduos comensales, el deseo que tiene doña Rosita es aumentar la variedad de sus productos y así cumplir con la demanda de sus exigentes clientes. Para conseguir sus objetivos solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares, dinero que le permitirá aumentar el stock y variedad de sus productos y promete retornar el préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses.Hagamos posible que esta joven y cariñosa madre mantenga a buen recaudo los anhelos de su pequeña niña con su desempeño diario.

loans.use: To stock a small grocery store.

loans.name: Madelene

texts.es:
Madelene is a hard-working 25-year-old. Since her daughter was born she has had to support her alone . She endeavored in various ways without success until she discovered that she has a gift for weaving. Since then she has worked at weaving each day in her humble home and gained a reputation as one of the finest weavers in town. Madelene finds, however, that she doesn't have enough capital to buy wool, so she is asking for a loan of $200 which she promises to repay in 6 months. Through her craft, she hopes to provide for her young daughter Florecita, two years old. Please help this gifted weaver and young mother.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Madelene es joven madre luchadora y trabajadora de 25 años, desde que nació su pequeña niña tuvo que afrontar sola con la responsabilidad y se dedicó a diversas actividades; desafortunadamente en ninguna le iba bien, hasta que descubrió el don especial que llevaba en las manos para elaborar sus tejidos, esta labor la efectúa con gran creatividad y habilidad diariamente en las instalaciones de su humilde morada.Actualmente se ha convertido en una de las personas más cotizadas de su ciudad por los bellos tejidos que realiza, pero tiene un problema, no posee suficiente capital para comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de sus trabajos, es por esa razón que recurre a tu ayuda desinteresada y solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares, dinero que invertirá en el capital de su negocio y generará buenos ingresos económicos para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija menor, Florcita de 2 añitos, Madelene promete reintegrarte el préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses.“Ayudemos a esta joven madre a salir adelante con el talento innato con el que fabrica sus bellos tejidos”

loans.use: :To buy wool or yarn for weaving.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca is 47 years old and has been separated from her husband for a number of years. With her strong character, she set a good example for her three adolescent children and set them on a good path. Previously she worked at a well-known restaurant in her town, but she saw household expenses rising and her salary was insufficient to meet all her family's needs. So she decided to risk her small amount of saving and start her own business with the help of her children. Since then she has set out on the streets selling delicious cebiche, a popular regional dish. At first, the business did not appear to be too profitable, but little by little her sales grew thanks to her excellent flavor and seasoning, and she now has a long list of customers. Her dream now is to purchase a cart and enlarge her business, and for this she is requesting a loan of $350 to help her increase her income and be able to fulfill her dreams of a higher education for her children. Help Francisca and her family will prosper along with the business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Francisca de 47 años edad, separada de su esposo hace ya varios años, con su entereza y su buen ejemplo supo sacar adelante a sus hijos 3 hijos adolescentes y guiarlos por el buen camino.Anteriormente trabajaba en una cebichería reconocida de su ciudad, pero al ver que los gastos de su hogar se incrementaban y el sueldo que obtenía con este trabajo era insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, decidió arriesgar el poco ahorrito que tenia y emprender junto a sus hijos su propio negocio, desde entonces se dispuso a salir a las calles y ofrecer su delicioso cebiche en forma ambulatoria; en un principio este negocio no parecía ser tan rentable, pero poco a poco fue creciendo gracias a su excelente sabor y sazón ya cuenta con gran cantidad de clientes.El deseo que ahora tiene doña Francisca es comprar un triciclo y ampliar su rentable negocio, para esto solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares, dinero que podrá invertir para acrecentar su negocio y así generar mayores ingresos económicos para ofrecerles sus tan deseados estudios superiores a sus hijos. “Ayudemos Francisca y su familia a prosperar con este negocio”

loans.use: Enlarge business and set up a better sales stand

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
Hello. My name is Dulce and I am an entrepreneur. I own and operate a small business selling toys and plastic products. I also design and create jewelry. I have dedicated myself to my businesses for several years and they help provide income that allows me to help cover my family’s expenses. With the holiday season fast approaching and being that this is the time of year in which I experience an increase in sales, I would like to increase my inventory. Currently, I am in negotiations to purchase the building in which my store is located from the current owner.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Dulce mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de Juguetes, productos plasticos y tambien a la elaboración de joyas, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, tomando en cuenta que se aproxima la epoca de navidad necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que es la espoca de mayor venta, actualmente estoy en planes de comprar este local donde tengo mi negocio ya que la dueña lo esta vendiendo.

loans.use:
Purchase of toys, home appliances, plastic goods, and material for making jewelry

Compra de juguetes, electrodomesticos, produstos plasticos y material para elaborar joyas.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Rosibel. My principal activity is the sale of new clothing, which I distribute by traveling and taking orders. I have several years of experience in this type of activity, which generates income for me to contribute to family expenses and other commitments to suppliers. Thanks to this business, I can give an education to my children since resources are scarce and every day the situation is more difficult. Presently, my children are in high school.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Rosibel, mi Actividad principal es la venta de ropa nueva la que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por encargo, cuento con varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para colaborar con los gastos familiares y otros compromisos con los proveedores, gracias a las utilidades que me genera este negocio puedo dar educación a mis hijos ya que somos de escasos recursos y la situación cada dia es mas dificil, actualmente mis hijos estan pasando la secundaria.

loans.use: Purchase of men's pants, tennis shoes, women's blouses, rubber boots, underwear, jackets, and a camera.

loans.name: Reina  De Los Angele

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Maria de los Angeles. I make and sell tortillas for a living. I work out of my small home business. I have three years of experience in this field. Thank God this business generates enough income for my family’s expenses. Our economic status has improved thanks to this business, giving our children the opportunity to pursue their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Mi nombre es Maria de los Angeles, mi actividad principal es la elaboración y de venta de tortillas, cuento con un pequeño negocio en mi casa de habitación, tengo tres años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que gracias a Dios me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia, gracias este negocio nuestra situación economica ha mejorado, dando a nuestros hijos la oportunidad de estudiar.

loans.use: Buying corn, sugar, and firewood.

loans.name: Maria Domitila

texts.es:
My name is Maria Domitila. My main activity is the flour tortilla sale and elaboration. I distribute these by order or as a traveling saleswoman. I have several years working in this business in which I earn my income to cover my family expenses. I am a single mother and I have a son. With this business I have been able to provide education to my son. I wil continue to support my son because my greatest desire is to help him obtain a college degree.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria Domitila, mi actividad principal es la venta y elaboración de tortillas de harina, las que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por encargo, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, soy madre soltera y tengo un hijo y con este negocio he dado educación a mi hijo actualmente esta pasando la secundaria pienso apoyarlo hasta el ultimo momento, mi mayor deseo es lograr que mi hijo obtenga un titulo universitario.

loans.use: Purchase Machine to make Tortillas, flour, butter and soda water

loans.name: Sandra Del Rosario

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Sandra del Rosario and my main activity is producing and selling "Baleadas" (a sort of pancake). My business is located in a gas station and I've been doing this for 2 years now. It allows me to contribute with the expenses of my family and to honour the commitments with the suppliers. Nowadays, my priority is to purchase a bigger tent and a table because the demand is growing every day and the space is pretty small.

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Mi nombre es Sandra del Rosario, mi actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de Baleadas ( productos para consumo humano), ubicado en una de las gasolineras de mi ciudad, cuento con 2 años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores, actualmente mi prioridad en la compra de una carpa mas grande y una mesa ya que cada dia la demanda es mayor y el espacio es muy pequeño.

loans.use: Purchase of a tent, a table, flour, butter and chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in merchandise and buy a display case

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a display case and more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stove and more merchandise

loans.name: I Komang Mertajiwa

texts.id:
I Komang Mertajiwa lives in a very basic house made of gedek and dirt floor. I Komang Mertajiwa supports his family by plating vegetable in a 35 acre land. With the help form his wife Desak Putu Pujawati they work on this since 1999. They had to stop because they use their capital to put their children to school. But 2 years ago they came back to this business on a borrowed capital. In 30 acres of land the plant long beans, and the cost for 3 months operations for insecticides and fertilizers is Rp. 2.750.000 while the profit is only Rp. 5.400.000, to get a higher profit they have to go to a bigger town to sell their product. Even though is not easy, Mertajiwa keep striving on because his children are still schooling, where one of their child is still in primary while another just started secondary, which will incur more cost for them.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Tinggal di rumah yang sangat sederhana dengan dinding gedek dan masih beralaskan lantai tanah , I Komang Mertajiwa menghidupi kelurganya hanya dari hasil berkebun sayur-sayuran yang di tanam di tanah sakapan ( mengerjakan tanah orang lain dengan bagi hasil ) seluas 35 Are. Dengan dukungan dari Desak Putu Pujawati, istrinya, Komang Mertajiwa telah menekuni pekerjaannya ini sejak tahun 1999,walau sebelumnya sempat terhenti karena modalnya di pergunakan untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya. Namun sejak 2 tahun terakhir Komang Mertajiwa kembali memulai usahanya dengan menggunakan modal pinjaman, dan tanaman yang di tanam pun masih jenis sayur – sayuran yaitu sayur kacang panjang . Dari sekitar 30 Are tanah yang ditanami kacang panjang Mertajiwa menghabiskan modal untuk beli bibit, pupuk , obat-obatan dan juga biaya oprasional lainnya sebesar Rp. 2.750.000,- / periode masa tanam ( 3 bulan ) . Sedangkan untuk hasil panen yang di dapat dalam satu periode adalah Rp. 5.400.000,- Untuk mendapatkan harga pasaran yang lebih tinggi, hasil kebunnya langsung di jual ke pasar umum yang ada di kota Negara. Bahkan kadang –kadang Mertajiwa juga mengambil hasil panen petani lain yang kemudian di jual lagi ke pasar sebagi penghasilan tambahan . Meski sangat melelahkan , Mertajiwa tetap semangat dan tekun dalam bekerja mengingat tiga orang anaknya yang kini sudah bersekolah. Anaknya yang pertama di SMP dan dua orang lagi masih di bangku SD, yang tentunya membutuhkan biaya yang semakin besar. .

loans.use: Membeli bibit kacang panjang, pupuk, obat - obatan dan biaya perawatan - To buy seed for long beans and fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase merchandise sales

loans.name: Selemena

texts.en: Selemena is a new member of the Samusu P Centre borrowing group.  She is 18 years old and is living with her parents, sisters, and brothers.  Over the years they lived and worked on their plantation to maintain an income.  She felt sorry for her father who had to work in very bad weather cleaning and weeding the plantation, which is very hard manual labor.  Selemena thought of getting a loan to buy equipment to help him perform these difficult tasks.  She is very thankful for this opportunity to develop her business and her family living.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suliati

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Suliati started selling krupuk ceker ayam ( a type of local chicken crackers made of chicken claws) since 1982. She makes them from her home. She lives with her husband and two children. Her daily income from this is Rp 50.000,00. Due to daily expenses of Rp 10.000,00 and her child's monthly expenses of 250.000,00 forces her to work and her husband income of Rp 300.000,0 is insufficient. Even though with the current price inflation and the epidemic of bird flu has not stop her. She knows that her chicken that she use is free from any sickness, and her customers keep on coming back for more. She has manage to put her children to school with this. To expand her business, she wants to buy better chicken claws.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard , Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut Suliati menekuni usaha jual krupuk ceker ayam sejak tahun 1982. Tempat usahanya adalah rumahnya sendiri. Dia tinggal bersama suami dan dua orang anaknya. Keuntungan yang diperoleh dari usaha ini mencapai Rp 50.000,00/hari. Biaya hidup Rp 10.000,00/hari dan biaya pendidikan anaknya Rp 250.000,00/bulan mengharuskan dia berkerja. Penghasilan suami yang Rp 300.000,00/bulan sebagai guru honorer tentu tidak mencukupi. Harga barang naik dan masalah flu burung yang beredar tidak membuatnya menghentikan usaha ini. Dia mengerjakannya sendiri dan dia tahu bahwa ayam yang dia pakai sehat. Selain itu, banyak pelanggan yang memintanya untuk tetap memproduksi krupuk ceker ayam tersebut. Suliati bisa menyekolahkan kedua anaknya melalui usaha ini. Usaha ini ingin dia kembangkan. Pinjaman yang dia peroleh akan dia gunakan untuk membeli ceker – ceker ayam lebih optimal.

loans.use: Membeli ceker – ceker ayam. To buy chicken claws as raw material.

loans.name: Solema

texts.en: Solemna E. is newly married, and has just moved to a new home. Her husband spends his days working as a farmer. Solema and her husband work hard cleaning and weeding their farming area. She heard about the local microfinancing organization through some village women, and this will be her second loan. She will use the $300 dollar loan to buy tools for farming. Solema is also planning to start a mini market in the village so she can sell their crops. Mrs. E. will repay the loan over 18 months.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Siaivao

texts.en: Siaivao is one of the oldest members for Vailoa Aleipata Centre. She is 65 years of age and married with two grown children. This will be Siaivao’s second loan with SPBD, and she is very thankful for the opportunity to develop her family business. With her second loan Siaivao is looking forward to growing more crops in addition to taro, and she is planning to export her crops overseas so that she might earn more money to support her family.

loans.use: To buy weed-killing chemicals, fertilizers, and other supplies for her plantation.

loans.name: Faataape

texts.en: Faataape is a 60 year old mother. She also has 7 delightful grandchildren. She has lived in Vaovai all her life with husband and her children. Faataape's family has lived on a plantation for their main source of income. For many years, they have been doing  arduous work including cleaning, weeding, and trying to clear the area. She used to buy weed-killing chemicals, fertilizers, as well as many other products. Unfortunately, they have had hard times and still continue to take their time when cleaning a small area. This is Faataape's second loan. She will also spend time buying supplies for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en: Lusia F. is 50 years old, married with 6 children. She had been running her canteen for almost two years. Lusia's canteen sells donuts, drinks, German buns, etc., in her village’s primary school. Lusia is a new member for Saleilua Centre. Over the years Lusia always wanted to have a proper place for her canteen. She decided to join SPBD so that she could get some money to do this.  Lusia is planning to build a proper place for her canteen and to be able to sell other varieties of food.

loans.use: To buy supplies and inventory for her canteen business

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sueli

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Sueli, is 49 and a mother, She has a stall selling tidbits and gado-gado ( a type of local delicacy) located at Manistutu town. Sueli started her business 5 years ago with a capital of Rp 500.000. Initially she started selling only gado-gado, but with her diligent hardwork, she has increase to cater other varieties as well. She start from 7 in the morning and ends at 9pm in the evening. Sueli reaps a profit of Rp 65.000, mainly from her gao-gado sales, because she has regular customers for them. However she is unable to cope with the demand due to lack of cash flow. With the financial help from Dinari, Sueli has increase her varieties to cater drinks and other necessities as well. Now she has more profit then before and is very thankful, because it has it has increase the wellness of her family.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Wayan Sueli seorang ibu yang sudah berusia 49 tahun, mempunyai usaha warung makanan ( Menjual gado-gado, es dan makanan ringan ) yang berlokasi di desa Manistutu. Sueli memulai usahanya sejak 5 tahun lalu dengan modal Rp 500.000,- . Menjual Gado - gado ( makanan yang terbuat dari ketupat yang dicampur sayuran dengan bumbu kacang ) adalah awal mulainya usaha warung Sueli. Karena ketekunannya berusaha, kini warung kecil itu telah berubah menjadi sebuah warung cukup besar untuk ukuran di desanya dengan jenis makanan yang lebih bervariasi. Memulai buka warung dari pukul 07:00 pagi sampai dengan pukul 21:00 malam, Sueli mampu meraup keuntungan sebesar Rp 65.000,- terutama dari penjualan gado - gadonya yang memiliki rasa yang khas dan banyak di sukai oleh para pelanggan. Usaha Sueli berkembang dengan cepat karena makananya enak dan di dukung juga tempat yang bersih dan yang tak kalah pentingnya juga harganya yang bersaing . Karena usahanya sudah memiliki banyak pelanggan, Sueli merasa kewalahan untuk melayani permintaan pelanggannya karena usahanya kekurangan modal. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, sekarang Sueli sudah melengkapi variasi dagangannya dengan berbagai jenis makanan / minuman ringan dan juga barang –barang kebutuhan sehari - hari lainnya sehingga semua kebutuhan pelanggannya tersedia. Sekarang ini, Sueli mendapat keuntungan yang lebih banyak dari sebelumnya dan Sueli merasa sangat bersyukur, karena hal itu dapat meningkatkan kesejahteraan keluarganya.

loans.use: Melengkapi fasilitas warungnya dengan menyediakan aneka jenis barang kebutuhan sehari-hari,mulai dari makanan dan minuman ringan sampai keperluan untuk dapur - To increase facilities of her stall and add more varieties of food and drinks.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: I am 39 years old and married with one child. My husband used to work for one of the government department in the town area. Unfortunately, when he got sick of asthma, he resigned from his job. We have struggled so hard to find a better life not only for us, but for our child as well. We have saved over the years, and we bought a taxi.  I drive during the week days, but on the weekends my younger brother drives. This is my first loan with SPBD and I am confident that my business will do well in future.

loans.use: To buy parts for her taxi

loans.name: Ni Komang Wiriasih

texts.id:
Wiriasih is a diligent worker. As a cocoa trader, she has to visit cocao farmer's under the hot sun. She has been doing this for the past 3 years. With a capital of Rp 500.000 from her husband Nengah Suarya, Wiriasih starts work from 10 in the morning till 3 in the afternoon. With that little capital she can only buy up to 50kg of goods which is Rp 10.000 per kg, and she sell to the distributor at Rp 10.500. She has a profit of Rp 25.000. She often loses to other competing trader who has bigger buying capacity. However with Dinari's financial assistance, she can buy more goods and has gain trust of regular customers and distributors. With this, she has increase her profits few fold, and manage to support her husband in raising their only child I Putu agus Setiawan who is still schooling.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Wiriasih, seorang wanita yang sangat ulet dalam melakukan pekerjaannya. Sebagai Dagang kakao yang harus berkeliling dari satu rumah ke rumah para petani yang memiliki pohon kakao, Wiriasih juga berjuang melawan teriknya panas matahari dengan berjalan kaki. Ini sudah merupakan resiko pekerjaan yang sudah di tekuninya sejak 3 tahun yang lalu . Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp 500.000,- yang di dapat dari I Nengah Suarya suaminya ,Wiriasih memulai aktifitasnya dari pukul 10.00 sampai pukul 15.00 setiap harinya. Dengan modal yang sangat terbatas itu Wiriasih hanya dapat membeli barang dagangan sebanyak 50 kg dengan harga pembelian rata-rata Rp 10.000,-/ kg dan oleh Wiriasih di jual lagi kepada pengepul Rp 10.500,-dengan demikian keuntungan yang di peroleh Wiriasih Sebesar Rp 25.000,- .Wiriasih sering merasa kewalahan dalam membeli barang milik petani sehingga kalah bersaing dengan pedagang lain yang memiliki modal lebih besar. Dengan tambahan modal yang di dapat dari pinjaman di Dinari , Wiriasih kini Sudah dapat membeli barang dagangan yang lebih banyak dan Wiriasih tak takut lagi bersaing dengan pedagang yang lain karena disamping modal , Wiriasih juga telah memiliki pelanggan tetap dan yang terpenting bagi Wiriasih adalah modal kepercayaan di berikan oleh petani maupun pengepul tempat Wiriasih menyerahkan barang dagangannya. Keuntungan yang di peroleh Wiriasih pun kini kian berlipat ganda sehingga Wiriasih dapat membantu suaminya dalam membiayai pendidikan I Putu agus Setiawan Anak tunggalnya yang kini telah duduk di bangku SMA.

loans.use: Menambah modal usaha sehingga bisa membeli lebih banyak kakao - To increase capital to buy more cocoa goods.

loans.name: Fetaiai

texts.en: Fetaiai is 42 years old, is married and has 5 children. The family has lived on their plantation for ages as it is their only source of income. Fetaiai heard of SPBD through the women in the village. She is thankful for the opportunity given to her because she can use the loan money to buy tools that are needed on the plantation. Fetaiai is planning to open a farm stand in her village where she could sell her crops.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Ni Ketut Westu

texts.id:
Since the demise of her husband almost 6 years ago, Ni Ketut Westu, had taken the role of both mother and father. Even since then, already 49 years old, had to struggle alone, to maintain the household’s economic condition. By baking cakes and selling them around the village, Ketut Westu fulfilled the entire family’s livelihood. Daily, Ketut Westu needs funding of Rp 150.000 (USD16), to purchase raw materials making baking cakes, which she does herself from 5:00 in the morning to 9:00 and after that sell them around the village. Profit attained by Ketut Westu ranges between Rp 30.000 (USD3) to 35.000 (USD4) daily. Ketut Westu has many customers as her cakes besides being tasty have a unique shape that it becomes a special attraction. With the additional capital from DINARI now Ketut Westu not only bake cakes to be sold by her, she also supply to orders or stores. From the outcome of this effort, Ni Ketut Westu is able to sustain and improve on the family’s economic condition.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Melakoni peran ganda sebagai seorang ibu sekaligus ayah telah di lakukan Ni Ketut Westu hampir 6 tahun lamanya sejak ditinggal meninggal oleh suaminya. Dan semenjak itu pula wanita yang telah berumur 49 th ini harus berjuang sendirian untuk meneruskan perekonomian rumah tangganya. Dengan membuat kue dan dijual berkeling di kampungnya, Ketut Westu memenuhi seluruh kehidupan keluarganya. Dalam sehari Ketut Westu memerlukan modal Rp. 150.000,- untuk membeli bahan –bahan membuat kue yang di kerjakan sendiri dari pukul 05:00 pagi sampai pukul 09 :00 untuk selanjutnya dijual keliling di sekitar desanya. Keuntungan yang di peroleh Ketut Westu per hari berkisar antara Rp. 30.000,- s/d Rp. 35.000,- . Ketut Westu memiliki banyak pelanggan karena kue yang di buat disamping rasanya yang enak juga memiliki bentuk yang unik dan lucu sehingga menjadi daya tarik tersendiri. Dengan tambahan modal dari Dinari kini ketut Westu tidak saja membuat kue untuk di jualnya sendiri tetapi juga bisa melayani pesanan atau juga menitipkan kue –kuenya di warung-warung . Dari hasil usaha inilah Ni Ketut Westu bisa bertahan hidup dan menanggung perekonomian keluarganya.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for making cake (Membeli bahan - bahan untuk membuat kue)

loans.name: Ni Kadek Mandasari

texts.id:
Mandasari has been very involved in running her food mart since she married I Putu Arnawa five years ago. With an initial working capital of 1,000,000 IDR (1USD ~9,000 IDR) and a very humble food mart shack, Kadek Mandasari began her business by selling vegetables, ice and other kitchen needs. Her food mart business was growing everyday. Her patience and hard working in serving customers wins her more customers. Unfortunately with her limited capital she could not meet all of her customers demand. Mandasari opens her shop from 7AM to 8PM and earns 35,000 IDR of profit per day Mandasari wants to improve her service's quality by adding more merchandising items. With the loan from Dinari, Mandasari purchases many type of new merchandising items such as instant noodle, soap, detergent and other snacks. With the increase in the merchandising items Mandasari could double her daily profits to 70,000 IDR. The profit will help her family's prosperity since her husband only works as a traditional farmer.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli aneka makanan dan minuman ringan,mie instan, sabun cuci dan keperluan dapur

loans.name: Leitioa

texts.en: Leitioa is a 47 year old mother. She is married with one, lovely child. In the past, Leitioa used to work for one of expensive hotels in her country. When her mother passed away last year, she resigned from her job to care for her sick father. She had many struggles, especially with her financial situation. After her father passed, she left working on her family’s plantation because she then had no one to look after, but having no one to rely on, she has decided to turn her plantation once again. Her first loan she spent on the plantation, and with her second loan she has more plans for her growing plantation. Her husband is looking after, and they are one of the most happy couples in their area. Leitioa's is also getting money at least twice a week from selling her taros.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Lesa

texts.en: I am 57 years old and married with four children, who are all married and live on their own. I have always had a hard time looking after them, and our plantation paid for their school fees and helps support our family.  My husband is looking after the plantation, with the help of some of the family relatives. I am delighted to have the opportunity of improving the lives of my family because of this small loan for supplies I need.

loans.use: To buy weed-killing chemicals, fertilizers, and other supplies for my plantation

loans.name: Seupepe

texts.en: Seupepe is a single mother of four children. She is having a difficult time raising her children especially in terms of money. Seupepe's family lived on a plantation which was their only source of income. This will be Seupepe's second loan and she has been putting her first loan to good use. Seuppepe is requesting a $500 loan to buy supplies for her taro plantation. a Seupepe is also planning to start a cattle farm in the future, which she believes will become a strong family business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her taro plantation

loans.name: Fetoai

texts.en: Fetoai is 38 years old and married with 4 children.  Her husband is a farmer who cares for their plantation.  Fetoai has always had a hard time raising her children, and to take care of them when they are sick.  They have worked hard over the years.  This is Fetoai's 4th loan with SPBD and with her loans she has been able to do so much good for the family. With the loan she will be able to purchase equipment needed for the plantation.  It will help to bring in a profit, and to support the family.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Saipolua

texts.en: Saipolua is the oldest member of Malie Centre.  She is 70 years of age, and a widow with 6 children and 24 grandchildren.  Before her husband passed away, he loved working in their plantation. Apart from that he had a pig farm. This is something Saipolua treasured very much, when her husband died. She wants to make sure everything he sweated for is maintained. This is Saipolua's first loan with SPBD and she has so many plans of what she would like to do with the money when she receives it.  She is a very fit mother, extremely hard working, and she has always believed that hard work is the key to long life.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her barbecue business

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: I am only 18 years old and single, but I have always been very supportive of my mother and her younger brothers.  I am is the eldest of 5 children.  My father passed away two years ago, and he left my mother and her four brothers.  I left school at the age of 16 because my mother is had a hard time paying my high school fees.  My mother is also a member of Malie J Centre, and through her loan with SPBD she started her own canteen business. I also would like to receive a loan for my barbeque business so I can support my mother and her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her barbecue business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa is a 51 year old mother of 5 children. Luisa and her family have had a plantation for ages. After working hard for many years, they also now own a cocoa and nonu plantation. This is Luisa's second loan, she is very thankful for the chance to improve the standard of living for her family. Luisa will spend the loan to buy weed-killing fertilizers, and other supplies for her plantation. She plans to expand her nonu plantation because it is in high demand.

loans.use: To buy weed-killing chemicals, fertilizers, and other supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en: Fenumiai is 60 years old, a widow, and a grand mother of twelve. She has been running her flea market for almost two years. Fenumiai always supports her children even during tough times. This is her 4th loan but she only wants $750 to expand the place. She is one of the happiest mother in Malie Centre, and her business is running good. She also has something to occupy her time as she always works hard at what she does.

loans.use: To buy inventory and supplies for her flea market business

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira I. lives in Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan. She is 35 years old, married and has two children. She and her husband are engaged in cattle-breeding. She started her business 10 years ago. She borrowed three loans from Normicro and increased the number of her cows. Now she needs $600 to buy another cow.

loans.use: To buy one cow to expand her cattle breeding business.

loans.name: Leagaioalii

texts.en: Leagaioalii is 35 years and old married with four children.  She had a difficult time raising them, especially when it came to paying their school fees. Fortunately it did not stop her from trying so hard to make a better living for her family. She heard of SPBD through other village women.  She decided to join so that she could develop her business into a better one. This is her first loan and she is one happy mother who has always wanted a chance like this to develop her business.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her ice cake business

loans.name: Gul

texts.en: I am Gul Z. and I moved to Lahore, second largest city of Pakistan, from a small mountainous town after my marriage. I live in a little rented house with my husband and five children. I understand the importance of education and therefore I have enrolled all of my children in school except the youngest two who are too small to go to school. I make decorative tassels for jewelry whereas my husband runs an electric appliances shop. Together we are able to make $200 a month. My husband does not have a complete range of appliances at his shop and so many of his customers' requests are turned down. We want to fulfill our customers' needs and that takes more product variety. This will cost us US$ 550. Expanding our business this way will leave us with sizeable profits which we will save to buy a house of our own.

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala is a married mother of 53 years of age. She has 6 children and 4 grandchildren. Her husband was a fisherman, and from fishing they managed to pay for her children’s school fees and slowly develop her family home.

Her husband used to fish using spears. He has always wanted to have a fishing boat to make it easier. She heard of the programme through other women of the Centre and she was very excited to join so she could get a loan to buy what her husband wanted. Kalala is hoping that one day she will be able to buy a bigger boat so her husband can catch more per trip.

loans.use: To buy fishing boat

loans.name: Emelya

texts.en: Emelya I. lives in Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan. She is 43 years old, married and has three children. She is engaged in cattle-breeding. Her husband helps her at her business. Emelya applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount $950. She wants to buy one cow.

loans.use: To buy one cow for cattle-breeding business.

loans.name: Iasinta

texts.en: Iasinta is a mother of 52 years of age, married with 6 children. She had been doing sewing which she learned from her mother when she was only 20 years of age. Through her sewing she is able to send her children to school and pay for their school fees. Even though it was not enough but she tried so hard to save money for her children. Iasinta heard of SPBD through the village women and she thought to be a great chance to get some money so she could improve her business.

loans.use: To replace her old sewing machine

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.en: Hikmat J. lives in Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan. He is 30 years old and is single. He is engaged in cattle-breeding. Hikmat has five years of experience at this business. He wants to buy one cow, which is why he has applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $500.

loans.use: To expand cattle breeding business.

loans.name: Tavalea

texts.en:
Tavalea T. is 40 years old, married with 7 children. Her husband works for one of the supermarkets in town. His weekly salary is not sufficient to support her family. In addition to his job, her husband has a pineapple farm. Every day after work he works on the farm with their children.

Tavalea decided to do something for herself and to occupy her time. Pancake was the business she chose. Families around her village buys them for breakfast especially on Sundays, and she is also close to the village school. Tavalea is a very hard working mother and with her first loan she wants to make sure she will use it wisely and to develop her business to another level.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pancakes business

loans.name: Oli Tupu

texts.en:
Oli is 30 years old married without a child. Her husband works for one of the local companies in town. Oli lived with her mother and brothers. Her father died six months ago and her bothers are now attending high schools and her mother is having a hard time paying for their school fees.

Oli's husband's weekly salary is not enough to support them so she decided to try a small business to help her family and to occupy her time. She heard of SPBD through the village women and it was a great chance for her to develop something for herself as well.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her popcorn business

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en: Evelina has lived in Nonoa Saleimoa for almost 10 years. She is married with 6 children. She joined SPBD nearly 5 years ago and she is one of the old members of the Nonoa Centre. Evelina learned sewing from her mother when she was only 15 years old. Having so many children to support, Evelina used her sewing to earn money. This is Evelina's 5th loan with SPBD and she is doing very well. She is planning to do elei printing and to start a flea market in her village.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Ilo

texts.en:
Ilo is 38 years old, married with 6 children. Her husband is a farmer. Over the years they have had a hard time in cleaning their farm, especially weeding. They sell vegetables in the market and sometimes in the village, but sometimes its hard because people do not buy much in a day. Through hard work and struggling, Ilo and her family have managed to look after their vegetables well using the right chemicals to keep away the insects.

Ilo is a happy mother and she is always thankful for such a great opportunity given by SPBD so that she can improve her garden.

loans.use: To buy weed-killing chemicals, fertilizers, and other supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Onoiva

texts.en:
Onoiva L. is a mother of 38 years of age, married with 7 children. Her husband is a carpenter and his salary is not sufficient to support the whole family. Onoiva also lives with her parents and she is also supporting them. She is having hard time, but she tries her best to support her family.

Onoiva decided to do something for herself, not only to support her family but to earn money for herself. Onoiva is planning to run a canteen in the village school and to sell more varieties of ice cakes to the children.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her ice cake business

loans.name: Ni Wayan Palem

texts.id:
The prolonging economic crisis has been causing the price hike on many products, including animal feed. Ni Wayan Palem, who has been doing pig farming for a long time, at times was unsure about its sustainability and almost gave up. His husband's income as a farmer was very minimal and seasonal. She tried many different jobs to make ends meet. In this tough situation she is determined to stick with pig farming. DINARI is her hope to help with her problem with animal feed's cost. She hopes to use the loan to purchase the animal feed as well as to purchase more hogs. She hopes to expand her pig farming business. The profit from her business will be used to cover her family's basic needs and for her two children's education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed and more sows.

loans.name: Sefulu

texts.en: Sefulu is 26 years old and recently married with one child. Sefulu's husband is a teacher in one of the village schools. His salary is not enough to support them, so Sefulu decided to join SPBD. Her parents used to run a shop but they are very old, so Sefulu is taking over.  Having a small shop, Sefulu decided to apply for a loan so she could expand the shop and buy more goods so that her business can progress well.

loans.use: To buy supplies and inventory for her shop

loans.name: Otila

texts.en: Otila L. is 41 years old married with 6 children. Her husband is a farmer and he is looking after their vegetable garden. With the help of her children they have developed well and they are also earning good money.Through the income from their garden, Otila sends her children to school and pay for their school fees.This is her 5th loan with SPBD and she has been very thankful for such a great chance so she can improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Osana

texts.en: Osana T. is 36 years of age, married with 5 children. Her husband works for a building company in town. Her husband’s salary is not enough to support their family. Osana decided to do something to support the family and to occupy her time. Having lived in the village for a long time, and also living close to the school, she decided to start an ice cake business. Her business is running well and Osana is a happy mother in the Levi Center. She is earning good money and she is developing her family and building an outdoor bathroom and washing place for the family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her ice cake business

loans.name: Lili'a

texts.en: Lili'a is a mother of 42 years of age, married with 7 children. Her husband works for one of the hotels in town. Unfortunately his salary is not enough to support them. Lilia thought of doing something so she could earn some money instead of relying on her husband. Selling pancakes from her home was easy for her, and many people buy pancakes, especially for breakfast. Lilia is thankful for being allowed to borrow from SPBD so that she can now earn money and buy whatever she needs.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pancake business

loans.name: Saloto

texts.en: Saloto is 59 years old, married, and has 7 children. Her family has been living on a plantation for quite some time, and that was their only source of income. Because Saloto and her husband have so many children to look after, Saloto’s husband decided to find a carpentry job in the surrounding area. However, Saloto and her children still must clean and clear the area to plant more crops to continue to support their family. This will be Saloto’s 5th loan, and she hopes that with it she can continue to maintain a happy family. She will use the money to buy supplies for her plantation.

loans.use: To buy weed-killing chemicals, fertilizers, and other supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Valelia

texts.en:
Valelia is 41 years of age and married with 4 children. Her husband is unemployed, but he has a small farm. He is a very hard working man who always puts his family first.

The family earns income from their garden. Therefore, Valelia would like a oan to buy equipment for the garden. Through the years of hard work, the family has been able to save and live where they are now. This will be Valelia's 4th loan with SPBD. She is very thankful for this opportunity, which helps her to develop her business and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Paneta

texts.en: Paneta is the Centre Chief for Moataa Centre. She is 62 years of age and a widow with 5 children and 24 grandchildren. Paneta used to be a teacher, but when her husband died she decided to stay home to look after the family shop. Her two older sons migrated to New Zealand and some of her grandchildren are looking after her and the shop. Through her loans with SPBD she had been expanding her home and helping to support her grandchildren in school. Paneta is very happy and very thankful for this opportunity to receive a loan to help her family.

loans.use: To expand her shop and to renovate her home

loans.name: Vezir

texts.en: Vezir A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan. He is married and has three children. He repairs cars at his home. He has 10 years experience at this job. He has applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan of $400 he needs to buy equipment for his business.

loans.use: To expand  car repair business.

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Ardiani

texts.id:
Gusti Ayu Ardiyani is a hard working woman. In her increasingly difficult time, her income as a labor in a furniture shop was not enough to cover her family's (a husband and two school aged children ) needs. She then decided to try pig farming. With the program from DINARI, she received a loan and training for raising pigs properly. With the fund Gusti Ayu purchased two sows. Each sow will be producing 8-10 piglets (sold for 250,000 IDR each - 1USD ~ 9,000IDR) in six months. Two sows will be producing 16 piglets and revenue of 4,000,000 IDR in six months. After pig feed cost of 1,200,000 IDR Gusti Ayu will profit about 450,000 IDR per month. With the profit Gusti Ayu will be able to increase her family's income to cover the basic needs and her children's education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To purchase Sows

loans.name: Maya

texts.en: Maya G. lives in Beylagan, a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan. She is 49 years old, married and has three children. She sells breads in the Beylagan city bazaar. She is asking for a loan of $800 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand bread selling business.

loans.name: Lemafoe

texts.en: Lemafoe is 39 years old married with 7 children. She is the Centre Chief for Levili Tuvao. Her husband works for one building company in town and his salary is not sufficient to look after the family. Lemafoe is very hard working and she has never relied on her husband for support. She started off with a pancake business and now she is running a flea market. Lemafoe has sacrificed for many years and she believes that hard work is the key to success. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her flea market. She is very happy and very delighted by the opportunity offered by SPBD. She hopes to help her family and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies and stock for her flea market business

loans.name: Rena

texts.en: Rena M. lives in Beylagan, a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan. She is 53 years old, married and has five children. She is engaged in clothing sales in the Beylagan city bazaar. She started her business seven years ago. She needs $1,000 to expand her clothing sales business.

loans.use: To expand clothing sales business.

loans.name: Dewa Ayu Rai Arti

texts.id:
Dewa Ayu Rai Arti, a mother who operates a store all day out of her home. The profit from the store is insufficient to cover the family’s rising expenses. As a lady who would like to improve the family’s prosperity, she intends to start another different business. Dewi Ayu with her husband, Dewa Adnyana, decided to raise pigs. With this loan and training from DINARI, she purchased a mother pig and feed. From raising this pig for 6 months will produce 10 piglets that can be sold for Rp 250.000 (about USD30) each. In the 6 months, Dewa Ayu, will generate revenue from the sale of the piglets amounting to Rp 2.500.000 (about USD300) – generating a monthly profit of Rp 370.000 (USD40) for Dewa Ayu. Thus allowing Dewa Ayu to increase the family’s income for covering the family’s essentials especially the children’s education.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Dewa Ayu Rai Arti adalah seorang Ibu yang kesehariannya menjaga warungnya yang berada dirumahnya sendiri. Dari hasil penjualan warungnya belumlah cukup untuk membiayai kehidupan keluarganya yang semakin hari semakin meningkat. Sebagai seorang wanita yang ingin meningkatkan kesejahteraan keluarganya, ia ingin membuka usaha lain lagi. Dewa ayu bersama suaminya Dewa Adnyana memutuskan uantuk memelihara babi. Dengan bantuan pinjaman modal dan pelatihan dari DINARI, dia membeli seekor induk babi dan juga untuk membeli pakan ternak. Dari seekor induk babi yang dipelihara 6 bulan bisa melahirkan 10 ekor anak babi yang nanti dapat dijual dengan harga Rp. 250. 000.- / ekor. Dalam 6 bulan Dewa Ayu mendapat penjualan anak babi sebesar Rp. 2.500. 000.- Jadi Dewa Ayu Rai Arti mendapat peningkatan pendapatan sebesar Rp. 370.000.- / Bulan. Sehingga dengaan demikian Dewa Ayu dapat meningkatkan penghasilan keluarga untuk membiayai kebutuhan keluarga terutama untuk biaya sekolah anaknya.

loans.use: Purchase feed, supplies and mother pig (Membeli pakan ternak dan induk babi)

loans.name: Liliya

texts.en:
Liliya has a small shoe sales business located at the Barabashovo market in Kharkov, Ukraine. In business for seven years, she sells primarily women’s shoes. Liliya is single and supports herself almost entirely with her business. Her goal is to continue growing the business and she would eventually like to open another sales location.

Liliya has requested a loan of $1200 which will allow her to purchase additional shoe inventory. This will be her sixteenth loan from Nadiya Ukraine. She has proven to be an excellent loan client and we look forward to many more opportunities to help her with her business.

loans.use: Liliya would like to purchase more inventory for her shoe store.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old and she has 2 children. Her husband was injured in a terrorist attack last year so he has not been able to work since that time. This borrower is a hairdresser in Kirkuk and she has applied to get $1200 to purchase new furniture and a new mirror for her salon, and make renovations and do some advertising to increase her income and develop herself.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new furniture and new mirror

loans.name: Nurasat

texts.id:
Every day Nurasat carries his pull cart to the junkyard to buy junks to be recycled. He works from 7 am to 12 noon. He lives in West Wibisana road with her wife, in a trash collector compound. His house has walls and roof made of zinc, and dirt floor. He doesn't pay rent for his house. He has three children that lives in his hometown in Java. He has been paying his children's tuition from his earnings. Each month, he needs about $45 for his children's tuitions and about $2.5 per day for daily living expenses. He earns about $3.2 a day while his wife makes $55 a month. He needs a large amount of funds to be able to increase his profit. The loan will be used to increase his capacity to buy more junk to be resold for recycling.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Setiap hari Nurasat membawa rombong untuk tempat barang-barang rongsokan yang dibelinya. Dia melakukannya dari pukul 7 pagi – 12 siang. Dia tinggal di Jl. Wibisana Barat bersama isterinya - komplek pemulung - dengan atap dan temboknya dari seng, sedangkan lantainya dari tanah. Dia tidak mengeluarkan biaya untuk tempat tinggalnya. Dia memiliki tiga orang anak, ketiganya tinggal di Jawa. Selama ini ia membiayai sekolah anak-anaknya melalui usaha ini. Per bulan dia memerlukan Rp 400.000,00 untuk biaya pendidikan anak- anaknya dan Rp 20.000,00/hari untuk biaya hidup isteri dan dirinya. Keuntungan dari usaha ini Rp 30.000,00/hari. Penghasilan isteri Rp 500.000,00/bulan. Dia memerlukan modal yang besar untuk meningkatkan keuntungan per harinya. Pinjaman yang diperoleh akan sangat membantunya untuk menambah jumlah barang-barang rongsokan yang bisa dia beli.

loans.use: Purchase junk materials

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
A divorced mother who lives alone, Tamara depends on her shoe sales business to make ends meet for herself. She retired from her previous work and receives a pension, but it is not enough for her to live on. Ten years ago, she decided to start her own business in order to supplement her income. Tamara has gained much valuable experience over the years and has established a good reputation as a business owner. She understands her product very well and is always fair to her customers and co-vendors in the market.

Tamara has also been a good client with Nadiya Ukraine, having repaid ten different loans. She has requested an additional loan of $1000 to help purchase new shoe inventory for her business. In the future she hopes to make enough extra income so that she can make some repairs to the roof of her home. We are happy for this opportunity to further assist Tamara as she works to support herself.

loans.use: Tamara would like to purchase inventory for her shoe sales business.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina is a hard working business owner from the Kharkov region of eastern Ukraine. Married with a son and daughter, she has a small sales business aptly called “Everything for Women” which is located at the busy Barabashovo Rhinok (market) in Kharkov. In business for ten years, Valentina has a great location for her sales kiosk at a busy intersection in the market. She has requested a short term loan of $300 to cover rent for a month while her kiosk is being remodeled. Valentina has proven to be an excellent client with Nadiya Ukraine, paying back fourteen loans with no delays. This loan will allow her to continue meeting her rental obligations and be back in business quickly once her kiosk is finished.

loans.use: Valentina would like to cover her rent while her business kiosk is remodeled.

loans.name: Govser

texts.en: Govser N. lives in Beylagan, a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan. He is 50 years old, married and has four children. He owns a food market. He has 15 years experience in this business. His son helps him at his business. Govser needs $800 to expand his food market business.

loans.use: To expand his food market business.

loans.name: Slamet

texts.id:
Slamet has started his repair shop business since 1989 with 4 employees. Currently he has 16 employees. He earns about $220 net profit per month with daily living expenses of $5.50. The loan will be used to purhcase several equipment for his shop. Owning more comprehensive equipment inventories will help him repair more vehicles, which consequently may expand his customer base. He projects that the new equipments may increase his monthly earnings by $440 per month.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Usaha bengkel yang digeluti Slamet sejak tahun 1989 - dengan anak buah 4 orang – sudah berkembang. Saat ini dia memiliki 16 orang anak buah. Dalam sebulan dia bisa mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp 2.000.000,00 dengan biaya hidup per hari Rp 50.000,00. Pinjaman yang diperolehnya akan dia pakai untuk membeli beberapa peralatan bengkel. Peralatan yang lebih lengkap akan membantunya untuk memperbaiki lebih banyak kendaraan. Semakin banyak kendaraan yang dapat ia perbaiki akan menambah jumlah pelanggan yang ia miliki. Perhitungannya ke depan ia akan dapat menaikkan keuntungan per bulan sampai dengan Rp 4.000.000,00/bulan.

loans.use: Purchase tools and equipment

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan. He is 26 years old and married. He sells souvenirs in a marketplace. He started his business two years ago. He wants to increase the kind goods he sells. He has applied to Normicro Beylagan branch for a loan in the amount of $400 to do this.

loans.use: To expand souvenir selling business.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar H. lives in Beylagan, a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan. He is 49 years old, married and has three children. Eldar is engaged in cattle-breeding. He established his business 15 years ago. He wants to borrow a loan from Normicro to buy grass for his cows because it’s difficult to buy grass for cows in winter. Eldar needs $500 for his plans to feed his cows for the cold winter.

loans.use: To expand cattle breeding business.

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.id:
Ni Ketut S. and her husband, I Ketut Naku work as contract labor. The construction downturn makes her family's earnings low and uncertain. She tried many professions from gardener to transport labor but still cannot earn enough to fulfill her family's needs. However, Ni Ketut S. didn't give up easily. To solve her problems, Ni Ketut S. started a breeding and fattening pig farm. She is applying for a loan to be used for purchasing a breeding pig, growing piglets and feeds. She chose this business, as her calculation showed that farming slaughter pigs (slaughter cycle of 3 month), has fast cash cycle. So she can pay back the loan on time and supplement her family's income. From the profit, she plans to continue increase her farm population.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Ketut S. beserta suaminya I Ketut Naku, berprofesi sebagai Tukang. Sepinya pembangunan mengakibatkan pendapatan keluarga yang minim dan tidak menentu. Berbagai pekerjaan sempat ia jalani mulai dari pengolahan kebun hingga kuli panggul. Tetap saja tidak bisa memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Tetapi, Ni Ketut S. tidah mudah berputus asa dan menyerah. Untuk mengatasi semua permasalahan hidupnya, Ni ketut S. membuka usaha memelihara babi induk dan penggemukan. Walaupun dengan dana pinjaman, ia manfaatkan untuk membeli induk , bibit penggemukan dan sekaligus untuk membeli pakan ternaknya. Usaha ini dipilihnya karena perhitungannya dengan memlihara babi jenis babi guling ( 3 bulan panen ), perputaran dananya cepat sehingga ia akan dapat mengembalikan pinjaman tepat waktu dan bisa juga disihkan untuk keprluan keluarga. Dari keuntungan usaha tersebut ia berencana untuk terus meningkatkan populasi ternaknya.

loans.use: Purchase breeding pigs and pig feeds

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en: Shakir Y. lives in Beylagan, a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan. He is 47 years old, married and has two children. He repairs electronic parts of cars at his home. He is a good electrician. He needs $600 to buy spare parts for his business.

loans.use: To expand car repair business.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 27 years old he has 2 children, one of whom is going to school. He lives in a rented house. He has a mini-market south of Kirkuk. He has applied to get $1000 to purchase a new ice box and more new goods, and to make new shelves and paint the shop. He wants to expand his project and increase his income to provide a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new ice box and more new goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 34 years old woman living in Borj El Barajneh with her husband and her only child. Siham is helping her husband support the family by selling clothes and accessories from home. She needs $600 to buy enough merchandise and to eventually develop her business and open her own clothing shop. Siham is determined to provide for her child the best this world can offer and is therefore striving everyday to make sure he gets everything he needs.

loans.use: To buy merchendise (clothes and accessories) for her business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Business Description

Ms. Lourdes works buying and selling houseware such as: sets of glasses, sets of plates, sheets, sets of pots, sets of cups. Having 8 years of experience, she works every week, especially on holidays. Carrying her products from house to house, in places outside the city where she lives, thanks to her own efforts she has been able to keep her business going.

Loan Use

Lourdes is requesting this loan to buy more varied articles, such as blankets, washcloths, and plastic articles, to give her business more stock and more variety. With the clientele she already has, Lourdes sees the need to please her customers with their requests and worries, and thanks to the experience she has in this line of work she has been able to keep and satisfy them.

Personal Information

At present our friend Lourdes is 32 years old, and since she is a widow she alone keeps the business stable and growing, thanks to her own efforts. She has 3 children, 2 of whom are in school. With courage and force of will, Lourdes has kept her family together and her business stable with untiring effort. Her goal is to get ahead with her business and expand it much more, and in that way increase her capital for the wellbeing of her children and family.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Lourdes se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos para el hogar como: juego de vasos, juego de platos, sabanas, juego de ollas, juego de tazas. Teniendo como experiencia 8 años, su actividad la realiza todas las semanas, especialmente en días feriados. Entregando el producto de casa en casa, en lugares fuera de la ciudad de donde reside, entregando su mercadería en la que gracias a su propio esfuerzo ha podido mantenerse en el negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

Lourdes solicita el crédito para comprar más artículos especialmente variados como: cobijas, lavacaras, artículos plásticos que hagan ver a su negocio de una manera más surtida y variada. Por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener, Lourdes se ve en la necesidad de complacer a sus clientes con sus peticiones e inquietudes, que gracias a la experiencia que tiene en su actividad ha podido mantenerse y satisfacerlos.

Información Personal

En la actualidad nuestro amiga Lourdes tiene 32 años de edad, en donde es viuda de tal manera que sola mantiene el negocio estable y progresivo, gracias al esfuerzo que realiza en su actividad, tiene 3 hijos en donde 2 estudian. Con valentía y fuerza de voluntad Lourdes ha sabido mantener su familia unida y su negocio estable con un esfuerzo incansable. Los anhelos de Lourdes es salir con su negocio adelante y extenderlo mucho más y así incrementar su capital, por el bienestar de sus hijos, en si de la familia.

loans.use: To buy a variety of items for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a display case and merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise and a display case

loans.name: Hafez

texts.en: Hafez lives with his wife and their 2 lovely children in the Beirut suburb of Laylaki. He is 36 years old and is taking the initiative to use a loan so he can make his business more efficient. Hafez repairs car wheels and with new materials he can improve his productivity and therefore generate more revenues so he can increase his family livelihood.

loans.use: to buy the necessary material to enhance his productivity in fixing wheels

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad owns a grocery store in the Laylaki region, a suburb of Beirut. He is 50 years old and is a father of 3 children. Now that the school year has started, Ahmad needs a loan of 1200$ to be able to buy more merchandise and to be able expand his business so that he will be able to pay his children's tuition. Ahmad has come to a point where he is seriously planning to grow his business and a loan is a first step towards his goal.

loans.use: to buy more mechandise for the grocery shop and pay the children's tuition fees

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad, 39 years old, owns a hardware store in Borj El Barajneh, in the Beirut suburbs with his wife and his 3 children. With school starting the tuition feesl, books, stationary, etc. must all be provided. Mohamad needs 1200$ to buy enough merchandise to sustain his business and to pay his children's education expenses.
Mohamad and his wife are aware of the importance of a good education. His family is therefore striving to provide the best education possible for their 3 children.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and pay the school tuition fees of his children

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: Ruslan M. is a 33-year-old man who keeps and raises livestock and fodder in the small village near the Saatli region which is  situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Ruslan is married and has two sons. He started his business in 2007. Although he does not have  experience he works very hard. Ruslan started raising fodder for cattle and sells it to the local farmers. With the money he received for the fodder he purchased a calf and he is going to engage in the meat production business. For this purpose he has applied for 900 USD. This amount will help him to purchase three calves, raise them and sell them for meat to the local bazaar traders. The estimated cost for calf is 200-300 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase 3 calves

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna E. is 68 years old and lives in Benin City, in the Edo State of Nigeria. She is a married mother of seven children and has been a LAPO client for six years.

She sells goats in the market. She is seeking a loan of $275 to buy more goats for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Afe

texts.en:
Mrs. Afe O. is 39 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Benin City, in the Edo State of Nigeria.

She sells bread and akara to people living in her community. She intends to use the loan of $200 to buy bread and beans for akara and sales.

She has been in this business since 2003 and in LAPO as a leader of her union for the past six years.

loans.use: To buy more bread and bags of beans for making akara

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria E. is 50 years old, and a widow with two children. She has been selling provisions, foodstuffs and drinks since 2002; this is a trade that she learned from her uncle.

She has been with LAPO for the past four years. She intends to use the loan of US$350 to buy more kerosene, provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy A. is a very active and enterprising woman. She is married and has a child. She is 35 years old and lives in Benin City.

Joy started her own business selling provisions, phone cards, and foodstuffs seven years ago. She needs the loan of $400 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs, and phone cards for sale

loans.name: Pedro Dos Santos Din

texts.pt:
Pedro is single. He works at a private institution. Pedro joined the credit program this year. Pedro now rents but he wants to use this loan to build his own house for his future family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Pedro e solteiro e nao tem filhos. Ele e trabalhador de uma Instituicao Privada.Ele entrou para o Programa de credito ainda este ano. Ele vive numa casa alugada. Assim ele quer usar o dinheiro para construir a sua propria residencia, pois que um dia pensa em casar e constituir familia.

loans.use: Pedro wants to buy construction material

loans.name: Aduke

texts.en:
Aduke M. is married with five children. She is 37 years old and lives in Benin City, in the Edo State of Nigeria.

To improve her family’s quality of life, 15 years ago Aduke decided to start her own business selling food to people living in her community. She is in need of a $250 loan to enable her to buy foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana O. is an experienced businesswoman. She studied her business for three years and opened hers in the year 1993. She sells provisions.

She is 48 years old, has seven children and lives in Benin City, in the Edo State of Nigeria. She has been a LAPO client for the past three years. She is requesting $800 to enable her to buy more provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib Q. is a 30-year-old farmer who has a garden and raises vegetables. Sahib is an internally displaced person who fled from the Jabrail region to Bilasuvar during the Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict in 1993.  Currently Sahib lives with his big family in Bilasuvar 4th IDP Settlement. He has three sons. Sahib engaged in raising vegetables seven years ago when hunger knocked on his family's door. Sahib used to live in the IDPs campus, without the normal conditions for life, but seven years ago the government built settlements and provided them to IDPs with the free land for raising crops. Since that time Sahib began raising watermelon and melons and selling them in the local bazaar. Later he started to raise tomatoes, cucumbers, pepper, guinea squash (eggplant) and other vegetables. It brought him good income during those years and his family's needs were covered enough. But two years ago living in the village become harder.  His sons are growing up, they need more things every year; school supplies, clothes and shoes. Sahib has worked very hard to improve his family life, but it has not been easy. He decided to develop his business and start raising potatoes and onions. These vegetables are in very high demand all across Azerbaijan, and Sahib believes that 900 USD he has applied for, will help him to overcome his difficulties.

loans.use: Going to start raising potatoes and onions

loans.name: Esahe

texts.en:
Mrs. Esahe S. lives with her husband in Benin City, in the Edo State of Nigeria. She is 37 years old and mother of seven children.

She has been with LAPO for three years. She studied her fashion designing for three years, then opened her business in 1989. She also sells clothes to people living in her community. She is requesting $400 to enable her to buy more clothes and tailoring materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Mrs. Magdalene I. is 44 years old, married and the mother of five children. She lives in Benin City with her husband. She has been with LAPO for the past three years.

She sells firewood, garri and plantains. She buys the firewood in the morning and sells it to people. She wants to increase her stock; hence she applied for a $400 loan.

loans.use: To buy more firewood, garri and plantains

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a very active and enterprising woman. She is 44 years old and married to Mr. U. with six children.

In order to take care of her family, Florence started her own business selling drinks and palm oil six years ago. She is requesting a loan of $400, which will enable her buy more palm oil and drinks for sale. She plans to repay it in eight months.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and palm oil

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy E. is 42 years old and the married mother of five children. She’s one of the active members of LAPO.
