She has run a clothes, shoes, bags and jewelry business for four years. She wants to restock her shop for Christmas trade, so she is requesting $800 in order to purchase more clothes, shoes, bags and jewelry for sales. She lives in Benin City, in the Edo State of Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, bags & jewelry

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice E. is a married mother of seven children. She is 44 years old and lives in Benin.

To improve her family's quality of life, 18 years ago Eunice E. decided to start her own business of selling food and clothes and baking cakes, meat pies and other catering activities. She sells and supplies to schools and her neighbors.

Her quality of service has increased the number of her customers. In order to meet the demand from her customers, she needs a $325 loan to purchase catering material and foodstuffs. She is grateful for the opportunity to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and catering material

loans.name: Zamile

texts.en: Zamile A. is a 45-year-old woman who owns her small business in a small village near the Imishli region which situated in southern part of Azerbaijan. Zamile is married and has four children. She and her husband are unemployed, and Zamile turned her family life in positive way when she started raising fruits and selling them to the local bazaar traders. Bringing up four children is very difficult, especially in villages, but Zamile did not give up and trained her children to help her in gathering crops. Sometimes they go to the bazaar and sell fruits themselves.  As children grow up covering family needs become harder and harder every year. This year was very hard, since prices for products increased  three times, however  Zamile  has found out a new way to improve the situation again. She has applied for 1200 USD. With this loan she is going to expand her business and start raising new kinds of fruits like apples and pears. To start raise them she needs sprouts and fertilizer.

loans.use: Going to expand her business and start raising apples and pears

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah A. is an experienced businesswoman. She has five years of experience in this business and has been with LAPO for the past five years. She sells clothes.

She is 46 years old, married with three children, and she lives in Benin. Deborah's business has grown rapidly. In order to cover the demands of her customers and offer better service, she needs a loan of $400, which she will use to purchase more clothes for sale. She promises to repay this loan in 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen E. is an experienced businesswoman. She studied her business for three years before she decided to open her own. She sells provisions and drinks.

She is 45 years old, a married mother of seven children, and lives in Benin City, in the Edo State of Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for the past three years. She hopes to buy more provisions and drinks and increase her business turnover with the loan of $250.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice E. is a very active and enterprising woman. She is 40 years old, a married mother of three children, and lives in Benin.

In order to take care of her family, Eunice started her own business selling drugs 17 years ago. She studied her business for three years. She has been in LAPO as leader of her union for four years. She is requesting $400 to buy more drugs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more medicine

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Being a LAPO member is not a mistake for me. I have been with LAPO for four years as a secretary of my union. I hope to improve my business and standard of living for my family through the US$325 loan I have requested, says Mrs. Grace U., who has 17 years of experience in the business of selling foodstuffs and provisions. She is married and has four children, and lives in Benin City, in the Edo State of Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and provisions

loans.name: Enige

texts.en:
Enige S. is very active and enterprising woman. She is married to Mr. S.. She lives in Benin City, where she sells drugs and drinks to people living in her community.

Enige S. is requesting a loan of $400, and she plans to repay it in 8 months. She has three years of experience in the business; she has been a LAPO member for two years.

loans.use: To buy more medicine and drinks

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is 21 years old and already has his own barber shop. He is a very ambitious micro-entrepreneur who works hard to make it on his own. Hassan offers his services to the inhabitants of the neighboring area. Hassan lives in Baalbeck in the Bekaa regoin. Hassan wants to enhance his business and therefore needs $1000 to improve the decoration of his shop. He is aware that the image of a barber shop, and the comfort it presents, are as important as the services he offers.

loans.use: Improve the decoration of his barber shop

loans.name: Feyyaz

texts.en: Feyyaz A. is a 52-year-old man who raises and sells livestock for the meat production. Feyyaz lives in the southern region of Azerbaijan, Saatli. He is married and has four children. Feyyaz has eleven years of experience in raising livestock. He works very hard to cover his family's  needs. Besides raising livestock he works as woodsman and plowman. With the money he earned working on these jobs he purchased his first calf. Now he has one calf for raising, but it is not enough to feed the family and for other family expenses. Feyyaz has applied for 1200 USD to purchase four calves, with an estimated price of 300 USD for each.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves

loans.name: Gift

texts.en:
Mrs. Gift O. is an experienced businesswoman. Her business is trade of weavons, relaxes and phone cards. She fixes hair for people and braids hair. She began her salon business in 2005. According to her, she receives more profit from sales of weavons and phone call cards.

Today she has many customers and intends to buy more weavons, hair cream, hair attachments and phone cards. She is requesting $250. She is 26 years old, married with three children and she has been with LAPO for the past two years.

loans.use: To buy more weavons, relaxers and phone cards for sale.

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en:
Itohan I. is 32 years old and a married mother of three children who lives in Benin City with her husband.

She sells clothes and shoes and sews for people living in the community. She has been with LAPO for four years and has three years' experience in business. She is asking for the loan of $250 to buy more clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 26 years old, and lives in Baalbeck, Bekaa with his family. Mohamad is a car electrician, and the inhabitants of the town fix their cars at his shop. For more efficiency and productivity, Mohamad would like to purchase new and more adapted materials for his business. He would like a loan of $1200 to purchase the required tools. Mohamad needs to keep up with the local competition in order to sustain and further develop his own business. Mohamad has already borrowed three times, and has a very good history of timely repayment.

loans.use: Buy material for fixing cars

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
I am happy to be LAPO client, says Mrs. Helen U., who lives in Benin City, in the Edo State of Nigeria.

She has sold kerosene in wholesale and retail since 2001. She has been with LAPO for past two years, and, with the support of LAPO, she has been able to improve her business and help her family. With her requested loan of $250, she will purchase more kerosene for sale.

She is 47 years old and married with four children.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 43 years old and married with 3 children. She sells motor part to people living in her community and has been doing this for four years. Esther plans to increase her sales using the new loan of $175 to buy motor part for re-sale. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy more motor parts

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein, who is 40 years old, is married and is the father of 3 children.  They live in Baalback, in Bekaa.  He owns a blacksmith shop and fixes everything related to metal.  His clients come from the surrounding neighborhoods and are very pleased with Hussein's work.  Sustainability is what matters to Hussein and in order to keep up on the same level of professionalism he has committed himself to.  He wants to buy more advanced tools for his business. This is the first time that Hussein has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He heard about the Institution through word of mouth.

loans.use: Buy new tools for his blacksmith shop

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet O. is a 42 year old woman, married with 7 children and lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells provisions, rice and fish to people living in her community. She is hard working; her determination and discipline has enabled her to always repay her loan on time every week.  Juliet is requesting a loan of $325 to buy more provisions, foodstuff and fish.  She has been in this business since 1989 and has been in LAPO for the past 4 years

loans.use: To buy more provisions, food and fish

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. is 35 years old, married with 4 children, and lives in Benin City. Maria runs a foodstuff business which she started in 2002. She has always been an active and enthusiastic entrepreneur. She is requesting a loan of US$ 175 to increase her available capital. She believes that the profit she will be able to generate will not only help her keep a stable position in the market but will also offer a better livelihood for her children.

Maria has been a role mode of discipline, accuracy, and responsibility. Difficult family circumstances and ill-health have not hindered consistent growth in her business. We believe her hard work and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her little shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and 2 children in Bekaa. Ali supports his family by running a business of installing sanitary equipment. He needs to upgrade his tools to sustain his business to continue providing for his family. Ali is a very conscientious worker trying to persevere in his installation business. This is the 6th time Ali has requested a loan from Majmoua and he has an excellent history of repayment.

loans.use: Buy new tools for sanitary installations work

loans.name: Abuu

texts.en:
Abuu is a 45 year-old father of three children and owns a shop selling cosmetics. He has been in this business for the past five years. It has been growing steadily ever since.

His shop mainly sells ladies’ cosmetics and other lotions. Abuu wishes to expand his stock and open up another business since the cosmetic business is seasonal. He is in need of USD 750 to help him expand his business.

loans.use: To further grow the business

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 42 year-old mother of three children, residing in the Vituka area. She is a tailor and specializes in making couch set dressings as well as curtains. She prepares many of them, then sells them as a vendor in the nearby trading center.

She has been doing this business for the past seven years, and wishes to expand it. She plans to do this by purchasing a larger space to run the business and to also buy another tailoring machine. She is in need of USD 350 to help expand her business.

loans.use: To further expand business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 48-year-old mother of three, who sells Kanga and Vitenge, the traditional attire commonly worn by women in Tanzania and most sub-Saharan countries. She is currently selling her items as a street vendor but her dream is to obtain a permanent location for her business to stop the disturbance from the Dar es Salaam  city council,  which keeps relocating the vendors every now and then. Amina is in need of a $600 USD loan to help boost her business.

loans.use: To find a permanent location for her shop and expand her business

loans.name: Faysal

texts.en: FaysA. is a 46 year old man who lives with his wife and his 5 children in Bekaa.  FaysA. owns a grocery shop which is the main source of income for the family.  FaysA. plans to spend the loan money on inventory in order to expand his business and offer a bigger variety of products to his clients. This is the first time FaysA. has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. He heard about the Institution through word of mouth.

loans.use: Buy Inventory for his grocery shop

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 34-year-old mother of four and a resident of Tandika in Dar es Salaam. She has got a restaurant in Tandika area. She would like to expand her business into a bigger one ,buy more chairs and tables for her restaurant. Amina needs a loan of USD 300  to help her boost her business.

loans.use: expand her restaurant

loans.name: Abieyuwa

texts.en: Mrs. Abieyuwa E. is 33 years old, married mother of 5 children, and lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs to people living in her community. She has 10 years' experience in this business and has been with LAPO for the past 4 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 400 to enable her to buy a larger quantity and variety of foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her little shop

loans.name: Anjela

texts.en: Anjela is a 30-year-old mother of two and a resident of the Tandika Community, in Dar es Salaam. She runs a shop that sells food items in Tandiika. She sells mainly cereal items (maize, beans, rice, and wheat). Her business is always affected during the dry season, so she likes to have extra stock before the season starts. Anjela would like a loan of $400 to expand to a larger store and increase her stock supply.

loans.use: To move to a larger store and expand her inventory to accomodate the dry season, when supplies are more scarce

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a 40-year-old, father of four who lives in the Yombo area in Dar es Salaam. He sells green vegetables and fruit, depending on the season, and runs this business in the Kariakoo market--Dar es Salaam's busiest trading area. During the dry season, the business is not always good, and Boniface is planning to open up another business that runs throughout the year. He would like a loan of $400 to help him expand his business to one that is less seasonal.

loans.use: To expand his produce business

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose O. is 29 years old, married with 2 children. She sells rice, beans, and groundnut oil in the market. This business is a source of income to the family. Bose lives in Benin City and has been with LAPO for 4 years. She also has been in this business for 4 years. She hopes to receive a loan of US$ 400 so that she can buy more rice, beans, and groundnut oil for sale and improve her turnover and thus her profit.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans, and groundnut  (peanut) oil for sale in her little shop

loans.name: Cryspian

texts.en: Mr. S. is a 33-year-old resident of Vituka in the Dar Es Salaam area. He has been doing business for the past 3 years and has recently received entrepreneurship training organized by the Youth Self Employment Foundation, which has greatly increased his business skills. Mr. S. owns a grocery store in the Vituka area, but wants to expand it into a larger wholesale store. He is needs a loan of $450 to help him achieve this goal.

loans.use: To expand his grocery business into a larger wholesale store

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 32 year-old resident of the Kinondoni area in Dar es Salaam. David sells used shoes and runs a small shop selling cosmetics. He normally buys his stock from wholesale shops in Kariokoo.

He has been doing business for the past five years. Now, he wants to open up a bigger shop in Kinondoni area to accommodate shoes, clothings and cosmetics.

David is in need of USD 400 to help him expand his business in these ways.

loans.use: To further expand shoe business

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is married with two children. To improve her family's quality of life, she decided to start her own business selling food items. She needs a loan in the amount of US$ 375 to improve the quality of service rendered to her customers. Joy trusts she will be able to repay the loan in 8 months. She thanks you.

loans.use: To more foodstuffs for resale in her little shop

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is a 53 year-old father of six and resides in Makangarawe in Dar es Salaam City. He has been in business for the past 10 years, now operating a charcoal business.

His business has grown tremendously and has acquired many new customers. He is in need of USD 350 so that he can expand his business.

loans.use: To further expand charcoal business

loans.name: Frolah

texts.en: Frolah is a 43 year-old widow with three children and resides in Makarangawe. She has been doing business for the past five years. She runs a shop selling both used and new clothes. She now wants to expand her business and deal with new clothes. She is in need of 350 USD as a start to attain her dream.

loans.use: To expand clothing business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret E. is 33 years old, married with 2 children, and lives in Benin. She owns a little shop in Ugbihoko, and she also sells garri. Recently her little shop has gained more popularity and the number of customers has increased. Margaret now wants to buy hair cream, weavons, and more garri for sale. She is therefore in need of a loan of US$ 175 to purchase these goods. Margaret has 5 years' experience in her business. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more hair cream, weavons, and garri for sale in her little shop

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 36 year-old mother of three and resides in the Vituka area. She has been in the food production and sales business for the past four years.

She runs a shop selling clothes and household utensils in Vituka market. She also sells fruits and vegetables, but this business is seasonal. She is in need of USD 400 to help her expand the business.

loans.use: To expand food business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia lives on Tocopilla Street in the Villa Ungenio neighborhood of Ciudad de El Alto. She has a grocery store at her house, where she sells consumer goods for domestic use. Her husband works as a policeman in the Interior Department. She has three children of 7, 6, and 5 years respectively. The credit she is seeking will be used to invest in her business to buy more merchandise. It will be the third credit she is receiving from IMPRO. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2006 and is qualified for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Patricia vive en la calle Tocopilla, de la zona de Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes en el mismo domicilio, donde vende artículos de consumo domestico. Su esposo trabaja como policía en el interior del Departamento, tiene tres hijos de 7, 6,5 años respectivamente. El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de más mercadería para su negocio. Es el tercer crédito con Impro. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 32 year-old mother of three, resident of Vituka area in the Dar Es Salaam City suburb. She owns a shop selling garments, vitengi and Kanga -- a business she has been running for the past seven years.

She now wishes to expand her stock in preparation for the Christmas season. She is in need of USD 800 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand clothing sales business

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Mrs. Bridget I. is 54 years old, married with 8 children, and lives in Benin City. Being a very enterprising woman, Bridget started her own business selling provisions, drinks, yams and garri. She has been in this business since 1980 and has been a member of LAPO for 7 years.

During these years with LAPO, Bridget has been able to increase the variety of the products she offers. To keep the business growing as it has up to this point, Bridget is requesting a loan of US$ 250, which will enable her buy more of the things she sells and thus increase her turnover and her profit.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
A. is a 29 year-old mother of three, a native resident of the Vituka area. She has done various businesses for the past five years but recently, she has been selling garments and bed sheets. She also sells clothing used in making wedding gowns, kanga and vitengi (traditional attires).

She knows she wants to buy her own tailoring machine and design the gowns. She also wants to open up a shop in any nearby trading center to target additional new customers for the expansion of her business. She is requesting USD 350 for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To expand clothing business

loans.name: Narcizo

texts.es:
Narcizo lives on Carmen Street in the Villa Cooperativa neighborhood in the city of El Alto. He works as a wage-earning driver in the city. His wife works weaving blankets at their house. They live together with their young daughter. The credit will be used to pay for the manual labor for the connection of a sewer system at his house. Even though they live in an urban neighborhood, they cannot expect this basic service. This connection will signify an improvement in the sanitary level at his house.

This is the second credit he is seeking at IMPRO. The first credit was given in 2006 and has repaid the entire loan. He is qualified for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

Narcizo vive en la calle Carmen, de la zona Villa Cooperativa, de La ciudad de El Alto. Trabaja como chofer asalariado en la ciudad, su esposa trabaja tejiendo mantas artesanalmente en su domicilio. Viven junto a su hija menor. El crédito será invertido en la contratación de mano de obra para la conexión de alcantarillado a su domicilio, ya que por ser una zona peri urbana no cuentan aun con este servicio básico. Dicha conexión significa un mejoramiento en el nivel de sanidad con el que debería contar su casa. Es el segundo crédito con Impro. El primer crédito fue concedido el año 2006 y a la fecha está pagado en su totalidad. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Install a sewer system.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 27 year-old up-and-coming businessman in the Kiwaalani area of Dar Es Salaam City. He has been in business for the past fours and operates a grocery in the area.

Now, he wants to expand his small shop into a quite bigger one in order to cater to the increasing number of customers. He is need of USD 250 for the moment to help him start his expansion.

loans.use: To expand grocery store business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Mrs. Gladys O. is 26 years old, married with 2 children, and lives in Benin City. She learnt her hairdressing business for 2 years before she opened her salon in 2001. In order to increase her income, she added the sale of drinks, provisions and recharge cards. Today she has many customers.

Gladys wants to buy more recharge cards, drinks, provisions, hair cream, weavons and hair relaxers for re-sale. For this purpose she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 550.

loans.use: To buy more hair cream, weavons, drinks, provisions and recharge cards for resale

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar lives is Pagador street, in the zone of Villa Ingenio in the town of El Alto. He has a bakery in his own house where he makes bread daily and sells it in the suburb where he lives.

His wife has a grocery shop in the same house. The income received from both business maintains their family, which consists of three children aged 8, 6 and 3 respectively.

This is the second loan with Impro. The completed evaluation has allowed them to authorise the loan.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Edgar vive en la calle Pagador, de la zona de Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto. Tiene una Panadería en el mismo domicilio en donde elabora pan de batalla y lo vende en el barrio donde habita.

Su esposa posee una tienda de abarrotes en el mismo domicilio. Los ingresos percibidos de ambas actividades mantienen a su familia que consta de tres hijos de 8, 6,3 años respectivamente.

El crédito que Edgar solicita servirá para la compra la compra de mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justine is a 32 year-old mother of four living in Makangarawe in the city of Dar Es Salaam. For the past two years, she has owned and run a shop selling fruits and vegetables, and various food items such as maize, rice, wheat and other cereal products.

She now wants to upgrade her shop into a bigger shop in order to increase her income. She is now in need of USD 250, to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To further expand the food business

loans.name: Kambona

texts.en: Kambona U. is a 45-year-old father of two and a resident of the Kiwalani area in Dar es Salaam. He has been in business for the past 10 years and owns a wholesale store in Kiwalani selling soft drinks.  Kambona has just cleared his former loan and now is need of another one to realize his dream of transforming his shop into a warehouse for one of the soft drink companies in Tanzania. Kambona would like a loan of $1,200 to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To transform his successful wholesale store into a larger warehouse store for soft drinks

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es:
Nataly lives on 20th Street in Huayana Potosi zone in the town of El Alto. She has a grocery store located in her own home.

She is single, she has a two-year old son and is also studying in El Alto Public University for a law degree.

The loan she is asking for will be invested in the purchase of stock for her business and thus be able to satisfy her customers’ demands.

This is her second loan with Impro. She has been our client since 2006 and the previous loan has been repaid in the agreed period. The completed evaluation has allowed the grant of the loan.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Nataly vive en la calle 20 de la zona Huayna Potosí de la ciudad de El Alto. Posee una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su propio domicilio.

Ella es soltera, tiene un hijo de dos años y también estudia en la Universidad Publica de El Alto en la carrera de Derecho.

El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así satisfacer la demanda de su clientela.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro. Es nuestro cliente desde el año 2006 y el crédito anterior ha sido cancelado en los plazos estipulados. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is 33 years old, married mother of 4 children, and lives in Benin City. She has 10 years' experience in the production of polythene bags and has been with LAPO for 3 years. She runs this business with her husband. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 to buy chemicals for production.

loans.use: To buy more chemicals for her plastic bag manufacturing

loans.name: Luci

texts.en: Luci E. is a 24-year-old mother of one, with a number of other family dependents. She is a resident of Dar es Salaam and an up-and-coming businesswoman. Luci works indefatigably to look after her family  and currently runs a charcoal business that has been growing steadily. She would like to expand her business to sell other goods and would like a loan of $300 to achieve this goal.

loans.use: To expand her charcoal business and begin selling other goods

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria D. is a 21-year-old resident of Vituka in the Dar es Salaam area. She has a business selling charcoal, which she has been doing for the past 3 years. She also has a kiosk selling soft drinks in addition to her charcoal business. Maria would like a loan of $250 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the stock of her business selling charcoal and soft drinks

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago has a carpentry workshop. He makes wooden doors and windows, which are sold every year during the community festival on July of 16 in the city of El Alto; this activity is his principal source of income that he uses to support his little girl, his wife and himself. He and his family live in the neighborhood of Huayna Potosi in the city of El Alto. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy the raw materials he needs to continue making wooden doors and windows. The articles he makes sell very well. This will be Santiago’s fourth loan through the organization Impro. The first three loans were repaid in full. This shows that Santiago is trustworthy. Please help finance his next loan!

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Santiago tiene su taller de carpintería. Hace puertas y ventanas de madera que son comercializadas en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto; esta actividad es su fuente de ingreso con la que mantiene a su pequeña hija y esposa; vive en la Zona Huayna Potosí de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito requiere para comprar materia prima (madera) para continuar con su producción de puertas y ventanas, artículos que tienen una muy buena aceptación. Es el cuarto crédito con Impro; los tres créditos anteriores fueron concedidos en los años 2004, 2005 y 2006, habiéndose cancelado todos de manera satisfactoria. Los antecedentes anteriores le facultan para aprobarle la solicitud realizada por el prestatario.

loans.use: Purchase wood.

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose O. is 37 years old, married with 3 children. She sells engine oil and kerosene. This business is a source of income for her family. Bose lives in Benin City. She is a LAPO member. She has been in this business since 2001. Bose hopes to receive a loan in the amount of US$ 475 so that she can buy more engine oil and kerosene for sale.

loans.use: To buy more oil and kerosene for re-sale

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha L. is a 44-year-old mother of four and a resident of the Pugu area in Dar es Salaam. She sells charcoal, a business she has been running for 2 years. She obtains her charcoal north of the city, and sells it as both a retailer and a wholeseller. She has recently gained a large store as a customer and needs more capital to expand her stock. Martha would like a loan of $450 to achieve this.

loans.use: To expand her supply of charcoal to meet the growing demands of her customers

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema R. is a 31-year-old mother of three and a resident of Tandiika in Dar es Salaam. She runs a small restaurant and sells used clothes, a business she has been doing for the past 3 years. She wants to expand her restaurant to a full-time operation and will need to buy more chairs and tables, and improve other facilities with time. Neema would like a loan of $250 to help her achieve this goal.

loans.use: To increase her restaurant's hours of operation to full time and upgrade its interior

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is a 20-year-old resident of Lumo in the Buguruni area. He has operated a grocery store for the past 3 years. He sells mainly food items, soft drinks, and other household goods. He needs to buy another refrigerator to preserve the store's fresh-food items and would like a loan of $350 to purchase this essential item.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for his food store

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with two children – a 9-year-old son and a 6-year-old daughter. She lives in Kherson and owns two vending facilities in the central city market where she sells baked goods, sweets and chocolate. Yelena has been in this trade for 8 years. Her turnover capital has doubled since she started her small business.

Yelena has a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. She has fully repaid all of her loans without any delinquencies. Yelena believes that a loan of $1000 will help her increase her working capital and profits as a result. She wants to purchase different varieties of candy to sell, increase the number of products she offers and expand her marketing area. Yelena has become a successful entrepreneur through hard work and dedication which we believe will help her succeed in the future as well.

loans.use: Yelena would like to increase the working capital for her small bakeries.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas works as a salaried chauffeur for a private family: he also works as a waiter. He lives with his younger sixteen-year old brother: their house is located in the Villa Ingenio Zone in the town of El Alto.

The loan is needed to purchase a kiosk which will be use to sell street-food (french-fries, hamburgers and hot dogs). This is a new activity that Nicholas wants to embark on and thus be able to gain independence and begin his own business. Thanks to El Alto’s characteristics, street-food businesses offer good results: given the rising population in El Alto, the town now has close to a million inhabitants.

This is his second loan with Impro: the first loan was arranged in February of this year and has been completely paid back, the last payment being received in September. This prompt payment allowed the approval of this second loan.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Nicolás trabaja como chofer asalariado para una familia particular, también trabaja como garzón, vive con su hermano menor de 16 años; su vivienda esta ubicado en la Zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para la compra de un kiosco que será utilizado para la venta de comida al paso (salchipapas, hamburguesas y hot dogs). Esta es una nueva actividad que Nicolas desea emprender y así poder independizarse y comenzar su propio negocio. Dadas las características de la ciudad de El Alto, los negocios de comida al paso dan buenos resultados debido al ritmo de crecimiento demográfico de El Alto, la ciudad cuenta con casi un millón de habitantes.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro; el primer crédito fue concedido en Febrero de este año y fue pagado en su totalidad siendo su último pago en el mes de Septiembre. El buen comportamiento de pago permite que se apruebe este segundo préstamo.

loans.use: Kiosk purchase

loans.name: Nouriat

texts.en: Nouriat A. is a 32-year-old mother of three and a resident of Lumo in the Dar es Salaam Airport Zone. She owns a saloon in the area, a business she has had for the past 7 years. Ms. A. also owns a poultry farm and keeps both broilers and layers. She would like to expand her farm in order to in time for the Christmas season, when poultry is in high demand. She also wants to add more facilities in her saloon to cater to the increasing number of customers. Nouriat A. would like a loan of $600 to help her achieve these goals.

loans.use: To upgrade the facilities in her pub and expand her poultry farm

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married with a teenage son, Arthur. She lives in Zaporozhye, Ukraine and runs her business in the Malyi Rhinok (Small Market). Alla became an entrepreneur as a result of unfortunate circumstances – she lost her job. Without money or savings she bravely started her small venture selling women’s clothing and footwear. Alla has been in the trade now for 5 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about $3000. Her monthly net profit is about $600.

Alla is planning to use this loan of $900 to open a new vending facility and increase her seasonal stock. She is always ready to venture out and take a chance in order to realize her personal and financial goals. We believe this client has the determination to make her business expand, following her proven route of success and providing supplemental income for her household.

loans.use: Alla would like to open a new vending facility and purchase seasonal inventory for her women's clothing shop.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en: Rajab is a 31-year-old father of three. He runs a multi-faceted business in the Vituka area of Dar Es Salaam. For the past 8 years Rajab has done a little bit of everything. He is a camera man, sells sweet and Irish potatoes and has a restaurant which is open every evening, serving chips, chicken, and eggs. He would like to buy a modern camera and other studio equipments, and set up his own photo studio. Also, Rajab would like to upgrade his restaurant so that it provides services all day long. Rajab is in need of a loan of $450 to expand both of these businesses.

loans.use: To upgrade his restaurant so it can be open all day, and buy photographic equipment for an adjacent photo studio

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is single. She lives in Izyum, Ukraine and owns a retail kiosk in the central market of the town. Tatyana sells a whole variety of hair accessories. She always chooses good quality inventory for her business and doesn’t buy big amounts of different items. Her trendy hair styling accessories attract many women to her stall which keep her sales rates relatively high.

Tatyana has been in this business for 6 years. She doesn’t earn big money but she feels happy because what she makes is enough to provide for all her needs. Moreover, Tatyana enjoys having contact with people which shows in her friendly ways with customers. Tatyana believes that lending services have always helped her business to remain sustainable and growing. At one point she was about to quit and close her business in the market because she didn’t have much needed $50 to cover her business expenses. She was able to get the necessary money, however, and has been able to continue working to develop her business.

loans.use: Tatyana would like to increase the inventory for her kiosk.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en: Celina T. is 35, married, and has three dependents. She has been in the pharmacy business for the past 7 years. Her stock consists of medicine for malaria, flu, all sorts of pains, and other related problems. She buys her medicine directly from the wholesale suppliers and then sells them at retail prices. She always stocks once a week, but sometimes she is forced to stock daily for medicine that is in high demand. Celina employs two people at her pharmacy and one relative always help her monitor critical issues for the business. Celina is hoping to secure a a loan as large as $1,200 to help her increase her working capital and therefore increase her stock supply so that she can compete with similar businesses.

loans.use: To expand the stock of her pharmacy and make her store more competitive

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, just like many other Bolivian women, is a single mother. Her daughter is 7 years old. Julia has a store where she makes dresses and hats for the sun. The hats she makes are commercialized in the department stores of Cochabamba, Santa Cruz, and La Paz. The is her main source of income, with which she cares for her daughter and mother. They live in the Rio Seco zone of El Alto city.

She is requesting a loan so that she can augment the resources necessary for her trade. She will use it to buy raw materials like cloth.

This is her second loan request with the Impro company, which before let her obtain a loan so that she could be able to satisfy the demand for her products in her market.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Julia, como mucha mujeres bolivianas es madre soltera de una hija de 7 años de edad, tiene un taller de costuras y confecciona sombreros para el sol, los mismos que son comercializados en los departamentos de Cochabamba, Santa Cruz y La Paz; esta es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que mantiene a su pequeña hija y madre; vive en la Zona de Rió Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito requiere para incrementar su capital de trabajo (compra de materia prima, tela).

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen antecedente le permite acceder a otro préstamo para que pueda satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Mr. Kenneth O. is 39 years old, married, and has 2 children. He has been selling VCDs and provisions since 2004. This is a business he learnt for 3 years. He is equally a LAPO member. In future he plans to increase the variety of his VCDs and sell wholesale. He will be grateful if a loan in the amount of US$ 400 is given to him to enable him buy more VCDs  and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more video discs & provisions

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is divorced with one daughter. She lives in Zaporozhye, Ukraine and works in one of the local markets selling pet foods and accessories. There are very few other vending kiosks selling the same type of products. Oksana has been in this trade for 7 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about $10000. Her monthly net profit is about $1000.

Oksana is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a third vending facility and expand her business in the market. She is committed to the success of her venture and is willing to learn and work hard to be better at what she does. We think Oksana’s ability to find her niche, put her customers' needs first and take care of them will be instrumental to her businesses' success.

loans.use: Oksana would like to purchase a third vending kiosk selling pet food & accessories.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en: Saidi is a 38-year-old mother of four and a resident of Vituka, in the Dar Es Salaam region. She has been in the grocery business for 5 years and operates a store in the nearby trading center. She has recently started selling ladies used and new clothes as well as operating the grocery.  Saidi wants to transform her grocery into a larger wholesale shop and would like a loan of $500 to achieve her goal.

loans.use: Expand her grocery store into a larger wholesale shop, selling clothing and other goods

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has a grown daughter. She runs a small business selling women’s clothing at one of the city markets in Zaporoshye, Ukraine. Her clothing sales business exhibits good economic characteristics and fundamentals. Irina has a unique talent for identifying new opportunities and determining appropriate growth policies for her business. She has been in this trade for 10 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about $3000. Her monthly net profit is about $600.

Irina would like to get a loan of $1000 to increase her working capital so that she can continue working to improve her business. We believe her natural ability to please her customers by perceiving their needs and offering speedy, courteous service will help Irina achieve her goals, sustain her success and win as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: Irina would like to increase the working capital for her small women's clothing business.

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.en:
Lidiya is divorced with a grown son. She owns a small business in one of the local markets in Zaporozhye where she sells high quality women’s clothing and footwear. Lidiya has been a market entrepreneur for about eight years. Currently, her turnover capital is about $3000. Her net profit is about $600 a month. The keys to Lidiya’s success are her perseverance and diligence.

Lidiya is requesting a loan of $1000 to open a new vending facility in the market and make her business even more profitable as a result. We believe Lidiya’s hard-work and responsibility will help her repay this loan on time and achieve even more success in her trade.

loans.use: Lidiya would like to open a new vending facility and purchase new inventory for her women's clothing and footwear kiosks.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
The client works as a Music teacher in Dons Bosco school in the town of La Paz, and he also gives private classes in guitar.

His house is located in Pasankeri zone on the West side of La Paz cuidad, where he lives together with his mother and younger brothers, for whom he is responsible.

This is the fifth time that he has asked for a loan. His credit history shows him to be an excellent client, who has fulfilled his repayment obligations in good faith. The total asked for will be used to pay for his studies for a Diploma in Education. His work allows him to access this loan as he already has experience as a Music professor, which allows him to earn money to cover the loan.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El cliente trabaja como profesor de música en el colegio Don Bosco de la ciudad de La Paz, y también dicta clases particulares de guitarra.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pasankeri de la ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, donde vive junto a su madre y hermanos menores de quienes es responsable.

Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito Su antecedente crediticio lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago se su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para el pago de estudio de diplomado en el área de la pedagogía. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia de profesor de música, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Education

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn E. is 35 years old. She has 4 children and she has been the secretary of her union in LAPO for 5 years and an active client. She sells provisions, foodstuffs, and drinks to people living in her community and the business gives her joy. Evelyn has been in this business for the past 5 years. She is seeking a loan in the amount of US$ 325 to buy more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She believes she can repay the loan within 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs & drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Miriam Anita

texts.es:
Miriam is a 28 years old young mother. 6 years ago she decided to adapt a space in her home and opened her general store. Presently it is one of the most popular ones in the area as it is located at a estrategic point of the town and it has great demand by the customers because of the politeness and excellence with which they are treated daily. Thanks to the economic income doña Miriam has been able to offer her 2 young children economic stability and welfare. It is her wish to expand her business, not only by selling esssential items but also by offering stationary and in the future adapt a space to be used for selling books. For this reason Miriam asks for $500 to carry out her new project which she is sure will be a success. She plans to return your loan in a period of 6 months. Miriam is awaiting your generous collaboration.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Miriam es una joven madre de 28 años de edad, hace 6 años decidió habilitar un ambiente de su domicilio y abrir su tiendita de abarrotes, actualmente es una de las más concurridas de su zona, puesto que está ubicado en un lugar estratégico de su ciudad, tiene gran demanda de sus clientes por la amabilidad y prestancia con la que los sirve diariamente; gracias al ingreso económico que genera esta bodeguita pudo brindarles estabilidad económica y bienestar a sus 2 niños menores.El deseo que tiene ahora es ampliar su negocio y no sólo vender a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad, sino también ofrecerles materiales de escritorio para más adelante habilitar un espacio para convertirlo en una librería.Por esta razón Miriam solicita 500 dólares, dinero que invertirá en su nuevo proyecto y está segura que dará muy buenos frutos, así mismo se compromete a retornar vuestro aporte en un periodo de 6 meses. Miriam espera por tu generosa colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase stationary to increase sales at general store.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: "Being a LAPO member is not a mistake for me. I have been with LAPO for a year. I hope to improve my business and standard of living of my family through the US$ 250 loan I am requesting," says Mrs. Kehinde O., who is 38 years old, married with 4 children, and lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more garri, plantains, & coco yams

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: "I am happy to be a LAPO client," says Mrs. Rosemary O. who lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks and she has been in this business since 1990. She hopes to buy more provisions and drinks with the requested loan in the amount of US$ 400. Rosemary is 39 years old, married with 7 children.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for re-sale in her little store

loans.name: Amen

texts.en: Amen A. is 32 years old and lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She is married with 5 children and has been a LAPO client for 8 years. She sells oil, bananas, and oranges. She is seeking a loan of US$ 625 to buy more oil, foodstuffs and fruit for sale. She has been in this business since 1994.

loans.use: To buy more oil, foodstuffs, and fruit

loans.name: Modesta Hilda

texts.es:
Doña Modesta is 37 years old, comes from a humble yet very hardworking home. Since she was very young she has been involved in several activities such as street sales, crafts, and domestic service as her husband abandoned her with 2 young daughters. She became father and mother, worked very hard and tirelessly to offer them a better life quality and above all, an adequate education.

Because of her effort and dedication she now owns a small candy factory where she receives the inconditional support of her oldest daughter, Mayda.

Her wish is to purchase a device for preparing waffles and a mill to process her varied candies and in that way implement her small factory, located in her humble and warm home. Doña Modesta is asking for $350 to develop this project. The loan will enable her to purchase her working tools, improve the manufacture, and obtain higher economic benefits for her family.

"With your support and generous heart Modesta and her family may prosper with their business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Modesta tiene 37 años, proviene de un hogar humilde pero muy laborioso, desde muy jovencita se dedicó a diversas actividades como el comercio ambulatorio, la artesanía y como empleada del hogar; desde que su esposo la abandonó dejándola sola sin ningún amparo junto a sus 2 hijas menores; se convirtió en padre y madre para ellas, trabajando ardua e incansablemente para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y sobre todo una educación adecuada. Fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación actualmente cuenta con una pequeña fábrica de dulces, siempre con el apoyo incondicional de su hija mayor Mayda. Su próximo deseo es adquirir una wafflera y un molino para procesar sus variados dulces y así implementar su pequeña fábrica ubicada en su humilde y cálido domicilio para desarrollar este proyecto está solicitando un préstamo de 350 dólares; dinero que le permitirá adquirir sus herramientas de trabajo y así poder desempeñar mejor su labor y obtener mayor beneficio económico para su familia. “Con tu apoyo y tu corazón generoso la familia de Modesta puede prosperar con este negocio”

loans.use: Purchase a device for preparing waffles and a mill to improve candy manufacture

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
"I believe if the loan of US$1,175 is given to me, I will be able to buy more goods for sale. Business is better right now as Christmas is around the corner. The Christmas period is a time people buy more lengths of cloth, shoes, and bags for the celebration. This will help me to improve my family's standard of living," says Mrs. Juliet O. who lives in Benin City.

Juliet is 38 years old, married with 4 children. She is a member of LAPO as a leader of her union and has been in this business since 1995.

loans.use: To buy more lengths of African print cloth, shoes, and bags for resale in her little shop

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia is 24 years old, a mother of a 2 year old boy, entrepreneurial and very home-loving. She lives with Jorge, her husband in a rented room. Jorge had to leave the city in search of a more profitable and secure job and thus be able to offer his family a better life quality. Lidia, on the other hand, decided to sell used clothes in the street from 7:00 a.m to 5:00 p.m, 6 days a week. Doña Lidia´s wish is to get a stand at the "Manco Cápac" market from which she can offer her variety of clothing to more visitors on a daily basis. To make her dream come true, Doña Lidia needs your generous support, and asks for a loan of $500 to invest in her new project. It is her plan to repay the loan in 6 months. "Let us all contribute to make Lidía´s dreams come true as soon as possible."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Lidia tiene 24 años es madre de un niño de 2 años de edad, emprendedora y muy hogareña, actualmente vive junto a su esposo, Jorge, en una habitación alquilada, quién para ver prosperar a su familia tuvo que salir de su ciudad en busca de un trabajo más rentable y seguro y así tener la satisfacción de ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida; por su parte Lidia decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, trabajo que realiza desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:30 de la tarde en forma ambulatoria durante 6 días a la semana.El deseo de Lidia es tener un puesto estable en el mercado “Manco Cápac”, lugar donde podrá ofrecer su gran variedad de prendas de vestir por la cantidad de personas que visitan este lugar diariamente; para hacer realidad sus sueños Lidia recurre a tu ayuda generosa y solicita un préstamo de 500 dólares, dinero que invertirá en su nuevo proyecto y se compromete hacer la devolución del préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses.“contribuyamos para que los sueños de Lidia puedan concretarse lo más pronto posible”

loans.use: Purchase of a stand to sell used clothing at the most popular marketplace of the region

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: "I am always happy when I design clothes for people," says Mrs. Elizabeth Osayewmwer who lives in Benin. Elizabeth is 35 years old, married with 3 children. She is a fashion designer and also sells clothes. She has been in this business since 1992 and in LAPO 5 years as a secretary of her union. She hopes to receive a loan in the amount of US$ 325 to enable her to buy more cloth and tailoring materials.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and tailoring materials

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
Mrs. Stephanie I. is 37 years old and still single. She is one of the active members of LAPO. She sells clothes and also designs clothes for people. She is one of the best in her community and she hopes to improve her business which she started in the year 2002.

Stephanie has been with LAPO for the past 3 years. She believes that with a loan of US$ 550 she can buy more cloth and tailoring materials and increase her earnings from her shop. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and tailoring materials

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia is 39 years old, she is the mother of 4 sons who are still at school and on seeing her household expenses were increasing, she decided to help her husband and ventured into business selling products through campaigns, that is to say the sale of seasonal merchandise according to the market demand that already exists.

Otilia travels to the city of Lima to buy her merchandise wholesale and then sells them on holidays in her town, Juliaca. Thanks to this business she obtains a favourable income that allows her to cover the basic necessities of her family. Her wish for the not too distant future is to hire a shop and to sell electrical goods wholesale. She is conscious that in order to turn her dream into reality she has to work harder and save enough to open the longed-for shop.

For the moment she is asking for a loan of 500 dollars, money which she will invest entirely in her current business “Gift Sales”, which in season responds to huge demand. As a result she has committed to repaying the loan in a period of six months. Otilia sincerely appreciates your help.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Otilia tiene 39 años, es madre de 4 hijos aún en etapa escolar y al ver que los gastos económicos de su hogar se incrementaban, decidió apoyar a su esposo e incursionó en el negocio de venta de productos por campaña, es decir vende mercadería por temporadas de acuerdo a la demanda del mercado que exista.

Otilia viaja a la ciudad de Lima para comprar su mercadería al por mayor y los ofrece en los días de feria de su localidad, Juliaca, gracias a este negocio obtiene ingresos económicos favorables que le permiten cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia..El anhelo que tiene para un futuro no muy lejano es alquilar una tienda y vender artefactos eléctricos al por mayor, es consciente que para hacer realidad este sueño tiene que trabajar más y ahorrar lo suficiente para abrir su tan anhelado espacio de ventas.

Por el momento solicita un préstamo de 500 dólares, dinero que invertirá totalmente en su negocio actual “venta de regalos” que en esta temporada tiene gran demanda y acogida. Así mismo se compromete a realizar la devolución del préstamo en un periodo de 6 meses. “Otilia apreciará sinceramente tu ayuda”

loans.use: Purchase of decorations

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en: Madeline E. is a very active and enterprising woman. She is married and has 5 children, and she sells goats. According to her, this period of Christmas is the period when people buy more goats for celebration. Due to this Madeline is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 800 to enable her buy more live goats to fatten for sale. She has been with LAPO for the past 4 years. She has about 17 years' experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy more livestock (goats) to raise

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Señora Natalia is the mother of two children: she is very hard-working and dedicated. She has a small bakery located insiD. her home, a business she inherited from her dear parents and to which she has devoted herself for more than thirty years together with her husband, Antonio.

As a result of much effort, dedication and above all kindness they have been able to convert their small business into one of the most crowded and their breads into some of the most requested in the town. In order to maintain this level of appreciation and regard, she starts her work at 3 in the morning and finish at five in the evening, together with two other people whom they employ in the bakery. Natalia’s wish is to complete the expansion and renovation of her bakery because up until a few days ago they were working with this in mind, but didn’t count on their lack of budgeted funds.

It is for this reason that she his asking a loan of $350 dollars, money which will allow her to complete the renovation of their important work space. Natalie promises to be punctual in her repayments and to return the loan within six months. With our help Natalia and her family can make their dreams reality.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Natalia es madre D. 2 hijos, muy laboriosa y persistente, cuenta con su pequeña panadería ubicada en su domicilio, oficio que heredó D. sus queridos padres y al que se dedica hace ya más D. 30 años junto a su esposo, Antonio.

A base D. mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y sobre todo amabilidad han podido convertir su pequeño negocio en uno D. los más concurridos y D. sus panes uno D. las más solicitados D. su ciudad..Para continuar con este aprecio y preferencia inician su trabajo a las 3:00 D. la madrugada y la culminan a las 5:00 D. la tarD., junto a otras 2 personas a quienes ofrecen trabajo en su panificadora.El deseo D. Natalia es culminar con la ampliación y mejoramiento D. su panadería porque hasta hace algunos días estuvieron trabajando en ese propósito pero no contaban con su falta D. presupuesto.

Es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo D. 350 dólares, dinero que le permitirá concluir con el arreglo D. su tan apreciado espacio D. trabajo, Natalia promete ser puntual y devolver el préstamo en un lapos D. 6 meses.“Con nuestra ayuda Natalia y su familia pueden hacer realidad sus sueños.”

loans.use: Completion of the installation of a bakery

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana O. is 35 years old, married with a child, and lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells fairly used clothes. She learnt her trade for 8 months before she opened her shop in 2003. She has been a LAPO client for the past 4 years. "I wish to start selling shoes with the loan amount of US$ 550 and also to buy more fairly used clothes for resale," Ana says.

loans.use: To buy more fairly used clothes and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita A. is 35 years old and lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She is a married mother of 3 and equally a LAPO member. Rita says, "I did not learn my trade but it is gift from God. I opened my business in the year 2004." She is seeking a loan in the amount of US$ 550 to buy more provisions, foodstuffs, drinks, and water.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, foodstuffs, drinks & water for sale

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
"I have a business in my house selling groceries, but I would like to expand it to accommodate the merchandise better. I want to build a room soon so that there is more space."

He is seeking $1,200 to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un negocio en mi casa de venta de abarrotes, pero me gustaría ampliarlo para acomodar bien la mercancía, quisiera hacer un cuarto enseguida para que el espacio sea más grande”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para ampliar mi negocio.

loans.use: Expand his business.

loans.name: Delia Patricia

texts.es:
Delia is 43 years old and has 23 years of experience in weaving. She works in the humble home she shares with her husband Cilso. Throught the dint of hard work she has been able to purchase two looms. So far, Delia's work has supported the family but her husband has recently taken a job as a miner. It's hard and dangerous work, especially for a man of his age, and it will take him har from home. Delia continues to weave ponchos and other garments in order to support her family and see that her children can get the education they need to advance professionally, an opportunity she never had. She is asking for a loan of $200 to buy alpaca wool so she can continue to weave. By increasing her production of beautiful woolens Delia hopes to better support her family. She promises to repay the loan in six months.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Doña Delia tiene 43 años de edad y desde hace 23 años se dedica a la artesanía, trabajo que emprendió en su humilde hogar junto a su esposo, Cilso y con qúién a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pudo adquirir dos máquinas de tejer para la fabricación de sus productos. Hasta hace poco con su desempeño diario en esta labor solventaron los gastos que generaba su familia; pero ahora al observar su incremento día a día, su esposo decidió buscar trabajo como obrero en una mina muy lejana de la ciudad en la que radica su querida esposa e hijos, y se ha convertido en un miembro más de este oficio esforzado, duro y muy peligroso para la edad que tiene. Mientras tanto Delia sigue dedicada a su labor elaborando hermosas chompas, pantalones y chullos, con el único objetivo de brindarles una carrera profesional a sus hijos, oportunidad que ella nunca tuvo por sus bajos recursos económicos, es por esa razón que recurre a tu persona y apoyo desinteresado para solicitarte un préstamo de 200 dólares, dinero que invertirá en la compra de más lana de alpaca para seguir elaborando sus hermosos tejidos y así obtener mayor beneficio económico para el sustento de su familia, comprometiéndose a realizar la devolución del préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses. “Con nuestra ayuda Delia podrá darles la oportunidad de seguir una carrera profesional a sus queridos hijos”

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is a very entrepreneurial and intelligent young lady. A couple of years ago she graduated as a teacher, but unfortunately she has not been able to find work due to the lack of opportunities even if she has put all her effort and heart into it. Therefore she decided to reinforce the small workshop that manufactures backpacks, owned by her parents, to make it grow and she has been working tirelessly to fulfill this purpose ever since. Thanks to her effort and perseverance she has been successful and it makes her feel satisfied and proud because she has the opportunity to reward the effort made by her parents to offer her a profession in spite of their low economic resources. Doña Teresa´s dream is to hold a professional job and continue reinforcing and expanding the workshop of her parents. She is asking for $350. The loan will allow her to buy material for the manufacture of backpacks and she promises to be very punctual in repaying the loan.

"Let us support Teresa in her work which brings her a lot of satisfaction".

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Teresa es una joven muy emprendedora e inteligente, hace algunos años terminó su carrera profesional de maestra, pero lamentablemente debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales no logró encontrar trabajo, pese al esfuerzo y empeño que puso; así que decidió fortalecer el pequeño taller de confección de mochilas que sus padres tenían para acrecentarlo y desde ese día Teresa trabajó incansablemente.Gracias a su esfuerzo y perseverancia ha logrado tener éxito en su labor, de la cual se siente muy satisfecha y orgullosa porque tiene la oportunidad de retribuirles a sus padres el esfuerzo que hicieron ellos para brindarle una profesión pese a los bajos recursos económicos que tenían.Los dos deseos más anhelados de Teresa son: desempeñarse en su labor profesional y seguir fortaleciendo y ampliando el taller de confección de mochilas de sus padres, para esto solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares, dinero que le permitirá comprar más materiales para seguir confeccionando tan útiles artículos; así mismo promete ser puntual en el reembolso del préstamo. “Apoyemos a Teresa seguir prosperando con esta labor que le trae mucha satisfacción”

loans.use: Purchase of material to manufacture backpacks, purses, and briefcases

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir Aqayev is a 42-year-old married man who sells fruits and vegetables in the local bazaar in the Imishli region. Nadir has four children and he is very proud that he has four sons.He believes that as soon as they grow up they will help him in his trading. Currently Nadir buys up fruits, vegetables and greens from people in villages near Imishli. Every day he wakes up at five o’clock in the morning. Fruits and vegetables are in very high demand in Azerbaijan and buying them up for a low price from village people and selling them in the central bazaar in Imishli brings  Nadir good income.  He is proud to have a small place in the bazaar. Nadir says that it is very hard to keep up with the expenses of so big a family and sometimes he doesn’t know how to improve the condition of his family. Now Nadir has found a way to make their life better: he has applied for 1200 USD to expand his business and open his own small store where he can increase and diversify the number of products he sells.

loans.use: Going to expand his business and increase and diversify the number of products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Rossen

texts.es:
Doña Rossen is 29 years old. Her mother passed away when she was still very young, but thanks to the good example and values taught her by her father she is successful in her work supported by the strength given to her by her 2 young children.

At the present she is selling watches/clocks from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. at the busy Túpac Amaru market, and thanks to her effort and dedication she has been able to cover the basic needs of her family.

Doña Rossen and her children live with her 2 sisters and her model father who help her take care of the children while she is working. Her business is profitable and she believes she can get better economic benefits if she can increase the merchandise and thus offer a higher life quality to her affectionate family.

She is asking for a loan of $275 so she can invest in buying more watches/clocks and offer more variety and she plans to repay the loan in 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

Rossen tiene 29 años de edad y quedó huérfana de madre cuando aún era muy jovencita, gracias al buen ejemplo y valores que su padre le inculcó está sobresaliendo en su actividad con la fuerza que le emiten sus 2 niños menores. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de relojes en el mercado Túpac Amaru, lugar muy concurrido de su ciudad debido a ello realiza la labor a la que diariamente se dedica de 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación en este trabajo ha podido apaciguar las necesidades básicas de su familia. Rossen y sus niños viven junto a sus 2 hermanas y su ejemplar padre, quienes la apoyan en el cuidado de sus hijos mientras ella trabaja; considera que el trabajo que tiene es rentable y cree que obtendrá mayor beneficio económico aumentando la cantidad de su mercadería y con este ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su afectuosa familia. A raíz de este hecho solicita un préstamo de 275 dólares, dinero que le permitirá invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de relojes y se compromete devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses.

loans.use: Increase stock and buy more variety of watches/clocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Delia Juana

texts.es:
Delia is 22 years old and approximately 3 years ago she decided to start a small restaurant in a rented space located in front of one of the most popular marketplaces in her hometown, Juliaca, and thanks to the delicious dishes she prepares together with her beloved mother and sister, her small restaurant has turned into one the most popular ones in her town and day by day she is getting more regular customers and growing economic benefits for her family. It is this young lady´s wish to implement her business in order to make it more comfortable for her customers, and therefore she is asking for $175 to buy tables and chairs and thus improve the environment where her delicious dishes are served to her demanding customers. It is her commitment to repay the loan in 6 months. "Delia is grateful from the bottom of her heart for your support to continue and implement her business."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

Delia de tiene 22 años y hace aproximadamente 3 decidió abrir su pequeño restaurante en un local alquilado ubicada frente a uno de los mercados más concurridos de su ciudad natal, Juliaca, gracias a los deliciosos potajes que prepara con ayuda de su querida madre y hermana su pequeño restaurante se está convirtiendo en uno de los más concurridos de su localidad, con el que día a día está obteniendo asiduos clientes y mayor beneficio económico para su familia.El deseo de esta joven muchacha es implementar su negocio con la finalidad de brindarles mayor comodidad a sus clientes, para esto esta solicitando un préstamo de 175 dólares, dinero con el que podrá comprar más mesas y sillas para mejorar el ambiente en el que ingieren gustosos diversos platos sus exigentes clientes, así mismo les extiende su compromiso de devolución en un lapso de 6 meses.“Delia agradece de corazón el apoyo que le brindas para continuar e implementar su negocio

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for a restaurant

loans.name: Norma Liliana

texts.es:
Approximately 15 years ago doña Norma decided to start a family with her beloved husband, Beato, and four children were born from this great love, and all of them bring joy to the lives of their parents. With the arrival of each new member the income received by the head of the family was insufficient and did no cover the basic needs of his home, and therefore his wife decided to start her own business selling food in the street, sometimes helped by her inseparable husband and their beloved children. It is Norma´s wish to buy ingredients in large quantities to lower the cost of the preparation of each of the dishes she offers daily in the streets of her hometown. and therefore she is asking for a loan of $275 to fulfill her dream. She plans to repay the loan in 6 months." Norma is awaiting your prompt reply."

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

Norma hace aproximadamente 15 años decidió formar una familia con el que actualmente es su querido esposo, Beato, fruto del gran amor que se tienen nacieron 4 niños, quienes son la mayor alegría de sus vidas. Poco tiempo después al observar que con la llegada de cada uno de sus miembros el ingreso económico que percibía el jefe de familia era insuficiente y no cubrían las necesidades básicas de su hogar, decidió apoyarlo e incursionó en el negocio de venta de comida en forma ambulatoria, en ocasiones con ayuda de su inseparable esposo y sus adorados hijos.El deseo que tiene Norma es comprar víveres al por mayor para disminuir el costo en la preparación de cada uno de los potajes que ofrece a diario por las calles de su ciudad para llevar a cabo este hecho está solicitando un préstamo de 275 dólares, comprometiéndose a hacer la devolución del préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses. “Norma espera tu pronta respuesta”

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of food

loans.name: Akhmadaga

texts.en: Akhmadaga Ahmadov is a 48-year-old trader who sells flour to the local bakers. He lives in the Sabirabad region, which is situated in the southern part of Azerbaijan. Akhmadaga lives with his wife and five children. He has twelve years of experience of selling flour. During these years Akhmadaga enrolled a lot of permanent clients and now he is going to open his small windmill and start making flour himself. He believes that for the money he has  applied for he could build a windmill and become an owner of a big business. He is planning to expand his activity not only in Sabirabad, and surrounding villages, but also in Baku and other big cities of Azerbaijan. He needs 1000 USD to build his own windmill.

loans.use: Going to build his own windmill

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
Mauricia is 55 years old. She is a very hardworking mother who has been able to excel in her community along with her family. More than 20 years ago she decided to open a small grocery in a rented space. Now, grace of a great deal of effort and sacrifice and the help of her 6 children, she has been able to construct a small dwelling in a newer area of the city where she has moved her business and has actually converted the space into the only store in the zone. Because of the telling demand in this area she wants to extend and increase her stock of merchandise in order to satisfy the needs of her new neighbors. For this purpose she is asking for a loan of $275, money which will permit her to meet her objectives. She is promising to repay the loan in a span of six months. "With your help Mauricia will continue to prosper with her business in the company of her family."

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Mauricia tiene 55 años D. edad es una madre muy trabajadora que ha podido sobresalir en su comunidad junto a su familia.Hace más D. 20 años decidió abrir su bodeguita D. abarrotes en un domicilio alquilado, ahora a base D. mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio con el apoyo D. sus 6 hijos ha podido construir su pequeña morada en un pueblo joven D. su ciudad a donD. trasladó su negocio y actualmente se ha convertido en la única tienda D. su zona, debido a la notable demanda que se está generando desea ampliar y aumentar el stock D. su mercadería para así satisfacer las necesidades D. sus nuevos vecinos, para esto solicita un préstamo D. 275 dólares, dinero que le permitirá cumplir con sus objetivos, comprometiéndose a hacer la devolución del préstamo en un lapso D. 6 meses.“Con tu apoyo desinteresado Mauricia podrá seguir prosperando con su negocio en compañía D. su familia”

loans.use: To extend and augment her stock of merchandise to satisfy the basic needs of her new neighbors.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana and Javier started their family with many dreams and yearnings in life to offer the best to their children that they could desire to have. At the present time, this young couple work in the manufacture of coats - work that they learned in the workshop of Javier's mother. Thanks to the effort and dedication that they put forth, they have now mastered their work and have decided to work every day of the week beginning very early in the morning. Their dream is to have their own workshop for coats, in which they hope to process a great quantity of items for export. For this Roxana is asking for a loan of $275 dollars, money which she will invest in the purchase of raw materials for a better completed product. She is promising to reimburse the loan in a period of 6 months. "This young couple needs you, in your hands is the power to help them."

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Roxana y Javier, formaron una familia con muchas ilusiones y anhelos de prosperar en la vida y ofrecerles lo mejor a los hijos que desean tener.Esta joven pareja actualmente se dedica a la confección de buzos, labor que aprendieron en el taller de la madre de Javier, gracias al empeño y dedicación que pusieron actualmente ya perfeccionaron su trabajo y han decidido laborar todos los días de la semana desde muy temprano.El sueño es tener su propio taller de confección de buzos, en donde desean elaborar gran cantidad de prendas para lograr su exportación al exterior, para esto Roxana solicita un préstamo de 275 dólares, dinero que invertirá en la compra de materia prima para la un mejor acabado y confección de las mismas, comprometiéndose a reembolsar el préstamo en un período de 6 meses.“Esta joven pareja te necesita, en tus manos está poder ayudarlos”

loans.use: Purchase of material manufacturing coats

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Life had not prepared Basilia for times of happiness until now. She lost her mother at the age of 6 and since then she had lived in the city with her father, but a few years later destiny showed her no mercy in snatching away the only person that was left to her in the world for companionship. This happening was very hard for her and cost her a great deal to overcome. When she reached 16 years of age she decided to leave her native Moho in search of a better horizon. At the moment she is in the city of Juliaca and works in the manufacture and sale of skirts - work which she came to start in a rented workshop. Her current wish is to possess as soon as possible her own manufacturing workshop, and to succeed in this she is conscious of the strength she has to show daily to save enough money and to undertake the long journey she has ahead of her. At the moment she wishes to increase her stock of raw materials with the aim of stepping up her production and increasing her income and personal wellbeing.
